story:
Some people just sweat more than others.

I’m one of those people.

No matter the season or temperature, I would often find myself having pit stains for no reason.

I've tried every deodorant and antiperspirant  out there (and I have the receipts to prove it). Each of them eventually wore away and just left me with pit stains again.

The only solution that worked was putting napkins and paper towels down my shirt to absorb sweat.

And after a couple of months of doing that I thought to myself...

Why isn’t there a simpler way of doing this?

When you get a cut, you use a band-aid to absorb the blood.  When you work out, you use a sweat band to absorb the sweat.

Why isn’t there a solution to absorb sweat under our arms?

That's why we created Sweat Seal.

 

What about HAIR?!!??!?

I know I know; this is the first question that pops into most peoples' minds. Sweat Seal won't be giving anyone an underarm wax! It’s designed with a specialized adhesive that firmly attaches to skin (even with hair) but removes gently when being pulled off.

We tested this on A LOT of people, so be assured that Sweat Seal is quite comfortable to wear and remove.

 

 

I want you to FULLY be a part of launching this product!

Each perk is designed to both get you an actual set of Sweat Seals and to give you credit for making this product real!

So please pick the perk that suits you, and please share with your friends!

 

 

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello!  My name is Bill Cresse.  I'm a Mechanical Engineer, and I live in Boise, Idaho.  I'm on a mission for people who suffer chronic shoulder pain & post-operative shoulder surgery patients.  600,000 Americans have shoulder surgery each and every year.  40% of Americans have chronic shoulder pain.  

My mission is to end nighttime suffering for people with chronic shoulder pain.  I've had a torn rotator cuff in my left shoulder for over 25 years (never had surgery).  I've dealt with the pain, instability & discomfort at night by using various pillows & sleeping positions.  Fast forward to August 2018...  

I started my own small business (Cresse Product Development) focused on consumer & medical product development.  We've been focused on developing a new product.  It's a sleeping pillow (actually it's a family of shoulder pillow products) that allows people with chronic shoulder pain or post-operative shoulder surgery patients to lay down, recline & sleep more comfortably, with less pain, and without unprescribed shoulder movement.  

We are currently in-process on testing prototype pillows with post-operative shoulder surgery patients.  Here's an image of the sling arm configuration of the shoulder pillow, which was developed specifically for post-operative shoulder surgery patients.  

Here's where you come in...  In order to continue our mission, we need funding.  We need funding in order to --- 

  • Continue fabricating custom prototype pillows for patients willing to test said pillows.  We provide said prototype pillows to said patients at no charge, in exchange for them giving design feedback (good or bad) and critiquing the prototypes.  Our target is 30 user stories for each pillow model.  
  • Perform a market study to validate market size ($140M yearly for post-op patients), and analyze competitors, customers & products.  
  • Recruit talent.  In particular, we need expertise in medical product sales, eCommerce sales & marketing, CAD, process automation, and mass customization.  
  • Create production hard tooling for the first three (3) pillow models, i.e. Sling Arm Configuration, Unaffected-Side Side-Sleeper, and Back Sleeper / Standard.  
  • Continue automating our processes to allow mass customization of our products, as this gives us a substantial competitive advantage.  

 

The deliverables resulting from this funding include --- 

  • 7,000 pillows shipped.  
  • Team on-boarded.  
  • Pillows tooled.  
  • Pillow certification testing (CertiPUR-US).  
  • Distribution setup.  
  • Intellectual property secured (utility patent already pending).  
  • Processes automated.  
  • Mass customization running smoothly from online ordering (eCommerce) & patient measurement (3D laser scan) through CNC foam cutting & automated adhesive dispensing.  

 

Risks and challenges include --- 

FINDING PATIENTS:  Thus far, we have fabricated prototype pillows for 12 patients.  The current average is one (1) new patient per week.  Waiting 18 more weeks to get to 30 user stories would be undesirable. 

SALES EXPERTISE:  We need medical product sales expertise in the Durable Medical Equipment (DME) space. 

TALENT ACQUISITION:  Boise is a small market.  Will we be able to attract the right sales, marketing & eCommerce expertise?  Similarly, will we be able to attract the right CAD, process automation & mass customization engineering expertise? 

FOAM MOLDERS/FABRICATORS:  Funding will solve the problem of foam fabricators & foam molders not being responsive.  $250K in funding will motivate them to be responsive. 

MASS CUSTOMIZATION:  Our target of two (2) minutes from start of patient measurement process to CNC file waiting at CNC foam cutting machine is aggressive.  Our target of four (4) day absolute maximum total lead-time from customer measurement to customer receipt of pillow is aggressive (assumes certain customers pay for expediated shipment of foam components, and final pillow). 

SALES GOAL:  Shipping almost 7,000 units by the end of year one is aggressive.  

In conclusion, please contribute to bring great pillow products to many people who really, really need a good night’s sleep, less shoulder pain & less shoulder discomfort.  And, please remember our mantra:  Less pain, more comfort & better sleep, for sleeping & recovering shoulders.  Finally, please share the link to this campaign page with your friends, family & coworkers.  Don't forget Indiegogo share tools.  Thank you!

story:
Please Help Ian

My nephew Ian. What can I say he is the most amazing child I have ever met with the most amazing sense of humor and always greats you with a smile. He is resilient and strong yet every day he faces pain constant pain.

Ian has what's known as EB (Epidermolysis Bullosa). you may ask "what is that"? Well it is an inherited connective tissue disease causing blisters in the skin and mucosal membranes, Its severity ranges from mild to lethal.

As a result, the skin is extremely fragile. Minor friction or trauma will separate the layers of the skin and form blisters. Often referred to as Butterfly Children due to the fact that their skin is as fragile as the wings of a butterfly. It's much like a severe burn in Ian's case all over his body. Ian lives in severe pain on constant pain medication to try to help keep him comfortable.

A bump or scratch or even moving the wrong way can case the skin blister and break. It's a constant battle, one area of the skin heals and then blisters again or won't heal at all. Scar tissue develops making it even worse restricting the movement of arms and legs and even opening the mouth. It doesn't stop there, blisters also develop internally in the eyes, nose, mouth and throat. For EB kids the risk of infection is high and can be fatal. Regular bandage changes are required and are nothing short of horrible and extremely painful.

In short it is a horrific disease, extremely painful and debilitating. Ian was born with RDEB which is considered to be a severe strain of this disease. Ian is bandaged from head to toe  with blistering and open wounds over most of his body. Ian is unable to walk and is confined to a wheel
chair. Ian can not sit up on his own or dress himself and requires constant care. When born Ian was not given much chance of survival and wasn't expected
to still be with us today. It is a shear miracle Ian is still with us today and has reached the age of 14.

87% of children born with one of the more sever forms of EB like Ian's do not live more then 12 months.

Ian enjoys arts and crafts, likes painting and drawing and watching the Food Network on TV. He enjoys spending time with his Brothers and Sister and his little kitten. Ian dreams of being a Firefighter when he grows up. He collects firefighting memorabilia and just loves all things do do with firefighting. He has an amazing attitude for a child who is in so much pain. With all the procedures he has to endure Ian still
manages to retain his sense of humor and I don't know how.

Ian had the chance of a life time a few weeks ago to travel to Ohio to the Cincinnati Children's Hospital EB Clinic. The reason for his visit was to tackle the issue of how Ian will be able to eat.

Ian has a feeding tube in his nose which provides him with vital nutrition. However in order to continue to insert a feeding tube every few months Ian has to undergo the procedure of having his esophagus dilated. This is alway a risky procedure as the esophagus is very thin and fragile to start with. Ian has had this procedure so many times it is no longer safe to continue to insert this tube. Without it Ian would be unable to eat and unable to survive. High amounts of nutrition are required to help the body heal the skin and fight infection.

His trip to Cincinnati was to hopefully find another way for Ian to be given food. In the past other methods had been tried and failed due to the deterioration of his skin.

Ian's visit was a huge success in one way as the doctors will in the coming weeks be able to dilate his esophagus and remove the tube from his nose. However he will have to under go a surgical procedure to insert a Mickey Button in his belly. At the same time Ian will have to have a total of 10 teeth removed, children with EB often have huge issues with teeth.

If that is not enough during his visit to Cincinnati it was discovered that his spleen and liver were enlarged and after further investigation they found 2 tumors one on each adrenal gland. Just when you think it can't get any worse for him, he will now have to have a biopsy to find out what they are before he can have his tube removed, his Mickey button inserted and his teeth pulled.

The cost alone of the trips to and from Cincinnati for long periods of time is to much for my sister to endure. Ian being confined to a wheel chair making travel all together difficult. By car it is an 8 hour drive from Pennsylvania to Ohio.

Ian and my sister will have to travel alone to Ohio and stay for long periods of time. Ian has always had trouble in recovering for any procedure and gets very sick after words during this recovery time Ian will not be able to travel home until he is 100%, again making the stays very long.

Ian's brothers and sister have to continue with school and my sisters husband has to continue work to keep the roof over their head and it is going to be impossible for them to manage all this without help. A one income family who is struggling to survive as it is can not possible manage this and that's why we need your help.

Our aim is to raise as much as we can to help cover the costs for Ian's trips to Cincinnati Ohio over the next year.

Any future medical care for Ian will be address in Cincinnati as they have the specialist with the experience needed to treat Ian. The local hospital where Ian has been treated feels that Ian's medical needs have become to specialized for them to continue to handle. So Ian will now be faced with traveling to Cincinnati for just about everything.

We just can't afford to cover the trips to Ohio alone we need to raise as much as we can in a short period of time to help get Ian to Cincinnati. Now that they have discovered the tumors on Ian's adrenal glads he will need to travel soon.

The cost of travel, food, accommodation for extended stays will mount quickly and Ian really need your help.

If you could find in your heart to help Ian it would mean the world to Ian and his family. Any donation no matter how small can help. If you would like to offer any assistance at all in any way please email at helpian@hotmail.com.

We will be posting regular updates on Ian's Facebook Page, Twitter Page & Blog.

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ian.swarr.37 please follow Ian's Story.

You can visit Ian's web page: www.helpian.weebly.com

Follow Ian on Twitter: https://twitter.com/HelpIan1

Please follow Ian's Blog Online

 Thank You For Taking The Time To Read About Ian

Ian's Aunt Jessica

 

Update Oct 6th 2012 : Ian will be admited to Cincinnati Childrens Hospital on Tuesday. Please keep him in your thoughts! More Updates will be posted here if you would like to check back!
 
Update Oct 7th 2012: Ian was feeling sleepy today but in good spirits! He wants to be sure to get his Halloween costume before he goes to Cincinnati on Tuesday. He had a chance to see his Facebook page for the first time and wanted to say to everyone "Hello Hi I am Here and I am on Facebook!!

Update October 12th 2012:Ian was not put under today, he was very happy with that but it meant he had terrible anxiety.We are waiting for his MIBG scan results they will tell us if this may be neroplastoma (cancer) They will be doing a biopsy next week that will be an open surgery not a small needle incision. His liver is hardening and is not full of iron. Mondays MRI was looking at vessel function his blood flow has small changes but over all is normal. next week during the surgery they will also biopsy the tumors on the adrenal gland. the are pretty sure it's the liver causing the fluid build up but they do not know why yet.

Update Oct 13th 2012:Ian's Grandma arrives today for a weekend visit Ian is very excited. Today Ian will have a full dressing change and a ultra sound of the heart. Delicia is feeling better today she got to have a hot shower.

UPDATE Oct 13th 2012 Grandma arrived to see Ian and Noah Ian's Brother came along for the trip! Ian had his scan of the heart today and a full dressing change. He said after the dressing change he felt much better. Dr.Lucky allowed Ian to go outside today and get some fresh air. Having Noah to hang out with for Ian was very nice. We have added an update page to Ian's web site. www.helpian.weebly.com  you can also visit to see the latest pictures. I think it was nice to get out and have a day that was not full of doctors poking at him.

Update 14th Oct 2012:: Ian belly and other areas are much larger today. This mean he is retaining more fluid his urine out put is low. They are doing a blader scan now. His day started off well and he had a sleep in but it seems as of now he is retaing the fluid and more then they like. Please keep him in your thoughts and prayers. We are very concerned. Grandma and Noah will be staying on over night so Delicia can rest for a bit. They are looking at possiable putting a cathader in now as the swelling is not allowing him to go to the bathroom. Please prayers> I am adding this as Delicia is on the phone with me now. Ian's condition is not improving.

Update 15th Oct 2012: they were not able to do Ian's MRI today because his Picc line is not working. They also did not have an EMT team on standby so they will reschedule. Ian was very happy about this. Today Ian received some mail with 2 packages and some cards he was over the moon. I myself was on the phone when they were opened and it was amazing to hear his excitement for sure.

Update 15th Oct 2012:  Ian's Picc line has been fixed it was not workingdue to this they had to hold off on the MRI today. They also wanted a EMT team on standby and they were not available. The issue with the swelling in the lower belly and groin the doctors believe because Ian was sitting up the fluid had moved down while he was up. That caused pushing on the bladder. This morning that improved and they will not have to put in a cathater at this stage. To much relief of everyone. Ian is passing fluid now. The out put is low but he is doing that on his own. I am trying my best to keep everyone up to date it is very hard as things move so fast one minute its one thing and the next its another. Ian is realy missing his family at home at the moment. His spirits were lifted today when Ian recieved some packages in the mail and some cards. One package included an IPad he was so excited he let out a scream. I was on the phone with him when he recieved it wow he was so Happy!! Easton's dad came over to Ian's room to help Ian set it up. While he was with him they had fixed the Picc line Ian now believes Easton's Dad is his good luck charm!! It was so sweet> Grandma and Noah are staying another night to help out. Ian also recieved a beautiful card today from and little girl and her Mom it was so amazing she sent Ian her hand print a a dollar from her piggy bank to help Ian. Ian and delicia were very touched that is just so wonderful. Thank you all who sent packages and cards and thatnk you all who also helped out with meals. It is a huge help when doctors are coming in and out all the time. Please hang in there I know much like us you are all waiting to find out what is going on with Ian's liver. so to are we this is a long process of getting tests done and back we to very much want answers the doctors are doing all they can for Ian and he is in the best hand. This is very hard on Ian and Delicia, they are missing Emma and Braden Pop Pop and Daddy to and home, the family pets you name it. We do not know how long Ian will be at CCH but by the day the stay is getting longer and longer so we need your support now more then ever.

 

Update 16th Oct 1012: Ian and Delicia are turning in early tonight. Ian is very tired today. He had the chance to go to the play room for a bit but he is iteritated and realy just wants to be left alone at the moment so they decided to go to bed early. The doctors are awaiting test results and scheduling the MRI for maybe the end of the week. They must plan carefully at the moment to ensure the can put Ian under. I am sorry I dont have any more information to share at the moment but we just have not gotten to the bottom of what is going on yet. Ian is on medication to reduce the fluid build up and that is a slow process. When they schedule surgery they hope to take a sample of the fuid to help understand what it is. Again the stay is becoming longer and longer and it is putting lots of presssure on the family financialy as well as emotionaly. Ian is missing his brothers and sister and his Poppop and Daddy to. I know Delicia is very concerned about how they will manage all of this in weeks to come and I know the stress is not helping at the moment please keep them in you thoughts tonight.

Update 17th Oct 2012: Ian had his PET scan today. He recieved a package from the Wrightsville Fire & Rescue and was so excited! His school teacher from home called today to line up with the teacher at CCH to help continue with Ian's schooling. He will meet the Cincinnati Childrens Hospital School Teacher tomorrow. Ian is having a lot of pain when having to sit up due to the fluid and it is a real challange for him.They are also helping Ian learn how to deal with anxiety duing bandage changes and tests which is a big help the therpist at CCH is working with him. Ian has gained a pound and a half but at this stage we are unsure if thats good or bad and unsure if thats fluid weight. Hopeing to know more soon as test results come back. Again his stay is getting longer and longer and we need as much help as we can get at the moment if you can donate even a dollar it would be a big help.

A post from Delica I wanted to share tonight.

 

I'm still up sitting in the dark eatting a bag of chips and sipping in a juice box. A new medicine they put Ian on has made his belly sick! I hope he rests comfortably. I sit and stare at my baby boy sleeping thinking oh dear lord what is in store for us. How much more can his very frail body take? I keep fighting but really how long can Ian fight? He is so strong but, really all he goes through how long until he has had enough? Until his body just stops and says no more? How long will we be here weeks months a year? Will Ian ever see home again? It's reality that I'm thinking! I want him healed out of pain smiling! I need thoughts and prayer as these rough times are apon me! I reach for hope keep my faith and just believe that god above will guide me! I have been blessed with a special fighter that has captured hearts of so many. Please continue to share his story and his pain. Educate people on the suffering of these children and their parents. Devistation is in my life and why is it fair that Ian suffers? My heart hurts beyond belief! Butterfly kisses blown over the bed to land softly on his fragile forehead. Rest peaceful my love. Mommy is watching! — with Ian Swarr at Cincinnati Children Hospital.

Oct 18th 2012 Ian's pain is associated with his tail bone. He has a lot of pain in that area. EB children are prone to fractures in the bones. They will do an x ray some time soon to check it out. Ian has some fractures as it is now in his back again common in EB children. the change in weather also seems to contribute to
his soreness and it has just gotten quite cold in Ohio. His stomach is upset due to medication and he is just feeling bad today. Hope tomorrow is better for him. He recieved a package today from the Noosa Fire Company in Noosa Australia and a
package from a lovley lady named Carol, who sent a portable DVD and some movies for Ian. He was very excited!! Thank you all for showing support for Ian. Keep the e cards and the mail coming he so enjoys it! If you can donate please do
every little bit helps!!

Oct 19th 2012

keep the cards coming. Ian loves getting mail. if you have children who would ike to draw him a picture he love that sort of thing!! Ian is not feeling well and depression is starting as he will be away from home so long. Hoping the family visit this weekend will help. They have set a tentative date for surgery for next Thursday and it will be weeks following that maybe even longer that he will be at CCH. Please keep the donations coming they really need the support. He slept most of the day he is still feeling unwell. The GI doctors will visit soon to see what we can do about the medication that is making him unwell.Keep
the thoughts and prayers flowing to he needs them.

Update oct 20th 2012: Ian was so happy to see the family today. he is tired and sleeping now Delicia and Troy and the kids will spend the night tonight in a hotel together for some much needed one on one time. Grandma and Popop will stay with
Ian tonight. It's been a long day for them all with the drive and I think they all need some rest. I have had over whelming support today from across the world and please know that we are just so touched by every one of you! Ian's power chair is now with him at CCH his grandparents delivered that today as well. He
was so happy to have it again as it is his legs!! Lots of love to Easton's Family tonight I thank you guys so much for sharing Ian's story with so many people. Having the family with him this weekend should help so much to lift his spirts for the week ahead it will be a long and hard week with tenative surgery
scheduled for Thursday. We still do not know what is happening with his liver and we hope to have more answers at the end of the week again keep the suport coming please Ian's stay is going to be a long one and we need all the support
we can get. Big Thank You To Everyone!

Update Oct 21st 2012

Ian had a good time having his family with him. They will be leaving tomorrow afternoon for home. Its been good for Delicia to spend time with her children. Today they went to the zoo. I was upset he could not go but he did not want to get out of bed anyway. His Amonia levels have come down and thats good news. He is stil scheduled for surgery on Thursday so any good news in the lead up  to that it amazing for sure. Grandma and Poppop have been able to give Delicia some time off so thats a good thing. She needs to be with the other kids and her husband Troy they need some time to all catch up. Please keep Ian in your thoughts and prayers this week in the lead up to surgery we are al very concerned as this is going to be hard on him. Its hard for him to recover so send lots of love his way please!

UPDATE OCT 22nd 2012

The family has now left to go back home. Ian was in good spirits today and even ordered himself something to eat. He was sad to see everyone go. They have confirmed they will go ahead with surgery on Thursday and Ian will have the next few days to rest up for the surgery. His ammonia levels are back up again today however they did say it will go up and down.

 

Update 23rd Oct 2012: Ian is having a good day! He is getting ready to get a albumin infusion (protein). He is just going with the flow. His skin looks really good! His ammonia level is better than it has been since we arrived! He gets his biopsy surgery Thursday early morning. As that nears I'm getting anxious just knowing how tight his airway is! We will be in icu at least one night to watch bleeding and vitals closely! His iPad has been keeping him busy! The cord isn't long enough to the outlet and it keeps dying and he doesn't let it charge long enough! I got to meet another eb family today! And have made some friends
with other moms that have children here! It's such a depressing place! I talked with a mother who lost her son this morning to cancer! Please just keep all suffering children close to your heart! There is no reason for children to suffer!

We have 13 days left on the Indiegogo campaigne and we have not reached our goal yet. Please visit his page and give a donation if you can even if its only a dollar every little bit counts. We will launch another campaign to follow and hope to raise even more for Ian. Please also visit the take them a meals page and sign up days will be added soon!! Thursday is the big day for surgery so please keep the love coming for Ian and pray for a good outcome. Again I want to thank you all so much for the support!!

Oct 24th 2012

My update tonight comes fro Delicia


Surgery
tomorrow... Sigh... I'm doing ok Ian has a lot of anxiety. Please pray for him and keep him in your thought Surgery will at least be 5 hours,then off to the PICU. I'm not going to sleep a wink I know it! Today was long dressings took forever because of interruptions. I'm wore out! Going out and talking with other
parents has been great! There is a family here on our floor with EB I have introduced myself but haven't had time to talk! I hope to before they leave! Thank you all for the mail  it has helped Ian greatly today! I'm going to try and hang his cards tomorrow it just keeps getting pushed off! Remember Ian tomorrow as you go about your day! Keep him lifted with happy thoughts as he keeps up his fight! Thank you everyone that has prayed sent well wishes food and smiles our way it becomes over whelmingIan is putting together a Halloween house he received in the mail. We are trying to keep him occupied! I'm shaking but staying strong I'm basically rambling! I hate seeing my son suffer I can't fix his skin and now all of this! Gnite my friends!

I my self am on edge I am worried and scared and i wish I was with them now!! May Ian be safe and sound tomorrow and may all go well I Love You so much and I miss you!! Aunt Jess

 

Ok so 3 really good biopsies of the liver, 2 from adrenal glands one that which bleed slot but they got it stopped. They have already gotten over 3 liters of fluid from him abdomin. The drai age tube will stay in for at least 24 hours! The did 3 punch biopsies! I went in OR to redress him. Lots of new blisters and his mouth to shredded!

We are in PICU he is very sleepy I'm going to eat and lay down with him! He says no pain! I had them give him something so he wouldn't
be also zofran as a precaution! Thank you for your prayers by no means are we out of the water we just got in I hope for no bleeding and answers to know what our next step is!

Ran back to our other room to get blankets and bumped into baby Liam and his family I will catch up with them hopefully tomorrow if not later tonight

Update 26th Oct

So today we are up to 5 liters of fluid that have drained from the drainage tube. The fluid keeps coming as the liver is not working well. We still do not have any results yet but we hope to soon at least something. They will look to remove the tube so and put it back in. They can not leave it in because of the risk of infection. and can not move because the drain is just siting in there they can'...

t stitch the drain in because of his skin so he is on his back. Being on his back is not a normal position for Ian so he is uncomfortable. We can't do any bandage changes as we can't move so that makes him feel a bit icky. Delicia will change the ones on his legs tonight and that should help a bit. He is not saying much and is not wAnting to eat or drink by mouth because the throat and mouth hurt but that's ok as he is being fed via his feeding tube and is receiving fluids by iv. He is tired to so hoping he rests. He is watching tv. They are working there way thought the packages and cards!! Ian was just over the moon when the mail guy rolled the cart in with the mail. He could not believe it. I will have pictures soon as the day goes on. Delicia is hanging all the cards on wall.She keeps running out of tape there are so many!! They will also be decorating for Halloween tonight as one of the packages received had decorations for him. That will be nice. Delicia told him today after Halloween they can decorate for Christmas and Ian said I won't be here for Christmas and then he said but it feels like Christmas!! So after Halloween they will decorate for Christmas!

 Oct 27th 2012

At this point they have a theory and only a theory. They felt maybe it could be autoimmune there are several types of this. It means the body could be attacking the liver causing damage to the live. This if so is something they can not stop. They have the ability to slow the process however the liver will continue to leak fluid. The live is damaged however the liver enzymes are showing fine. This is confusing for sure. They have many test results that are not back as EB is a very complex thing they will consult on an international level on all results. This is something that CCH has not seen in an EB patient and it could be the case that a doctor somewhere else has.

It may be the case this is a first again EB is complex at best. They do not know that this is directly related to EB. It could be contributing but again many unanswered questions. We hope to know more Tuesday about the tumors on the adrenal glands
but the liver will take much long to determine what is really going on. If in fact it is autoimmune the body would continue to destroy the liver and they could only slow the process down in saying that things like liver transplants are not much of an option for Ian and probably would not even be a possibility.

I don't even know that there has ever been a transplant on an RDEB patient. That is just getting to far ahead at this stage. What we have to remember is we are only entertaining a theory at this stage we need more results and more answers before anything can really be determined. One thing we do know is the liver continues to leak fluid for some reason and they must look to solve this issue first and in turn they must work out exactly what is going on inside until then we are still no further ahead.

Oct 28th 2012

Ian is feeling good today a bit lazy. Ian's Grandma has now joined us on Facebook woo hoo!! I cant wait to see what comes in the mail for him tomorrow!! We are all just waiting for more results.

Update Oct 29th 2012


At this point we are still going with liver disease! An auto immune disorder of the liver! There  is inflammation and scarring in the veins that drain the liver. nothing with spleen kidneys skin or liver looks like cancer tests and markers on pathology are not clear. They plan to do an MRI this week, And discuss plan of action! Enzymes are good! Protein was ok today and we are giving vitamin K! So nothing new just wanted to update! We will probably treat with steroids  but again no clue exactly what's going on at this point!

Ian was in a great mood this afternoon he has been on a mental down slide for about an hour he is crying and just wants to be home. With his brothers and sister! Nothing I do or say makes him feel betting! He had visitors that brought him a milk shake and that didn't even help! I'm going to see if he can have something to calm him! It's breaking my heart. I finally went out earlier to get comfy shoes thanks to Amy!

Update Oct 30th 2012
Awesome cards art work and gifts today, thank you everyone ! Did a dressing change and overall Ian looks great! The Medihoney has been a blessing now that I have figured out how to go about using it we will always have it on board! He had his 5th albumin infusion today! I can certainly
tell the fluid is building  again but he said he feels good! These nurses sure get a kick out of him! He is a little pistol! Many have commented on the differences over the time we have spent here! With how he looks his color and humor!

We both miss home so much he tells the nurses about daddy and his brothers sister and his animals some of these girls are from the city and think it's hilarious that we have chickens! They even asked if we take them inside when it storms! Lol! We are going to bed I hope to do more laundry tomorrow and find our hospital room there are boxes bags cards dressing supplies and candy everywhere! Gnite

 Update Oct 31st 2012 Halloween Update from Delicia
Good morning and Happy Halloween , I tossed and turned all night, he was pretty noisy while sleeping he is still asleep, he will get up soon and get his torso changed. I will get a pic with him and his nurse today! Beth is a vintage nurse today she is terribly cute as always!

Ian has realized we won't be hone for his brothers and sisters bdays! He cried its been kinda a rough afternoon I think we might eat watch a movie and veg! I try and stay so strong and bit cry in front if him it has not been easy!

We will defiantly need to have Joanne and Jared come up more often (danielle was on Paci duty) Ian is so pleasant now! Thank you! We enjoy your family so much! Joanne you were so right when you said Easton and Ian are tied together for life! Our families will forever be together!

Update Aunt Jess
Both Ian and Delicia are having a hard time at the moment being away from home and the family is very hard. Each day gets harder and harder. Its also very hard on the family at home to. We hope to make the next few weekends as special as we can with family to visit. Please eep the thoughts and prayers flowing during the hard times.It is a huge financial strain as well and that alone makes it even harder. Your suport is needed during this time please visit Ian's Fundraising page and help out if you can it would mean the world to all of us!


Update November 1st 2012
Ian had a good day today for the most part. The Picc line was not working again and they were working hard to fix it. Ian got lots of mail today and a Furbie!! He was thrilled. Still no word on test results at this satge. He could not go to be untill he had some coco pops! Delicia had to go down and see if she could find some she returned moments later with coco crisps, will have to do!

 Update November 2nd 2012

Update: they believe Ian may have Fibrosis of the liver. Tuesday Delicia will have a meeting with the entire team to discuss further. Next week they will look to do an MRI and MRV at this point in time that's all the information we have in. In the coming weeks I am sure they will be discussing treatment and how we will reduce the fluid retention. At this time they are very unsure of what is going ...

on. it is very frustrating.Ian is now on morphine to manage the pain he is having. His pain has been increasing because he has become very accustomed to the medication on which he has been on so it is proving to be no longer effective for him. he has a very bad wound on his belly that is really irritating him at the moment. This weekend Ian will be very surprised to have 2 of his home nurses visit with him and his Daddy. The only good news I have to share today is that Ian will be given 4 hours to leave the hospital during that time he will be visiting the zoo!! Woo Hoo escape from hospital even if its only for a few hours it will do him a world of good!! I will update as the days go on as we learn more please keep the prayers coming for Ian as his stay becomes longer and longer at CCH.
story_txt:
Please Help IanMy nephew Ian. What can I say he is the most amazing child I have ever met with the most amazing sense of humor and always greats you with a smile. He is resilient and strong yet every day he faces pain constant pain.Ian has what's known as EB (Epidermolysis Bullosa). you may ask "what is that"? Well it is an inherited connective tissue disease causing blisters in the skin and mucosal membranes, Its severity ranges from mild to lethal.As a result, the skin is extremely fragile. Minor friction or trauma will separate the layers of the skin and form blisters. Often referred to as Butterfly Children due to the fact that their skin is as fragile as the wings of a butterfly. It's much like a severe burn in Ian's case all over his body. Ian lives in severe pain on constant pain medication to try to help keep him comfortable.  A bump or scratch or even moving the wrong way can case the skin blister and break. It's a constant battle, one area of the skin heals and then blisters again or won't heal at all. Scar tissue develops making it even worse restricting the movement of arms and legs and even opening the mouth. It doesn't stop there, blisters also develop internally in the eyes, nose, mouth and throat. For EB kids the risk of infection is high and can be fatal. Regular bandage changes are required and are nothing short of horrible and extremely painful.In short it is a horrific disease, extremely painful and debilitating. Ian was born with RDEB which is considered to be a severe strain of this disease. Ian is bandaged from head to toe  with blistering and open wounds over most of his body. Ian is unable to walk and is confined to a wheel  chair. Ian can not sit up on his own or dress himself and requires constant care. When born Ian was not given much chance of survival and wasn't expectedto still be with us today. It is a shear miracle Ian is still with us today and has reached the age of 14.87% of children born with one of the more sever forms of EB like Ian's do not live more then 12 months.  Ian enjoys arts and crafts, likes painting and drawing and watching the Food Network on TV. He enjoys spending time with his Brothers and Sister and his little kitten. Ian dreams of being a Firefighter when he grows up. He collects firefighting memorabilia and just loves all things do do with firefighting. He has an amazing attitude for a child who is in so much pain. With all the procedures he has to endure Ian still  manages to retain his sense of humor and I don't know how.Ian had the chance of a life time a few weeks ago to travel to Ohio to the Cincinnati Children's Hospital EB Clinic. The reason for his visit was to tackle the issue of how Ian will be able to eat.  Ian has a feeding tube in his nose which provides him with vital nutrition. However in order to continue to insert a feeding tube every few months Ian has to undergo the procedure of having his esophagus dilated. This is alway a risky procedure as the esophagus is very thin and fragile to start with. Ian has had this procedure so many times it is no longer safe to continue to insert this tube. Without it Ian would be unable to eat and unable to survive. High amounts of nutrition are required to help the body heal the skin and fight infection.His trip to Cincinnati was to hopefully find another way for Ian to be given food. In the past other methods had been tried and failed due to the deterioration of his skin.  Ian's visit was a huge success in one way as the doctors will in the coming weeks be able to dilate his esophagus and remove the tube from his nose. However he will have to under go a surgical procedure to insert a Mickey Button in his belly. At the same time Ian will have to have a total of 10 teeth removed, children with EB often have huge issues with teeth.If that is not enough during his visit to Cincinnati it was discovered that his spleen and liver were enlarged and after further investigation they found 2 tumors one on each adrenal gland. Just when you think it can't get any worse for him, he will now have to have a biopsy to find out what they are before he can have his tube removed, his Mickey button inserted and his teeth pulled.The cost alone of the trips to and from Cincinnati for long periods of time is to much for my sister to endure. Ian being confined to a wheel chair making travel all together difficult. By car it is an 8 hour drive from Pennsylvania to Ohio.  Ian and my sister will have to travel alone to Ohio and stay for long periods of time. Ian has always had trouble in recovering for any procedure and gets very sick after words during this recovery time Ian will not be able to travel home until he is 100%, again making the stays very long.  Ian's brothers and sister have to continue with school and my sisters husband has to continue work to keep the roof over their head and it is going to be impossible for them to manage all this without help. A one income family who is struggling to survive as it is can not possible manage this and that's why we need your help.Our aim is to raise as much as we can to help cover the costs for Ian's trips to Cincinnati Ohio over the next year.Any future medical care for Ian will be address in Cincinnati as they have the specialist with the experience needed to treat Ian. The local hospital where Ian has been treated feels that Ian's medical needs have become to specialized for them to continue to handle. So Ian will now be faced with traveling to Cincinnati for just about everything.We just can't afford to cover the trips to Ohio alone we need to raise as much as we can in a short period of time to help get Ian to Cincinnati. Now that they have discovered the tumors on Ian's adrenal glads he will need to travel soon.The cost of travel, food, accommodation for extended stays will mount quickly and Ian really need your help.If you could find in your heart to help Ian it would mean the world to Ian and his family. Any donation no matter how small can help. If you would like to offer any assistance at all in any way please email at helpian@hotmail.com.We will be posting regular updates on Ian's Facebook Page, Twitter Page & Blog.Facebook: www.facebook.com/ian.swarr.37 please follow Ian's Story.  You can visit Ian's web page: www.helpian.weebly.comFollow Ian on Twitter: https://twitter.com/HelpIan1Please follow Ian's Blog Online

 Thank You For Taking The Time To Read About IanIan's Aunt Jessica

 
Update Oct 6th 2012 : Ian will be admited to Cincinnati Childrens Hospital on Tuesday. Please keep him in your thoughts! More Updates will be posted here if you would like to check back! Update Oct 7th 2012: Ian was feeling sleepy today but in good spirits! He wants to be sure to get his Halloween costume before he goes to Cincinnati on Tuesday. He had a chance to see his Facebook page for the first time and wanted to say to everyone "Hello Hi I am Here and I am on Facebook!!
Update October 12th 2012:Ian was not put under today, he was very happy with that but it meant he had terrible anxiety.We are waiting for his MIBG scan results they will tell us if this may be neroplastoma (cancer) They will be doing a biopsy next week that will be an open surgery not a small needle incision. His liver is hardening and is not full of iron. Mondays MRI was looking at vessel function his blood flow has small changes but over all is normal. next week during the surgery they will also biopsy the tumors on the adrenal gland. the are pretty sure it's the liver causing the fluid build up but they do not know why yet.
Update Oct 13th 2012:Ian's Grandma arrives today for a weekend visit Ian is very excited. Today Ian will have a full dressing change and a ultra sound of the heart. Delicia is feeling better today she got to have a hot shower.
UPDATE Oct 13th 2012 Grandma arrived to see Ian and Noah Ian's Brother came along for the trip! Ian had his scan of the heart today and a full dressing change. He said after the dressing change he felt much better. Dr.Lucky allowed Ian to go outside today and get some fresh air. Having Noah to hang out with for Ian was very nice. We have added an update page to Ian's web site. www.helpian.weebly.com  you can also visit to see the latest pictures. I think it was nice to get out and have a day that was not full of doctors poking at him.

Update 14th Oct 2012:: Ian belly and other areas are much larger today. This mean he is retaining more fluid his urine out put is low. They are doing a blader scan now. His day started off well and he had a sleep in but it seems as of now he is retaing the fluid and more then they like. Please keep him in your thoughts and prayers. We are very concerned. Grandma and Noah will be staying on over night so Delicia can rest for a bit. They are looking at possiable putting a cathader in now as the swelling is not allowing him to go to the bathroom. Please prayers> I am adding this as Delicia is on the phone with me now. Ian's condition is not improving.


Update 15th Oct 2012: they were not able to do Ian's MRI today because his Picc line is not working. They also did not have an EMT team on standby so they will reschedule. Ian was very happy about this. Today Ian received some mail with 2 packages and some cards he was over the moon. I myself was on the phone when they were opened and it was amazing to hear his excitement for sure.

Update 15th Oct 2012:  Ian's Picc line has been fixed it was not workingdue to this they had to hold off on the MRI today. They also wanted a EMT team on standby and they were not available. The issue with the swelling in the lower belly and groin the doctors believe because Ian was sitting up the fluid had moved down while he was up. That caused pushing on the bladder. This morning that improved and they will not have to put in a cathater at this stage. To much relief of everyone. Ian is passing fluid now. The out put is low but he is doing that on his own. I am trying my best to keep everyone up to date it is very hard as things move so fast one minute its one thing and the next its another. Ian is realy missing his family at home at the moment. His spirits were lifted today when Ian recieved some packages in the mail and some cards. One package included an IPad he was so excited he let out a scream. I was on the phone with him when he recieved it wow he was so Happy!! Easton's dad came over to Ian's room to help Ian set it up. While he was with him they had fixed the Picc line Ian now believes Easton's Dad is his good luck charm!! It was so sweet> Grandma and Noah are staying another night to help out. Ian also recieved a beautiful card today from and little girl and her Mom it was so amazing she sent Ian her hand print a a dollar from her piggy bank to help Ian. Ian and delicia were very touched that is just so wonderful. Thank you all who sent packages and cards and thatnk you all who also helped out with meals. It is a huge help when doctors are coming in and out all the time. Please hang in there I know much like us you are all waiting to find out what is going on with Ian's liver. so to are we this is a long process of getting tests done and back we to very much want answers the doctors are doing all they can for Ian and he is in the best hand. This is very hard on Ian and Delicia, they are missing Emma and Braden Pop Pop and Daddy to and home, the family pets you name it. We do not know how long Ian will be at CCH but by the day the stay is getting longer and longer so we need your support now more then ever.
 
Update 16th Oct 1012: Ian and Delicia are turning in early tonight. Ian is very tired today. He had the chance to go to the play room for a bit but he is iteritated and realy just wants to be left alone at the moment so they decided to go to bed early. The doctors are awaiting test results and scheduling the MRI for maybe the end of the week. They must plan carefully at the moment to ensure the can put Ian under. I am sorry I dont have any more information to share at the moment but we just have not gotten to the bottom of what is going on yet. Ian is on medication to reduce the fluid build up and that is a slow process. When they schedule surgery they hope to take a sample of the fuid to help understand what it is. Again the stay is becoming longer and longer and it is putting lots of presssure on the family financialy as well as emotionaly. Ian is missing his brothers and sister and his Poppop and Daddy to. I know Delicia is very concerned about how they will manage all of this in weeks to come and I know the stress is not helping at the moment please keep them in you thoughts tonight.
Update 17th Oct 2012: Ian had his PET scan today. He recieved a package from the Wrightsville Fire & Rescue and was so excited! His school teacher from home called today to line up with the teacher at CCH to help continue with Ian's schooling. He will meet the Cincinnati Childrens Hospital School Teacher tomorrow. Ian is having a lot of pain when having to sit up due to the fluid and it is a real challange for him.They are also helping Ian learn how to deal with anxiety duing bandage changes and tests which is a big help the therpist at CCH is working with him. Ian has gained a pound and a half but at this stage we are unsure if thats good or bad and unsure if thats fluid weight. Hopeing to know more soon as test results come back. Again his stay is getting longer and longer and we need as much help as we can get at the moment if you can donate even a dollar it would be a big help.
A post from Delica I wanted to share tonight.
 


I'm still up sitting in the dark eatting a bag of chips and sipping in a juice box. A new medicine they put Ian on has made his belly sick! I hope he rests comfortably. I sit and stare at my baby boy sleeping thinking oh dear lord what is in store for us. How much more can his very frail body take? I keep fighting but really how long can Ian fight? He is so strong but, really all he goes through how long until he has had enough? Until his body just stops and says no more? How long will we be here weeks months a year? Will Ian ever see home again? It's reality that I'm thinking! I want him healed out of pain smiling! I need thoughts and prayer as these rough times are apon me! I reach for hope keep my faith and just believe that god above will guide me! I have been blessed with a special fighter that has captured hearts of so many. Please continue to share his story and his pain. Educate people on the suffering of these children and their parents. Devistation is in my life and why is it fair that Ian suffers? My heart hurts beyond belief! Butterfly kisses blown over the bed to land softly on his fragile forehead. Rest peaceful my love. Mommy is watching! — with Ian Swarr at Cincinnati Children Hospital.

Oct 18th 2012 Ian's pain is associated with his tail bone. He has a lot of pain in that area. EB children are prone to fractures in the bones. They will do an x ray some time soon to check it out. Ian has some fractures as it is now in his back again common in EB children. the change in weather also seems to contribute to his soreness and it has just gotten quite cold in Ohio. His stomach is upset due to medication and he is just feeling bad today. Hope tomorrow is better for him. He recieved a package today from the Noosa Fire Company in Noosa Australia and a package from a lovley lady named Carol, who sent a portable DVD and some movies for Ian. He was very excited!! Thank you all for showing support for Ian. Keep the e cards and the mail coming he so enjoys it! If you can donate please do every little bit helps!!
Oct 19th 2012
keep the cards coming. Ian loves getting mail. if you have children who would ike to draw him a picture he love that sort of thing!! Ian is not feeling well and depression is starting as he will be away from home so long. Hoping the family visit this weekend will help. They have set a tentative date for surgery for next Thursday and it will be weeks following that maybe even longer that he will be at CCH. Please keep the donations coming they really need the support. He slept most of the day he is still feeling unwell. The GI doctors will visit soon to see what we can do about the medication that is making him unwell.Keep the thoughts and prayers flowing to he needs them.
Update oct 20th 2012: Ian was so happy to see the family today. he is tired and sleeping now Delicia and Troy and the kids will spend the night tonight in a hotel together for some much needed one on one time. Grandma and Popop will stay with Ian tonight. It's been a long day for them all with the drive and I think they all need some rest. I have had over whelming support today from across the world and please know that we are just so touched by every one of you! Ian's power chair is now with him at CCH his grandparents delivered that today as well. He was so happy to have it again as it is his legs!! Lots of love to Easton's Family tonight I thank you guys so much for sharing Ian's story with so many people. Having the family with him this weekend should help so much to lift his spirts for the week ahead it will be a long and hard week with tenative surgery scheduled for Thursday. We still do not know what is happening with his liver and we hope to have more answers at the end of the week again keep the suport coming please Ian's stay is going to be a long one and we need all the support we can get. Big Thank You To Everyone!
Update Oct 21st 2012
Ian had a good time having his family with him. They will be leaving tomorrow afternoon for home. Its been good for Delicia to spend time with her children. Today they went to the zoo. I was upset he could not go but he did not want to get out of bed anyway. His Amonia levels have come down and thats good news. He is stil scheduled for surgery on Thursday so any good news in the lead up  to that it amazing for sure. Grandma and Poppop have been able to give Delicia some time off so thats a good thing. She needs to be with the other kids and her husband Troy they need some time to all catch up. Please keep Ian in your thoughts and prayers this week in the lead up to surgery we are al very concerned as this is going to be hard on him. Its hard for him to recover so send lots of love his way please!
UPDATE OCT 22nd 2012
The family has now left to go back home. Ian was in good spirits today and even ordered himself something to eat. He was sad to see everyone go. They have confirmed they will go ahead with surgery on Thursday and Ian will have the next few days to rest up for the surgery. His ammonia levels are back up again today however they did say it will go up and down.
 
Update 23rd Oct 2012: Ian is having a good day! He is getting ready to get a albumin infusion (protein). He is just going with the flow. His skin looks really good! His ammonia level is better than it has been since we arrived! He gets his biopsy surgery Thursday early morning. As that nears I'm getting anxious just knowing how tight his airway is! We will be in icu at least one night to watch bleeding and vitals closely! His iPad has been keeping him busy! The cord isn't long enough to the outlet and it keeps dying and he doesn't let it charge long enough! I got to meet another eb family today! And have made some friends with other moms that have children here! It's such a depressing place! I talked with a mother who lost her son this morning to cancer! Please just keep all suffering children close to your heart! There is no reason for children to suffer!We have 13 days left on the Indiegogo campaigne and we have not reached our goal yet. Please visit his page and give a donation if you can even if its only a dollar every little bit counts. We will launch another campaign to follow and hope to raise even more for Ian. Please also visit the take them a meals page and sign up days will be added soon!! Thursday is the big day for surgery so please keep the love coming for Ian and pray for a good outcome. Again I want to thank you all so much for the support!!
Oct 24th 2012
My update tonight comes fro Delicia 
Surgery  tomorrow... Sigh... I'm doing ok Ian has a lot of anxiety. Please pray for him and keep him in your thought Surgery will at least be 5 hours,then off to the PICU. I'm not going to sleep a wink I know it! Today was long dressings took forever because of interruptions. I'm wore out! Going out and talking with other  parents has been great! There is a family here on our floor with EB I have introduced myself but haven't had time to talk! I hope to before they leave! Thank you all for the mail  it has helped Ian greatly today! I'm going to try and hang his cards tomorrow it just keeps getting pushed off! Remember Ian tomorrow as you go about your day! Keep him lifted with happy thoughts as he keeps up his fight! Thank you everyone that has prayed sent well wishes food and smiles our way it becomes over whelmingIan is putting together a Halloween house he received in the mail. We are trying to keep him occupied! I'm shaking but staying strong I'm basically rambling! I hate seeing my son suffer I can't fix his skin and now all of this! Gnite my friends!I my self am on edge I am worried and scared and i wish I was with them now!! May Ian be safe and sound tomorrow and may all go well I Love You so much and I miss you!! Aunt Jess
 
Ok so 3 really good biopsies of the liver, 2 from adrenal glands one that which bleed slot but they got it stopped. They have already gotten over 3 liters of fluid from him abdomin. The drai age tube will stay in for at least 24 hours! The did 3 punch biopsies! I went in OR to redress him. Lots of new blisters and his mouth to shredded!We are in PICU he is very sleepy I'm going to eat and lay down with him! He says no pain! I had them give him something so he wouldn't  be also zofran as a precaution! Thank you for your prayers by no means are we out of the water we just got in I hope for no bleeding and answers to know what our next step is! Ran back to our other room to get blankets and bumped into baby Liam and his family I will catch up with them hopefully tomorrow if not later tonight 
Update 26th Oct 

So today we are up to 5 liters of fluid that have drained from the drainage tube. The fluid keeps coming as the liver is not working well. We still do not have any results yet but we hope to soon at least something. They will look to remove the tube so and put it back in. They can not leave it in because of the risk of infection. and can not move because the drain is just siting in there they can'...
t stitch the drain in because of his skin so he is on his back. Being on his back is not a normal position for Ian so he is uncomfortable. We can't do any bandage changes as we can't move so that makes him feel a bit icky. Delicia will change the ones on his legs tonight and that should help a bit. He is not saying much and is not wAnting to eat or drink by mouth because the throat and mouth hurt but that's ok as he is being fed via his feeding tube and is receiving fluids by iv. He is tired to so hoping he rests. He is watching tv. They are working there way thought the packages and cards!! Ian was just over the moon when the mail guy rolled the cart in with the mail. He could not believe it. I will have pictures soon as the day goes on. Delicia is hanging all the cards on wall.She keeps running out of tape there are so many!! They will also be decorating for Halloween tonight as one of the packages received had decorations for him. That will be nice. Delicia told him today after Halloween they can decorate for Christmas and Ian said I won't be here for Christmas and then he said but it feels like Christmas!! So after Halloween they will decorate for Christmas!

 Oct 27th 2012
At this point they have a theory and only a theory. They felt maybe it could be autoimmune there are several types of this. It means the body could be attacking the liver causing damage to the live. This if so is something they can not stop. They have the ability to slow the process however the liver will continue to leak fluid. The live is damaged however the liver enzymes are showing fine. This is confusing for sure. They have many test results that are not back as EB is a very complex thing they will consult on an international level on all results. This is something that CCH has not seen in an EB patient and it could be the case that a doctor somewhere else has.
It may be the case this is a first again EB is complex at best. They do not know that this is directly related to EB. It could be contributing but again many unanswered questions. We hope to know more Tuesday about the tumors on the adrenal glands  but the liver will take much long to determine what is really going on. If in fact it is autoimmune the body would continue to destroy the liver and they could only slow the process down in saying that things like liver transplants are not much of an option for Ian and probably would not even be a possibility.
I don't even know that there has ever been a transplant on an RDEB patient. That is just getting to far ahead at this stage. What we have to remember is we are only entertaining a theory at this stage we need more results and more answers before anything can really be determined. One thing we do know is the liver continues to leak fluid for some reason and they must look to solve this issue first and in turn they must work out exactly what is going on inside until then we are still no further ahead.
Oct 28th 2012
Ian is feeling good today a bit lazy. Ian's Grandma has now joined us on Facebook woo hoo!! I cant wait to see what comes in the mail for him tomorrow!! We are all just waiting for more results.
Update Oct 29th 2012
At this point we are still going with liver disease! An auto immune disorder of the liver! There  is inflammation and scarring in the veins that drain the liver. nothing with spleen kidneys skin or liver looks like cancer tests and markers on pathology are not clear. They plan to do an MRI this week, And discuss plan of action! Enzymes are good! Protein was ok today and we are giving vitamin K! So nothing new just wanted to update! We will probably treat with steroids  but again no clue exactly what's going on at this point!Ian was in a great mood this afternoon he has been on a mental down slide for about an hour he is crying and just wants to be home. With his brothers and sister! Nothing I do or say makes him feel betting! He had visitors that brought him a milk shake and that didn't even help! I'm going to see if he can have something to calm him! It's breaking my heart. I finally went out earlier to get comfy shoes thanks to Amy!

Update Oct 30th 2012 Awesome cards art work and gifts today, thank you everyone ! Did a dressing change and overall Ian looks great! The Medihoney has been a blessing now that I have figured out how to go about using it we will always have it on board! He had his 5th albumin infusion today! I can certainly  tell the fluid is building  again but he said he feels good! These nurses sure get a kick out of him! He is a little pistol! Many have commented on the differences over the time we have spent here! With how he looks his color and humor! We both miss home so much he tells the nurses about daddy and his brothers sister and his animals some of these girls are from the city and think it's hilarious that we have chickens! They even asked if we take them inside when it storms! Lol! We are going to bed I hope to do more laundry tomorrow and find our hospital room there are boxes bags cards dressing supplies and candy everywhere! Gnite
 Update Oct 31st 2012 Halloween Update from DeliciaGood morning and Happy Halloween , I tossed and turned all night, he was pretty noisy while sleeping he is still asleep, he will get up soon and get his torso changed. I will get a pic with him and his nurse today! Beth is a vintage nurse today she is terribly cute as always!Ian has realized we won't be hone for his brothers and sisters bdays! He cried its been kinda a rough afternoon I think we might eat watch a movie and veg! I try and stay so strong and bit cry in front if him it has not been easy!We will defiantly need to have Joanne and Jared come up more often (danielle was on Paci duty) Ian is so pleasant now! Thank you! We enjoy your family so much! Joanne you were so right when you said Easton and Ian are tied together for life! Our families will forever be together!Update Aunt JessBoth Ian and Delicia are having a hard time at the moment being away from home and the family is very hard. Each day gets harder and harder. Its also very hard on the family at home to. We hope to make the next few weekends as special as we can with family to visit. Please eep the thoughts and prayers flowing during the hard times.It is a huge financial strain as well and that alone makes it even harder. Your suport is needed during this time please visit Ian's Fundraising page and help out if you can it would mean the world to all of us!
Update November 1st 2012Ian had a good day today for the most part. The Picc line was not working again and they were working hard to fix it. Ian got lots of mail today and a Furbie!! He was thrilled. Still no word on test results at this satge. He could not go to be untill he had some coco pops! Delicia had to go down and see if she could find some she returned moments later with coco crisps, will have to do!
 Update November 2nd 2012


Update: they believe Ian may have Fibrosis of the liver. Tuesday Delicia will have a meeting with the entire team to discuss further. Next week they will look to do an MRI and MRV at this point in time that's all the information we have in. In the coming weeks I am sure they will be discussing treatment and how we will reduce the fluid retention. At this time they are very unsure of what is going ...
on. it is very frustrating.Ian is now on morphine to manage the pain he is having. His pain has been increasing because he has become very accustomed to the medication on which he has been on so it is proving to be no longer effective for him. he has a very bad wound on his belly that is really irritating him at the moment. This weekend Ian will be very surprised to have 2 of his home nurses visit with him and his Daddy. The only good news I have to share today is that Ian will be given 4 hours to leave the hospital during that time he will be visiting the zoo!! Woo Hoo escape from hospital even if its only for a few hours it will do him a world of good!! I will update as the days go on as we learn more please keep the prayers coming for Ian as his stay becomes longer and longer at CCH.

story:
My name is Victoria and I have inflammatory breast cancer (IBC) that I need to get medical treatment for. 

The donations will all be used for this purpose.  I don't have insurance, but am concerned I won't be able to wait for Obamacare to kick in.

I cannot afford any rewards other than prayers, and since it is prayers that got me this far, that's a pretty good reward.

I will also keep all donors apprised of my progress.

If people contribute they will do honor to Angelina Jolie and all the women whoo choose to undergo preventive mastectomy so that breast cancer doesn't take them away from their family and loved ones.

Even if you cannot contribute, please get the word out about my campaign and if you can keep me in your thoughts and prayers, God Bless You!

story:
I am trying to raise some funds to pay off medical bills related to a pulmonary embolism and Hospital stays. I weighed 473 pounds at the time and as a result started a weight loss attempt. Since December of 2011 I have lost 150 plus pounds. I have over $3000 in medical bills that I want to pay off.

One of my goals is to do some things that I could not do when I weighed more. When I reach my goal I plan to take a trip, but I do not think I can do that without paying down the debt.

story:
The Accident

On May 25th, Monique and Michael DeCoste were in a tragic car accident in Edmundston, New Brunswick. They had been travelling back from their 33rd wedding anniversary holidays. Dad died in the crash, Mom is still in the hospital with a broken pelvis.

Mom is not able to get home unless she is sent by air ambulance, which her insurance refuses to make a decision on. We have been contacting them daily, and every time we are told that they are "reviewing the file internally. You'll have an answer tomorrow." Mom hs been in the hospital for more than a week.

All of her children and grandchildren are in Ontario, and we can't even schedule our Dad's funeral because we don't know when she might get home.

Your generous contributions

All contributions will go toward the air ambulance fees of sending Mom from Edmundston to Trenton or Belleville. (Whichever hospital has a bed open for her). You will have the complete gratitude of our family.

Meeting the goal

Getting Mom home means we can grieve and start to heal as a family. We will be able to schedule Dad's funeral, and finally lay his remains to rest.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute money to our cause. We appreciate if you would spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media you happen to use.

The insurance company we are dealing with is Sunlife. The only number they gave us is 1-866-222-0427.

More information on our story:

The accident article, from Edmundston http://cimt.teleinterrives.com/nouvelle-Regional_Embardee_mortelle_a_Saint_Basile_Le_nom_de_la_victime_devoile-5962

The story from the Belleville Intelligencer http://www.intelligencer.ca/2013/06/04/daughter-battles-insurers

The interview with CBC All in a Day http://www.cbc.ca/player/News/Canada/Ottawa/Audio/ID/2389691908/

Story on the CBC http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/story/2013/06/05/ottawa-monique-decostes-crash-new-brunswick-bring-mom-home-indiegogo.html 

Interview with the Mix97 Morning Crew http://www.mix97.com/morningcrew/bring-mom-home-campaign/

story:
We are Manuela and Valeria Cardenas, two twin sisters who started playing ultimate at the age of 8 through the INDER program, a project that brings sports like ultimate to public schools in Medellin, Colombia, as a vehicle for social change. We were immediately fascinated by ultimate because of the fact that it was a non-contact sport and there were so many different ways that the disc could be thrown. We began to train intensively and often stayed after class to throw on our own time. After seeing their passion for the sport, our coach encouraged them to try out for the competitive INDER team, which we did, passing the cuts and eventually making the travelling team, where we began to travel to various tournaments around the region.

At the age of 9, we began to train with Revolution Ultimate Club, which we remain a part of today. In 2010, at 11 years of age and with only three years of experience playing ultimate under their belts, we helped Revolution to a Colombian women's national championship, which our team repeated the subsequent year.

In 2012, the we were selected for the Colombian Women's U19 team and gained our  first international experience in Dublin, Ireland, at the 2012 World Junior Ultimate Championships. Despite being the youngest members of the team, we helped lead our squad to a gold medal finish. This trip was the "greatest experience of their lives". 50% of our travel and tournament costs were subsidized by INDER.

In 2013, we graduated from the INDER program and began to dedicate ourselves wholeheartedly to Revolution. They traveled with the team in July to the U.S. Open, where they gained their first experience playing in the United States, coming in fifth place. They also led Revolution to another Colombian Women's championship.

In 2014, we realized our dream of playing in two worlds - WJUC and WUGC in Lecco, Italy, and won yet another Colombian Women's championship.


In 2015, we repeated as national champions with Revolution and travelled to compete in Mexico for the first time, where we won a Pan-American Championship over Madison Heist in a hard-fought final.

This year, our dream is to travel to London and Poland to represent our country in the World Ultimate and Guts Championships and World Junior Ultimate Championships.

Message Trainer 

Hi guys my name is Mauricio Moore and I’m the coach of the Women’s elite Ultimate Team for the 2016 WUGC and head coach of Juniors Team for the 2016 WJUC which will take place in London UK, and Worclaw, Poland, in the next summer. I’m helping promoting this campaign this 16 years old twin ultimate player’s (Valeria and Manuela Cardenas) that have been playing since they were 8. They are part of the national team in Elite and junior division which means they both are commit to fly London and Poland this year, but sadly their family doesn't have enough economic resources to send both of them to the both tournaments as they come from the INDER program. 

Our team is turning to the ultimate community to raise the money to help out supporting their dream to play the sport which has been their passion since age 8. Please read on to learn more about the Wonder sisters


How You Can Help

Our parents are not able to finance either of these trips, so this is a way for us to raise money. The cost of these trips as well as player fees and team fees are very high, and even with the fundraising that we will do with the teams, we are not able to cover the costs.

Partnerships

We are excited to partner with Skyd Magazine to help this campaign come to life. 

Help Valeria and Manuela

story:
*UPDATE*

*We moved our time table up and even though some perks may say "Estimate for November" we are moving our shipping dates up to September meaning you will receive your Wake Up Waffles much sooner!*

 

Wake Up, Eat Well, Feel Good

No more messy mixes. Wake Up Waffles are the healthiest, highest protein waffles available. Just pop them in the toaster or microwave and you are ready to go!

Why Wake Up Waffles?

The Problem

Eating healthy on the go is never an easy task. Fast and healthy  are two words that do not go hand-in-hand.

If you want a high protein, low fat meal in the morning preparation needs to start early.

Or you can choose to drink a protein shake or bar. We all know how those feel on an empty stomach...

 

The Solution

Nicole and  I (Keegan) started making our high protein waffles about two years ago when we were first beginning our fitness journeys.

We still wanted to have all the fun of delicious breakfast foods; but most pancake, waffle, or french toast options are packed with sugar. The high protein options are overpriced and tasted a little too "healthy" for Nicole and I. That is when Wake Up Waffles were born.

 It took many attempts but we finally figured out a recipe that was

  • low fat
  • high protein
  • not dry (our original goal was to not get hiccups)
  • didn't taste terrible

and ever since we have been eating our waffles almost every day.

They are great for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or even as a snack. You can eat them plain or top them off with anything you can think of!

 

Our Benefits

  • low fat
  • high protein
  • GLUTEN FREE
  • low sugar
  • no artificial preservatives

Ingredients: Whey Protein Concentrate, Egg Whites, Pumpkin, Gluten-Free Whole Grain Rolled Oats, Pure Vanilla Extract, Sodium Bicarbonate (Baking Soda), Dextrose (D-glucose) and Maltodextrin (Splenda), Acetoin and Acetyl Propionyl Free (Flavor Concentrate), Milk Protein, Cellulose Gum, Zantham Gum, Carrageenan (Binding Agent)

Additional Ingredients for Chocolate Brownie: Unsweetened Cocoa

Our Goal & Your Reward

Our main goals are to...

  • keep Wake Up Waffles affordable

  • help others discover fitness and health

 

We set our funding goal at $50,000.

This will be going towards...

  • ingredients (major bulk!)
  • packaging (time to get fancy)
  • a commercial kitchen
  • flavor development
  • commercial waffle makers

Protein is our most expensive ingredient, so a good amount off our funds will be going towards ordering a large quantity in order to lower the price-per-package.

If we hit our goal we will be looking into contract manufacturers with the intentions of getting into stores as soon as possible. We want to eliminate the shipping cost for the consumer making Wake Up Waffles even more accessible.

Funding

We have decided to do the flexible funding option. If we do not reach our funding goal we will still be putting the money raised towards ingredients, a commercial kitchen, and waffle makers to get Wake Up Waffles to everyone who wants them, and to keep our aspiration going.

Perks!

We have a variety of perk options from a "thank you!" to working with us to create a new flavor! You have the choices of receiving one, two or three packages; where you can choose from any of our three flavors.

 

Mix and match or get one flavor that is already making your mouth water. In some of our perks you have the option of getting a t-shirt with your package of waffles.

 

Help us spread the word!

Check out our Facebook page, Instagram ( @wake_up_waffles ), or website.

And please share our campaign to show support and others what Wake Up Waffles are all about!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are Joshua Koning and Cameron Ouwens. Together we study Physical Activity & Lifestyle at the Hanze University of Applied Science in Groningen. We are going to study in Rio Maior, Portugal for the coming semester. We didn't know quite how to go there and how to cope with all the free time that lies between our last exam in Groningen and the first classes in Rio Maior. So we figured, why not practice what we preach and take the bike?!

To make our journey more than just an awesome adventure for the two us we figured to do something with it that connects it with our study. That is why we will be taking health measurements such as a skin fold, BMI, VO2 max uptake etc. before and after our three week journey in which we will cycle about 3000 km.

What We Need & What You Get

Cameron is actually still looking for a bike, but we are mainly going to use the money for:

  • Bicycle repairs and maintenance
  • Healthy food
  • Money for overnight stays
You are going to get?

  • A frequent update on Facebook, Instagram and a blog.
  • You will get the report of our 'study' findings
  • Acces to our offered perks.
  • We will attempt to make a little movie of all our footage after the journey.
  • The knowledge you helped two student achieve their goal and make that awesome journey.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute through this site? We made another more accessible (IDEAL) site as well  that you can find on our Facebook page. 

You can also help without money.
Below is our estimated schedule for our journey and we'd love a place to stay.
