story:
Dear Friends, Family, and World:

I have created this page to support my dear friends, my "siblings", Adit and Rany, who recently experienced the joy of giving birth to a beautiful baby boy named Keandra.

Keandra was born with Down Syndrome, and we just recently discovered that he also has holes in his heart (artioventicular septal defect).  This can lead to a high-risk of heart failure, and cardiologists have explained that corrective surgery is required this December.  If we cannot afford his surgery then, it will be impossible to perform the surgery later.  Keandra's life is at enormous risk.

This surgery costs $9,000.  I implore you to please consider any level of donation to save Keandra's life.

To bring a new life into this world is truly a miracle.  Equally miraculous is the strength with which Adit and Rany are facing this challenge.  Adit has said, "We have learnt that its a very beautiful gift. Keandra holds something huge upon us. We know that its not going to be easy, but we believe that there is more to be revealed. He has shown us what life is all about."

Full story of Keandra's journey can be read on http://adittaslim.tumblr.com

Thank you for your support at any level, and please share this link far and wide.

In solidarity,

xo Kate

katherine.otto@gmail.com

story:
My name is Carolyn; I am 44 yrs. YOUNG !!

I have been on Disability since 2001, due to several medical issues and bring in less than $800/mo. My husband works full time and goes to college. We are barely getting by as it is, never have enough money to save up for emergencies like this, or the car breaking down, etc. Our landlord has been so patient, as we have fallen behind there as well, due to the downed economy issues. This is so hard for me, as I have never been one to beg, but we really can't afford this trip, and I'm sure I will probably have to go back again, maybe several times. 

My stomach issues began when I was just 3 mo. old with Intussusception of the intestines (http://children.webmd.com/tc/intussusception-topic-overview). Hospitalized for that 3 times, 3 mo. old, 8 yrs. old and 12 yrs. old and had to have two transfusions pre 1981, when they didn’t check for things like Hep-C yet. My Father always tells me "the Lord won't give me more than I can handle" but I feel I am at my wits end already, then I am diagnosed with Gastro paresis (http://diabetes.webmd.com/tc/gastroparesis-topic-overview). I was referred to Mayo Clinic in Jacksonville, Fl. And I hear they are the best at figuring these things out but this trip is going to be hard on us financially, esp. since my husband has to take off work to take me because I can't drive anymore. On top of all that, I have only one tooth left in my mouth and no dentures because we just can’t afford them. This is why getting to this appt. and being able to afford whatever it is they want to do is so important to me. I don't want to be this sick for the rest of my life knowing it’s only going to get worse medically. The Dr.'s can’t cure any of these illnesses, but there is a good chance that Mayo can increase my quality of life so I might be able to go back to having a life. Due to all these medical issues, I rarely leave the house, except for dr.'s appts. I have lost most of my friends due to the fact I cant go out and socialize like I used to. I'm always worried when my bladder or bowels will decide to let go before I can get to the bathroom. 

I have also been diagnosed over the years with Fybromyalgia, http://www.webmd.com/fibromyalgia/default.htm, Pernicious Anemia http://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/vitamin-b12-deficiency-anemia-topic-overview, Hepatitis C http://www.webmd.com/hepatitis/digestive-diseases-hepatitis-c), Bursitis, both hips and right shoulder; fibrocystic breast disease (http://women.webmd.com/guide/fibrocystic-breast-changes-symptoms-treatments-causes), Carpal Tunnel and I recently had to have a mesh wall implanted in my abdomen to fix three Hernias and Adhesions caused by prior surgeries. As well as remove a lesion on my left breast that would not heal for over a year. I also had a seizure that couldn't be explained?

Mayo Clinic is my last chance. The last time I saw my Gastro Dr. He recommended a medicine I could try, but it’s not on the market in the U.S. As it is, I already take Lotronex which is one of the few meds to be brought back on the market after being black labeled. It helps with the abdominal pain for the most part, but not the other symptoms. I also take several other meds to try to control the symptoms. I feel like a walking pharmacy at times.

Anything you can afford to contribute will be greatly appreciated. Even if only $1.00. Every little bit counts! The money received will be used to cover any medical expenses not covered by medicare, (usually 15-20%), and travel expenses.

And if you can’t afford to contribute in this hard economy, I totally understand. But if you could just pass the word on, share this site with your friends/family and keep me in your prayers, that will be appreciated just as much! Bless you :)

The video I have linked is not my own, but I haven’t created one yet and this one was very informative for me and I thought it might bring more awareness to this disorder.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please just spread the word so more research can be done to try and find a cure so no one else ever has to go through what I am going through.

I don't want to be this sick for the rest of my life knowing it’s only going to get worse medically. The Dr.'s can’t cure any of these illnesses, but there is a good chance that Mayo can increase my quality of life so I might be able to go back to having a life. Due to all these medical issues, I rarely leave the house, except for dr.'s appts. I have lost most of my friends due to the fact I cant go out and socialize like I used to. I'm always worried when my bladder or bowels will decide to let go before I can get to the bathroom. 
I have also been diagnosed over the years with Fybromyalgia, http://www.webmd.com/fibromyalgia/default.htm, Pernicious Anemia http://www.webmd.com/a-to-z-guides/vitamin-b12-deficiency-anemia-topic-overview, Hepatitis C http://www.webmd.com/hepatitis/digestive-diseases-hepatitis-c), Bursitis, both hips and right shoulder; fibrocystic breast disease (http://women.webmd.com/guide/fibrocystic-breast-changes-symptoms-treatments-causes), Carpal Tunnel and I recently had to have a mesh wall implanted in my abdomen to fix three Hernias and Adhesions caused by prior surgeries. As well as remove a lesion on my left breast that would not heal for over a year. I also had a seizure that couldn't be explained?
Mayo Clinic is my last chance. The last time I saw my Gastro Dr. He recommended a medicine I could try, but it’s not on the market in the U.S. As it is, I already take Lotronex which is one of the few meds to be brought back on the market after being black labeled. It helps with the abdominal pain for the most part, but not the other symptoms. I also take several other meds to try to control the symptoms. I feel like a walking pharmacy at times.
Anything you can afford to contribute will be greatly appreciated. Even if only $1.00. Every little bit counts! The money received will be used to cover any medical expenses not covered by medicare, (usually 15-20%), and travel expenses.
And if you can’t afford to contribute in this hard economy, I totally understand. But if you could just pass the word on, share this site with your friends/family and keep me in your prayers, that will be appreciated just as much! Bless you :)
The video I have linked is not my own, but I haven’t created one yet and this one was very informative for me and I thought it might bring more awareness to this disorder.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please just spread the word so more research can be done to try and find a cure so no one else ever has to go through what I am going through.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

Thanks to the very skilled surgeon and attentive (and patient) hospital staff, Jon is now recovering at "home" with Allison for 3-4 weeks(?) until he can manage on his own.

Even though he has a great job taking care of nursing home patients, he doesn't have insurance and will need some financial help as it will be two months or so before he will be able to get back to work.

Because the infection in his heart spread to the joints in his body, he was in the hospital three weeks before the surgery--unable to walk. Therefore, his recovery will take longer than a regular heart valve surgery.

Let's help Jon get back on his feet--literally and financially--for a very merry Christmas.

Any assistance will be appreciated to help pay for home nurse care, food, doctor visits, and follow-up care.

Thank you and Happy Holidays!

story:
Short Summary

Mr. Rick has worked with youth since the early 70's.  He is driven to make a difference in their lives and find safe places for them to spend their time.  It all started in his backyard, as the video describes, and has grown every year.  This year he has 4 teams-8th, 9th, 10th, and 11th grade boys. 

  • Kids are off the streets and spending time with other boys and men, getting exercise and growing up.
  • This is more than basketball!  It is a family environment where kids get a chance to shine and excel!
  • Every year we have kids that cannot afford to play; whether it be team dues, team shoes, travel expenses, etc.  Contributions allow them to participate.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Tournament fees cost between $250.00 and $650.00.  Each team hopes to attend 10 tournaments between March and July this year.  
  • Gym rental averages $150.00/ week for one night/week.  Ideally, we would have the boys in the gym twice/week but the cost currently prohibits that.
  • Player dues for those that can pay are $300.00/ year.  This covers a team uniform, partial gym rentals and partial tournament fees.  Every year we have boys who can't pay all or part of this fee.  We depend on donors and contributors to support these boys. They need money for travel, food, and lodging when traveling outside the area.
  •  In addition, if the teams make it to national tournaments, there are additional fees for travel expenses, national tournament fees and a year end celebration with trophies.
  • Donors sponsoring a player will get a personalized thank you and autographed photo of the player and/or team.  In addition, all donors can opt to have their name listed on our team website: www.mrricksballerz.net
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will limit the amount of tournaments we attend, look for local tournaments only, and opt out of attending nationals. In addition, we will have to practice just once/ week.

The Impact

We have personally seen boys' lives changed by their participation with MRB.  Some never traveled outside of Durham and are learning how to be a team player on and off the court!  Supporting a player, team, or the whole organization will enhance and improve the lives of so many.

  • Most won't play professional basketball but can get access to college scholarships through their AAU play and exposure to college coaches.
  • Lessons learned through sports and team play will improve their future work life, home life, and overall quality of life.
  • With your help Mr. Rick's dream of helping kids grow up and give back to their community will be fulfilled!

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you can't help financially, we hope that you will share our message with your friends and family. You can support our teams by watching us play if we are in your area.  Follow us on our website and Facebook page.  You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Visit our website! http://www.h2obolivia.org

Our Story 

H2O Bolivia was founded by Ricardo Saavedra and Jennifer Li in the spring of 2011 and inspired by Ricardo and his many years living in Cochabamba, Bolivia.  The project was born out of a mutual commitment to public service and environmental conservation.  With feedback and support from friends and networks in New York, Washington, D.C., and South America, work on developing H2O Bolivia's mission quickly developed from a single idea to a village of eager participants and volunteers.

Local NGO chapters in Bolivia, such as SODIS  and Water for People, along with San Simon University in Cochabamba, continue to provide invaluable assistance to the project through consulting and serving as liaisons in the communities where H2O Bolivia is currently working.

 

What We Need & What You Get

100% OF DONATIONS GO DIRECTLY TO OUR COMMUNITIES: for constructing the families' biosand water filters, marketing our efforts to the surrounding communities, providing daily stipends to our volunteers who teach our public health classes, and administration costs for our small team in Bolivia. 

 

Thank you !

story:
Short Summary

 

My name is John Michael and I regularly compete in extreme obstacles courses throughout the year. This year I competed in a Tough Mudder event and I completed the full course. The video link shows what kind of event that I will be running in this year if my fundraising goal is met.

This race will help support the Wounded Warrior Project which provides assistance to injured veterans coming home from war. The fundraising money will help me pay for the race as well as race related expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

I need the money to pay for the race fee which is $450 dollars plus a $45 insurance fee. The remainder of the fundraising money will go towards equipment I need to run the race. I need to purchase a tent for the overnight stay as well as new running gear due to the harsh conditions that I will be running through. Any amount helps and is greatly appreciated.

For your donations I will provide race photos of myself before, during and after the race concludes.

Even if I don't reach the entire fundraising goal I can still use what funds were raised to go towards the event.

The Impact

Your donation will help support the injured veterans returning home from overseas and support an excellent cause. To date the Tough Mudder company (for which this event is being run) has donated over 3 million dollars to the Wounded Warrior Project.

This race means a lot to me because I never thought I would be capable of running an event like this. I was never that strong mentally or physically and the event that I ran prior in the year helped me gain confidence. This is more than just a race to me. This event shows that anyone can be capable of great things.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey! If you can't donate, do not worry. Any help is appreciated.
 
Please share the link for the donation on your facebook and with your friends and family. Help me raise the money so I can compete and support the Wounded Warrior Project.
 
Thank You!

story:
Please watch Ryan's interview with NBC Bay Area:

http://www.nbcbayarea.com/news/local/San-Jose-M...

Ryan Manansala, is a 27 year old filipino male from San Jose, CA. He is suffering from Acute Myelogenous Leukemia, and is in dire need of a bone marrow match. 

Ryan has always been about giving back to the community. He has worked for years as an Intervention Specialist, assisting children with autism. He also devoted his time and love to EMQ Family First as a Big Brother for 6 years. 

Ryan is absolutely an inspiration because he is so passionate about helping others. Now, it is our turn to help him. Filipinos only make 0.6% of the bone marrow registry. Due to the lack of donors, no match has been found for Ryan. He is undergoing a cord blood transplant in Seattle, WA on August 31, 2012 - a $1.2 million procedure.

Any and all funds will be used for medications, co-pays, and procedure costs. 

Awareness is everything! Spread the word about the need to register as a bone marrow donor, although you may not be a match for Ryan, you may save the life of another cancer patient. To register as a donor, or to hold a bone marrow drive for Ryan (or others), please visit: http://www.aadp.org/learn/how-to-register/ 

Visit Ryan on Twitter and Facebook!

www.helpsaveryan.com

story:
Short Summary

Owen was thrown from a vehicle and broke his collarbone.  He also suffered serious abrasion burns over a significant part of his body.

 

While the burns will heal, he needs a simple surgical procedure to repair his broken collarbone (see the attached x-ray to see the break).  The surgeon requires $400 to get started on the procedure -- if we can raise $1,000, that could help with the procedure and other related medical expenses!

 

All the money being raised goes directly to Owen to help with his medical costs.

story:
Twelve years ago, I began visiting Honduras on short term missions helping the communities, schools, and local churches. I have also had the opportunity to live in Honduras for 4 months last year volunteering as a teacher in the school. Throughout these years, I was so blessed to meet a wonderful family- The Jacksons. They embraced me like I was their own family. 

Recently, Kenner Jackson, his wife, and 23 month old child were riding on a motorcycle and were struck by a drunk driver. Unfortunatly, Kenner did not make it. His wife made it out with a few injuries. The child, Rachel Jackson, is currently in a hospital in Tegucigalpa with 4 fractures in her skull, brain swelling, and has difficulty moving the right side of her body. 

Rachel is currently at the Public Hospital, and is not able to recieve the best medical attention that she needs. In Honduras, there is no health insurance or any kind of insurance available to the family. They needs the funds available at hand for any doctors to perform any kind of test or medical procedure before they can proceed with it. 

She needs our help.

I do not know exactly what the cost is going to be, but it will be at a minimum of $10 000. All the money donated here will be going towards her medical bills, whether we make more or less than our goal. (The currency is in Canadian Dollars. approx. 1 CAD= .97 USD)

You can be a part of changing a life. 

Think about how much you can give. Are you willing to sacrifice something to make a big difference in someone's world? 

If you aren't in a place where you can contribute financially, please get the word out about this campaign. We need everyone to see this. We need everyone on board to help Rachel.

story:
Meet Molly Gibbons. Please help make her smile.

Molly is a an eleven-year-old middle school student in Jamesville, NY, who suffers from Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB). EB is a rare and devastating genetic skin disease (affecting only 1 out of 50,000 births) for which there is currently no cure. In this condition, there is a defect in the connective tissue of the skin and mucous membranes that causes the skin to be so fragile that the slightest friction, minor injury, heat, rubbing, or scratching causes severe blistering inside (such as the mouth, stomach, esophagus) and outside of the body. These blisters can cause serious and sometimes fatal problems when they become infected. Those with EB live in unthinkable pain. Young EB patients are often called “butterfly children," because their skin is as fragile as the wings of a butterfly. 

When Molly was born and her diagnosis made, her parents were told that she, like countless other EB babies, would likely not live more than 12 months. Eleven years later, she is a beautiful, caring girl known for her smile, positive attitude and desire to help others.

Molly and her family have privately battled her disease without asking for any financial assistance. They only recently agreed to bring attention to Molly's condition by allowing her to participate in media interviews specifically to generate awareness of EB and for baby Easton Friedel who was born in August 2012 in a community close to Molly's home (see link to media coverage). However, Molly's family's situation has changed and she now needs our help. 

Due to a change in her family's health insurance, none of Molly's bandage costs are covered any longer. Previously, 90% of the approximate $4,000 monthly bandage supply cost was covered by insurance. You can imagine how that change has impacted her family.  

Like most all EB children, Molly's bandages need to be changed about every three days. It takes 3 to 4 hours and the process is so painful that Molly dreads having it done. But she knows her bandage changes are critical to prevent infection and to help keep her wounds from bleeding and blisters from oozing. She is much more comfortable with the bandages on, and as her supply runs low, she worries about the smell and discomfort it will mean if she has to go longer between changes. Not having enough bandages is the last thing this kind and loving little middle school student should have to worry about. 

An area pharmacy has generously agreed to sell Molly's bandages at cost and has set up an account for her. Every penny received through this donation campaign will be deposited in Molly's pharmacy account and will be spent on bandages and changing supplies. Though the goal is $1,000, we would love to far exceed that amount and raise enough to cover the approximate $4,000 it will cost to supply Molly's bandages for just one month. It would be such a gift to take away Molly's worry--even if just for a while--about having enough bandages so that she can focus on things other eleven-year-old girls do.

A dollar or two or whatever you can spare will be greatly appreciated by this special little girl and her family. Together, we can make Molly smile!

http://www.syracuse.com/news/index.ssf/2012/08/central_new_york_community_com.html

story:
Order Now!

Achieve more with Mobius Breakfast.

Starting your day healthy and energized doesn't have to be time consuming. Replace your morning coffee, your multivitamin and your rushed breakfast with this dark chocolate shake. Combining coconut milk, protein, caffeine, and brain-boosting herbs, Mobius Breakfast is the fastest, healthiest and best tasting way to jump start your day.        


Think, work and feel better with Mobius Breakfast.


"I know I'm full without that awful 'I ate too much' feeling. I also had tons of energy without the [caffeine]shakes and didn't need coffee. I was super focused, got tons accomplished, and didn't get hungry for hours." -Blair L.

"Ya'll killed it! It's all on point. I'm thinking more clearly because my brain has energy!" -Martin M.

"I am not a breakfast person so I have tried many shakes and supplements. This is the first one that tastes like real food!! and it isn't TOO sweet!" -Amy E.

"Enjoyed that it doesn't have a strong protein after taste" -Lora D.

"I enjoyed the flavor and it stayed mixed with the water very well. The “right-size” blender bottle is also pretty neat. I am feeling more alert, focused, and calm than I usually do in the morning. Typically I consume three cups of coffee each morning and get hungry from missing breakfast. Imagine Tweek from South Park. I look forward to making this a part of my morning!" -Caleb L.

Mobius Breakfast was rated 8.5/10 for both flavor and texture.




Ingredients:

We've worked to handpick the best, all-natural ingredients for this product:

  • Coconut Milk, not maltodextrin, is the central ingredient. These healthy saturated coconut fats give you consistent energy, not an insulin spike.
  • A specially engineered dual-blend of protein derived from grass-fed cows and eggs supports muscle and joint health and keeps your mind sharp.
  • Caffeine derived from 100% Arabica Coffee Beans, for the kick you need to start your day.
  • Electrolytes keep you hydrated.
  • A full multivitamin means that you don't have to rely on a handful of different vitamins to give you the nutrients you need - including B Vitamins, which support neural and metabolic health.
  • Nootropics, made of herbs and amino acids, give your mind energy, increasing focus and decreasing stress.
  • Three MCTs (Medium Chain Triglycerides) give you energy quickly and consistently.

Did you know?  Mobius makes a nutritious and delicious hot cocoa!

Mobius Breakfast is entirely gluten-free, soy-free, dairy-free, and natural, without GMOs.  It's also deliciously dark-chocolate flavored.

Packaged in single-serving packets, Mobius goes wherever you need to be, and ensures you always have the right amount for your drink.



Ingredients: Coconut milk powder, grassfed beef collagen peptides, sugar, Fibersol®-2, maltodextrin, dutch process cocoa, vitamin C, cocoa seed extract, L-carnitine L-tartrate, egg albumin (egg protein), calcium carbonate, magnesium aspartate, gotu kola extract, coconut water powder, natural flavor, dipotassium phosphate, potassium chloride, Rhodiola rosea root extract, sodium citrate dihydrate, ashwagandha root extract, magnesium oxide, caffeine (from Arabic coffee beans), guar gum, xanthan gum, salt, silica, Stevia rebaudiana leaf extract, zinc glycinate amino acid chelate, dicalcium phosphate, DL-alpha-tocopheryl acetate, niacin, calcium D-pantothenate, copper glycinate amino chelate, molybdenum citrate, selenium citrate, manganese sulfate monohydrate, pyridoxine HCl, thiamine HCl, riboflavin, beta carotene, chromium polynicotinate, retinyl acetate, folate, biotin, potassium iodide, vitamin K, vitamin D, vitamin B12

What are Nootropics?

Nootropics (/noʊ.əˈtrɒpɨks/ noh-ə-TROP-iks)—also called smart drugs, memory enhancers, neuro enhancers, cognitive enhancers, and intelligence enhancers—are drugs, supplements, nutraceuticals, and functional foods that improve one or more aspects of mental function.   -Google

L-Carnitine - 1,000mg
According to the National Institutes of Health, L-Carnitine is an amino acid that transports long-chain fatty acids into the mitochondria of the body’s cells. The cells then burn this fat to produce energy. This is extremely useful as the majority of calories in Mobius Breakfast come from coconut fat. All of this will keep your brain energized throughout your morning.


Gotu kola - 500mg
Comes from the Eastern medicine family, and is an herbal stress reliever. Studies published in the Nepal Medical College Journal and the Journal of Ethnopharmacology found that participants who took gotu kola had reduced stress and increased cognition.  

Ashwagandha - 200mg
Ashwaganha is found in India and is an herb used in Ayurvedic Medicine. In two double-blind, placebo-controlled studies published in the Indian Journal of Phsychiatry(2), Ashwagandha was shown to decrease anxiety.

Rhodiola rosea - 300mg
An herb that helps reduce mental fatigue.  Studies were done with students and with physicians and showed that Rhodiola reduces the mental fatigue that the subjects experienced in stressful environments. The studies were both published in Phytomedicine: International Journal of Phytotherapy and Phytopharmacology. 

Back to top of page



3 Samples of Mobius

Share Your Experience!

Once you try Mobius, we know you'll love it - and we want you to share this with us!


About Us

David Taylor is a Chemical Engineer who graduated in 2013, and Michael Eichenseer is a Business/Information Science graduate of 2014.  Both graduated from the Missouri University of Science and Technology.  They are fitness/nutrition enthusiasts, David being on the body builder side of the spectrum, Michael being on the functional fitness side.  Together they have both read countless books on the subjects of health, fitness, and business.  David is an avid reader of studies relating to supplements, nutrition, and fitness and has been the main driver of Mobius.

 

David married Megan, a talented dancer with a BFA in modern dance  from Texas Christian University, after graduating college and soon after cofounded the company with her and Michael.  David and Megan are the husband and wife team making this all happen from Plano, TX.  They both have jobs and work on Mobius in their spare time. Michael currently lives in Boulder, CO working on marketing operations.  The team wears many hats and works together on their many roles, but simply put David and Megan are focused on operations, production, and social media.  Michael focuses on branding, marketing, and web development. 

Check Us Out On:
story_txt:
Order Now!

Achieve more with Mobius Breakfast.
Starting your day healthy and energized doesn't have to be time consuming. Replace your morning coffee, your multivitamin and your rushed breakfast with this dark chocolate shake. Combining coconut milk, protein, caffeine, and brain-boosting herbs, Mobius Breakfast is the fastest, healthiest and best tasting way to jump start your day.        





Think, work and feel better with Mobius Breakfast.

"I know I'm full without that awful 'I ate too much' feeling. I also had tons of energy without the [caffeine]shakes and didn't need coffee. I was super focused, got tons accomplished, and didn't get hungry for hours." -Blair L."Ya'll killed it! It's all on point. I'm thinking more clearly because my brain has energy!" -Martin M."I am not a breakfast person so I have tried many shakes and supplements. This is the first one that tastes like real food!! and it isn't TOO sweet!" -Amy E."Enjoyed that it doesn't have a strong protein after taste" -Lora D."I enjoyed the flavor and it stayed mixed with the water very well. The “right-size” blender bottle is also pretty neat. I am feeling more alert, focused, and calm than I usually do in the morning. Typically I consume three cups of coffee each morning and get hungry from missing breakfast. Imagine Tweek from South Park. I look forward to making this a part of my morning!" -Caleb L.Mobius Breakfast was rated 8.5/10 for both flavor and texture.








Ingredients:
We've worked to handpick the best, all-natural ingredients for this product:


Coconut Milk, not maltodextrin, is the central ingredient. These healthy saturated coconut fats give you consistent energy, not an insulin spike.
A specially engineered dual-blend of protein derived from grass-fed cows and eggs supports muscle and joint health and keeps your mind sharp.

Caffeine derived from 100% Arabica Coffee Beans, for the kick you need to start your day.

Electrolytes keep you hydrated.
A full multivitamin means that you don't have to rely on a handful of different vitamins to give you the nutrients you need - including B Vitamins, which support neural and metabolic health.

Nootropics, made of herbs and amino acids, give your mind energy, increasing focus and decreasing stress.
Three MCTs (Medium Chain Triglycerides) give you energy quickly and consistently.




Did you know?  Mobius makes a nutritious and delicious hot cocoa!

Mobius Breakfast is entirely gluten-free, soy-free, dairy-free, and natural, without GMOs.  It's also deliciously dark-chocolate flavored.
Packaged in single-serving packets, Mobius goes wherever you need to be, and ensures you always have the right amount for your drink.

story:
We are almost there!

We’ve had the generous donations to cover our initial expenses and we are so grateful. It’s proof that, together, we can accomplish anything. As we are in our final stretch, we need raise some more funds where we need it most—to provide direct relief to the people. For this we are doing a small booster campaign for $5,000 to cover the medicines, exam tools, and even access to care in neighboring areas.

As we’ve discovered the most immediate and pressing needs is for dental treatments and education. Due to lack of dental hygiene and access to routine dental appointments, people here suffer from dental health issues such as severe cavities and early tooth loss. So please help us address these concerns.

Your donation is tax-deductible. Our partner, The Dzogchen Shri Singha Foundation, is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization, and is helping to manage the distribution of funds, so your donation is fully tax- deductible.

In-kind donations such as travel and accommodation expenses and medical and non-medical supplies are also graciously accepted. To inquire about making this type of donation, please contact us.

About One Path Outreach

One Path Outreach is a humanitarian relief program that seeks support to provide health care, education, and basic necessities to remote villages of Eastern Tibet. We seek to provide immediate relief through voluntary clinical care and basic supplies while helping promote long-term improvement by collaborating with local communities to create systemic change.

One Path Outreach believes all beings should have access to adequate health care, education, and basic necessities. We believe that all people share “one path” and that is the desire to live in health, happiness, and harmony.

Together We Can Make A Difference

Our current project is a medical mission to the Dzogchen Area in Kham, Tibet, in the western part of the Sichuan Province of China. Our goal is to provide mobile clinics offering basic medical examinations, dental care, vision care, woman’s health, and health education. There is a great need for the most basic care and supplies, and your support is instrumental to providing these.

•

One Person Makes A Great Impact

Your contribution is valuable and much appreciated. Whether it's in the form of donations, volunteer services, or spreading the word, your participation is essential to bringing immediate relief to people geographically isolated from some of the necessities for basic health.

•

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us spread the word and share our campaign on social media. The more awareness we raise, the more resources we can gather to reach our goals.

Thank You!

story:
Recently, my Grandmother fell down the stairs and had nowhere to turn for help. Every year over 33% of the population over the age of 65 have a falling accident. It's the leading cause of death due to injury. We wanted to create a simple and easy to use app that would address the emergency situations of our senior population and the response of their trusted family and friends.

VIPE was founded late-June, 2014 and has been live on the App Store since mid-January, 2015. We are a small and passionate team with big dreams and have turned to Indiegogo to enable us to continue making a positive impact in people's daily lives. Being able to meet and overcome the challenges we will all inevitably face in older age with the help of the VIPE App is what keeps us going. 

The life of a 21st century human being is so fast-paced that it sometimes clouds our ability to appreciate what life is truly about - family and our health. We wanted to create an app that not only serves as an emergency services tool, but also allows younger generations to manage the wellbeing of their beloved older adults - enabling them to check-up on and remotely take care of their parents, grandparents and beyond. It is crucially important that our senior population can live independently and confidentially into a brighter future.

We're in this Together

We are campaigning for £25,000 to continue our operations for a future 6 months. We have done our utmost to keep costs as low as possible without compromising the quality of our app. The pie chart below outlines the allocation of campaign funds. It is important to note that since the founding of VIPE, our Founder & CEO has not taken a salary, not a penny. The company has been self-funded up until this point - with your invaluable contribution we can continue to push full steam ahead.



The bulk of our campaign funds thanks to your contribution (no matter how big or small) will enable our team to continue developing VIPE's:
  • iOS version updates
  • Apple Watch
  • Android
  • Wearable (continued R&D in a low-cost complementary device we intend to launch in Q4 2015)

In the event that we are unable to achieve our goal of £25,000, we will strive to stretch the use of any campaign funds received as far as possible and explore our strategic options in the interim.  

Head Winds

We currently have a steady flow of daily downloads and engagement on the app, our website and social media channels. Bringing word of mouth awareness to the masses will be crucial to the success of VIPE. Challenges are everywhere, but we have the determination to overcome them. Our 3 main external obstacles are:

1. Smartphone Adoption Amongst Older Adults (65+)

Only 18% of older adults use a smartphone, of which 29% has never downloaded an app. However, things are changing - older adults are forecast to have the highest year-over-year smartphone adoption of any age demographic in developed countries. The increase in first time users amongst baby boomers is a huge step forward and inevitable to continue gaining traction. Health and wellbeing related apps are booming to accommodate the rapidly growing longevity economy worth an estimated $7.1 trillion.

We are conscious of this shift and have developed VIPE with the first time smartphone user in mind. Making the app as intuitive and straightforward as possible to position ourselves as a daily-use service to fulfil the basic needs of older adults.

2. Outdated National Health Service

The shortcomings of the NHS in the United Kingdom is well documented and debated amongst politicians. In a nutshell, the health system requires a huge overhaul to modernise infrastructure, gain significant efficiencies in patient care (from initial appointment -> diagnosis -> treatment) and promote health and wellbeing technologies that enable potential patients to better assess and manage their situation prior to visiting a hospital. (emergencies aside) Healthcare-related startups are slowly but surely being noticed by the NHS as it seeks to innovate.

We are amidst a turning point whereby VIPE can contribute as a main player in the modernisation of healthcare systems for pre-hospital care wellbeing and emergency response management.

3. Well-Funded Companies/ Tech Giants

Inevitably with lucrative opportunities springs competition in the healthcare startup scene. At this stage we acknowledge that without significant investment we are facing an uphill battle against well-funded companies and tech giants rolling out their own internal projects.

VIPE aims to be more than just a standalone app. In an ever congested app-space, consolidation of services in a single app is what is truly needed. We strive to be a comprehensive wellbeing platform where people visit us to manage their day-to-day lives, explore and engage with their trusted family and friends, access emergency services and discover relevant content.

Helping your Neighbours

We appreciate the fact that contributing financially may be challenging. We are grateful for your time and willingness to learn more about us. Please take a moment to show your love:

1. Download the VIPE App

2. Visit Our Website

3. Follow us on Twitter and LinkedIn 

4. Like us on Facebook and Instagram

5. Find us on AngelList, Tumblr, Product Hunt, Google+, Vine and Pinterest

6. Email Us

Thanks again for all your help! Together with your support, we can achieve something remarkable for our society.

story:
Where: LifeThyme CrossFit, 7 Dundonald Street, Hamilton, Bermuda
When: Saturday, December 8th, 2012
Cost: $50 LTC Members Only (Payment made to LifeThyme CrossFit)

We are hosting a CrossFit event to raise money for Raleigh Bermuda.  We believe that our CrossFit community and Raleigh have similar philosophies – Changing Lives!  Raleigh Bermuda is a charity (reg # 710) with a fully-funded personal development programme for young Bermudians aged 17 – 25. Their mission is to challenge young adults to realize their full potential, develop skills for life, and become the person thee want to be. At LifeThyme CrossFit, we support and challenge our members to train hard, take charge of their health and wellness and often, this changes their life. Both Raleigh and LifeThyme encourage their members to set and achieve challenging goals.

We support and empower people to take charge of their life.

What We Need 

We would like to raise enough funds to support one young adult for a year in the Raleigh Bermuda program.   This is why we hope to reach our goal of $12,000. Making a difference for one young adult will make a positive change in our community.

Our members will demonstrate hard work in a challenging WOD (Workout of the Day)in front of you and your family and friends in Bermuda's first CrossFit Event. Your generous donation will offer you the satisfaction in knowing that you have particpated in something bigger for Bermuda's Comminity - helping young adults change their lives. 

Fundraising

Please use our crowdfunding platform to make your donations for Raleigh Bermuda.  Pledge sheets will also be available. We are counting on you to help us reach our goal. 

 In the event that we don't reach our goal, the funds that are raised will go to support one of Raleigh's local events for young adults.

The Event

Schedule

8:30: Athlete registration and warm-up
8:45: Athlete briefing
9:00: Wave #1 begins, waves will continue at 15 min intervals.
12:00: Awards

Divisions

Open to all levels of CrossFit athletes of LifeThyme CrossFit

  • RX Men/Women  (The same prescribed weights for everyone)
  • Scaled Men/Women (Modified)
  • Masters Men/Women (ages 50+)

Format/Workout

Athletes compete in a series of events that are set up in a circuit format.  Movement standards and scaling will be discussed at the athlete briefing. The athletes begin their wave and do not stop moving until they have completed all stations of the competition. There is no down time in between stations. The athlete must dig deep for the duration of their wave.  Athletes will be given a start time the day before the event.  Judges will be at each station; however, the honor system will be strongly adhered to. 

 Scoring

Each athlete will need to complete each event before moving on to the next event.  This will be a timed event and your final time will determine the winner.  

Bring family & friends to watch this exciting event!  There will be no parking in our lot on the day of the event. Thank you for your support. We look forward to seeing you there on Dec 8.

 

Official site: www.lifethymecrossfit.com

Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/pages/LifeThyme-CrossFit/155423714545556

story:
do you suffer from...

...stress related headaches, stiffness or medical conditions such as disc problems or arthritis?  Below are some of the everyday causes or aggravators for painful neck complaints.


what is necksaviour?...

necksaviour is an effective and affordable product. It applies 'traction' to the neck, a proven treatment often administered by therapists (like me) to help relieve the above symptoms and many many more. I'm Wesley Marshall and I've been treating patients in this area as a Chartered Musculoskeletal Physiotherapist for 16 years. I have been developing necksaviour (patent pending) for the last 3 years with the goal to create a simple and effective clinic & 'home use' device for an age old list of problems. I believe necksaviour is the only sensible solution.

is necksaviour the perfect solution?...

Other than the fact that necksaviour actually works it is a great product because it fits into your life. When researching we found that most other products were either cumbersome, very expensive or just plain ridiculous. So it was important to develop a product that was light, portable, durable and without the need to set up any complicated apparatus. 


a portable & lightweight solution...

You can take  necksaviour anywhere with you. It's just 25.5cm x 23.5cm and weighs only 58g (2oz).  Simply pop it into your bag and you will be able to get rapid neck pain and headache relief whenever you need it, without having to take medication. 

what are the cost benefits?...

necksaviour's simple design not only means it is simple to use but also makes it affordable. Using necksaviour may significantly reduce the need to see your therapist for treatment.  The high quality foam materials mean necksaviour can be used time and time again.


what symptoms will necksaviour help?...

necksaviour can help both stress related physical symptoms and various medical conditions.

  • Headaches in many forms
  • Neck stiffness
  • Muscle spasm/tension
  • Joint inflammation
  • Disc problems
  • Arthritis
  • Upper limb referred pain
  • Wry neck
  • Sub acute whiplash
  • Plus many more


Drawing 1

Illustrates some common neck problems:





Drawing 2

Illustrates how necksaviour can relieve the symptoms:




how to use necksaviour...

Simply pop necksaviour under your neck when you are in a supine or reclining position.

  1. Activate necksaviour by bending it in half using your hands, trunk or leg.
  2. Position yourself on a comfortable surface.
  3. Lie down and place the folded necksaviour in a 'U' shape behind your neck.
  4. Fully relax onto necksaviour before releasing it.

Feel the benefit of a comfortable stretch of your neck.

1 necksaviour gives you 4 options

  1. Short neck & light force
  2. Short neck & strong force
  3. Long neck & light force
  4. Long neck & strong force

You can safely try all four options to see which suits you best. Different ones may suit you better at different times.


how to use necksaviour...

Click play to see how best to use neck saviour.




For more information and detailed instructions go to www.necksaviour.com

a safe product...

necksaviour is classed as a Grade 1 medical device and is in the process of being CE marked. It is suitable for most neck related complaints and has been tried and tested by the University of Hertfordshire (England).  The forces necksaviour delivers are well within safe limits. The foams used in the manufacture of necksaviour are completely skin friendly.

Please Note: necksaviour  (and all forms of traction) may not suitable for people with extremely severe neck injuries or very recent trauma to the neck or people suffering from severe rheumatoid arthritis (different to osteoarthritis which is the wearing/ageing process of joints). For any of the above conditions or if you have concerns regarding other conditions, including VBI (vertebrobasilar insufficiency) you should seek expert advice before using necksaviour. For more information go to www.necksaviour.com.


the story...

I am a Chartered musculoskeletal physiotherapist with 16 years experience in this field and I run a successful practice called HertsPhysio www.hertsphysio.com we achieve unrivalled results in our area. My team and I have spent tens of thousands of hours assessing and treating thousands of patients from elite athletes to children and the elderly.
We have a full understanding of what is therapeutic for numerous conditions including neck problems. Not satisfied with existing home use traction products I've felt for a long while that there must be better way, so I created one - necksaviour.


necksaviour is 'patent pending' and the first product to be launched by Epiphany Innovations, a brand new therapy, rehab and exercise product development company. Great innovation, cutting edge design and the use of advanced modern materials are at the heart of Epiphany Innovations.

nearing production...

A fully functioning  necksaviour prototype has been made and the moulding tool created. Funding is only required in order that we can start necksaviour production in sufficient quantities in order that unit costs are reasonable.

Each necksaviour comes in it's own drawstring backpack.

product family...

necksaviour is going to be a family of products which will include a necksaviour−pillow, necksaviour-super compact and a modular system to stretch the entire spine.

Epiphany Innovations will also launching a brand new type of soft tissue injury support. 'Offloader' will be ideal for tendinitis and works in in the same way therapists do when they 'Offload tape' an injury site.


delivery time line...

We aim to ship the first orders of necksaviour in June/July 2014.


please share necksaviour :)

Please help us and people with neck problems by sharing this campaign on facebook and twitter by using the share buttons at the top of the page below the video.

Get a necksaviour for free!!

1/ Sign up to Indiegogo.

This is incredibly simple, just name and e mail needed and no bank details are required. You will receive an e mail asking you to verify your e mail address.

2/ Share the necksaviour campaign using the share tools at the top of the page, while signed in.

3/ If 4 people you have shared the campaign with buy a necksaviour you will get a necksaviour for free.

It's even easier if you make a contribution to necksaviour.  Use the 'share' tabs on the e mail Indiegogo sent you immediately after contributing.

Note: Indiegogo let us know exactly who has shared the campaign and which purchasers bought a necksaviour as a result - so you don't have to worry!


send us a pic!

When you have your necksaviour we would love you to share a photo with us on facebook book or twitter showing us :) 


https://www.facebook.com/pages/Necksaviour/465634720234554?fref=ts

https://twitter.com/necksaviour

or send us an email to: info@necksaviour.com

On line store coming soon at www.necksaviour.com



A big thank you…

I would like to say a massive thanks to all our backers and also to:

  • Richard, Andy and Greg the brilliant designers at PDT
  • Daniel Irons at Facade media for his great videography.
  • George for the jingle.
  • Mike Aldridge at WPKD for his design and marketing expertise.
  • Chris Aldridge of Harrison IP for making the complicated subject of Intellectual property and patenting clear.
  • Phil Green and Peter Benson at the University of Hertfordshire for their advice and testing expertise.
  • Richard Hunter at Printola for his fantastic print work.
  • David Roker for his excellent photography.
  • Kate Cornish for all her help and advice.
  • Lastly to family and friends for their support and encouragement and modelling!

story:
We are almost there!

We would love to cross the finish line with you!

Yogaboots is entering the final steps before we can produce our long awaited home fitness program.  We just need a little help.

Yogaboots is a customizable fitness DVD/Blu-Ray that takes into consideration your current mood and how much free time you have at any given time!  Too often, quality products never reach the public due to "red-tape" and/or public funding hurdles. We created Yogaboots for the people; and, it is the people that will bring Yogaboots to life!

The Yogaboots ﬁtness DVD will have the unique feature of allowing the user to select how they are feeling and the amount of time they have to exercise in the DVD menu (5-60min intervals). The DVD will then automatically select and combine each component of the workout based on these factors.  Yogaboots ﬁtness DVD’s will revolutionize the home ﬁtness world by providing a customized work out every time.

It has been a dream to offer the same quality of workout responsible for creating Olympic level athletes to the general public. The secret was to create a workout that was equally challenging as it was inviting.  The beauty and love that this program was created with; in conjunction, with the science to back it up (under the watchful eye of Dr. Linda Blade, PhD, Keinisiology) will give everyone a special option when creating a better version of themselves.

Check out this video we shot at a Yogaboots demo class!


Follow us on Twitter:@yogaboots 

Feel Free to click on our Facebook page and "like" us to keep up-to-date with all things Yogaboots!

WE NEED $45,000 TO BRING THIS TO THE WORLD IN A MAJOR WAY

We have raised over half of the budget required to get this show off the ground.  The last bit of funding will allow us to begin principle production on the DVD/BLU-RAY and have our infomercial shot and on-air in the first week of December.  This is a HUGE milestone as we can then become available for Christmas shopping and New Years resolutions.

As this is not our sole funding source, we want to ensure our backers that this project will be completed.  However, the support of the community we are creating it for is the most important aspect.

We feel very strongly that your financial support will allow us to take the product to the next level.  For more information on the next steps of the project and bios of our team, please visit www.yogaboots.info.

IF YOU CANT HELP IN A FINANCIAL WAY... PLEASE SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND HELP THIS PROJECT SEE THE LIGHT OF DAY.

story:
THE GAVIN CHRISTOPHER LEGACY

GAVIN CHRISTOPHER is a singer-songwriter producer extraordinaire, known the world around for many musical gifts. He has been entertaining us for decades with his chart topping hit songs and production abilities. One of Gavin's early memorable co writing achievments was the mega hit ONCE YOU GET STARTED for Rufus and Chaka Khan. A favorite of many is also his magical vocals on Herbie Hancock's STARS IN YOUR EYES from the 1980 MONSTER album. Gavin is instrumental in launching many powerful musical careers with his songs and touch.

Gavin also enjoyed a solo career along the way, most noteably with  the beautiful love song YOU ARE WHO YOU LOVE, and dance hit ONE STEP CLOSER TO YOU.

Mr Christopher works non stop, thriving on the beats of the music-the very beats of his heart. But recently Mr Christopher was struck down with CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE. He is currently in a Chicago hospital where doctors are attempting to stablize him....

WHAT HE NEEDS

Mr Christopher has endured 2 heart surgeries and is currently in the hospital being stabilized, possibly facing a third. Upon his release, due to a recovery period, he will not be able to work or generate income. This funding site has been set up to be able to support his recovery needs, down to the basics of a caregiver, rent, utilities, and food. The hope is to raise enough money to be able ease the financial stress and to provide Mr Christopher with time to heal.

THE IMPACT OF YOUR GENEROSITY

By contributing a donation be it large or small, you will not only be helping a fellow human being in time of need, but you will personally become a part of the recovery of this musical icon, helping him not only to heal and regain a good qualitly of life, but a hope of return to the stage, where clearly he thrives.

He has been touching our hearts for decades.

It is time to reach out and touch his....

Other Ways You Can Help

If by chance making a donation is just not possible for you at this time, but your heart is connected to his, please consider sharing this funding site with as many of your friends as possible. That in itself will be of tremendous value and will be greatly appreciated. Please look up The Gavin Christopher Recovery Fund Page on Facebook for further information and a way to share with your friends and get the word out.

In conclusion, I simply thank you for taking the time to visit this page.

Blessings to you and yours,

Linda Dalziel

Friend

story:
Bringing Acupuncture Home

My Husband Guy Wells and I opened the practice here in Denton in January 2015 and we need your help to continue the work that we are called to do.  We have invested a considerable amount of our savings, and have taken on debt, to manifest this dream to help and to assist others. We opened here for a couple of reasons. One we live here this is our hometown. The second is that this is an underserved area. I am the only full time Acupuncturist in Caroline Co. Md. I want to bring to the area the benefits of this form of medicine. I am also a Reiki Master and Guy is a long time Reiki Practitioner and is also a Pangu Qigong Instructor ( Pangu Qigong is a form of Qigong that allows a individual to build their Qi energy which improves their Health and is very simple to learn).

We were running a Free Veterans Clinic twice a month at the Local American Legion until Dec. to give back to our veterans and their families for their sacrifice. We are looking at this time for another location locally to hold  these sessions and looking to expand the program to Easton with the assistance of another Acupuncturist.  While we offer regular private acupuncture services along with the Chinese Herbals, we are looking at offering Community Acupuncture Services a couple days a week.    

Why Help Now?

It takes time to become known in an area, especially a rural one, and your assistance will help us over the hump. It often takes years for a practice to hit its stride and we are ready to persevere. Please share this campaign on social media as in addition to donations, it is publicity.


More About Gina Beth Hamlin, Lac.

I have a Master of Acupuncture Degree from the Academy for Five Element Acupuncture in Gainesville, Florida.  This is a 36-month program based in the ancient energies of the Five Elements. Which are rooted in traditional Taoist philosophy of the cycles of nature.  The tradition of Five Element Acupuncture is based on the understanding of the cyclical flow of vital energy-also known as Qi.  Each of the Five Elements – Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal and Water – represents a distinct quality of the Qi energy that is vital to the continued health and flow of nature.  In this program I was taught the skills of traditional diagnosis and treatment planning as well as understanding the influences lifestyle has on the whole of a person’s health and well being and how the constitutional factor plays a big role in the health and balance of a person’s body, mind and spirit. While I was in the Acupuncture program I also took the Chinese Herbal Studies Certificate course, this is a 27-mounth course in the use of Chinese Herbs. We learned the Eight Principle/Zang Fu diagnosis and treatment models that are the foundation of Chinese herbal studies. For both of these programs there was class work and clinical internships to apply and understand what was learned in the real world. There were technique courses on Point Location, Needle Technique, Pulse Diagnosis, and Taking Case Histories for both Acupuncture and Chinese Herbs. There were also classes in self-development such as Qigong, Meditation, and developing the sensitivity of the Practitioner to interact with the client and people around the Practitioner.

After graduation and with licensure continuing education is and ongoing part of being a Licensed Acupuncturist, I like that there is always more to learn and no limit to how far one can go. I am also a Usui Reiki Master

story:
About 6 months ago, when I had just delivered my second baby an opportunity arose, my husband Jerlin Johny got a job in Singapore. Since I dint want to stay away from him at this stage, we decided to sell off everything that we owned in India and moved base to Singapore so that we could live decently from the beginning.

The Singaporean company said, only after Jerlin’s visa was approved we would start receiving his salary. It wasn’t a problem because they said they would compensate his salary as soon as the procedure was done. So we continued living on the money we had brought from India.

After 3 months we found out the reason that was acting as a hurdle in the procedure. Jerlin’s medical wasn’t getting cleared. We had almost exhausted our finances by now, we decided to come back to India and get his treatment done. Luckily his office agreed to grant us leave. When we came back to India 2 months ago, we realised that he was critically ill.  

My Husband Jerlin Johny 37 years old has been detected with Liver Cirrhosis at a serious and critical stage. Cirrhosis has caused an infection of TB in the ascitic fluid. We have been in the hospital for more than 2 months now and soon have to do a transplant on him as this case has been termed as "Child C" by the Doctors here at Medical trust hospital in Cochin, Kerala India.

Only after the infection comes down, the doctors will go ahead with his transplant. While the infection persists, the transplant cannot be done for he may not make it through or if with a slim chance he does, he will definitely slip into coma. But till then we live in a massive fear that his liver could just give up.

My daughter Nenita (6 years), Son Liam (8 months) and I are completely dependent on Jerlin. He is the backbone of our house. I secretly also fear on how will I raise INR 20 lakhs for this transplant. I request you’ll to generously donate as much as you can and please help me. I request you’ll to keep us in your prayers as we need all the blessings.

I also pray that no one goes through such testing times. It is like living hell, I have only been running to and fro managing the kids, the younger one is still on feed and taking care of my husband too.

Thanking each one of you in advance!!!

God Bless you all...

Nisha Jerlin
story_txt:
About 6 months ago,
when I had just delivered my second baby an opportunity arose, my husband Jerlin
Johny got a job in Singapore. Since I dint want to stay away from him at this
stage, we decided to sell off everything that we owned in India and moved base
to Singapore so that we could live decently from the beginning.
The Singaporean company said,
only after Jerlin’s visa was approved we would start receiving his salary. It wasn’t
a problem because they said they would compensate his salary as soon as the
procedure was done. So we continued living on the money we had brought from
India.
After 3 months we found out the
reason that was acting as a hurdle in the procedure. Jerlin’s medical wasn’t getting
cleared. We had almost exhausted our finances by now, we decided to come back
to India and get his treatment done. Luckily his office agreed to grant us
leave. When we came back to India 2 months ago, we realised that he was critically
ill.  
My Husband Jerlin Johny 37 years old has been detected with
Liver Cirrhosis at a serious and critical stage. Cirrhosis has caused an
infection of TB in the ascitic fluid. We have been in the hospital for
more than 2 months now and soon have to
do a transplant on him as this case has been termed as "Child C" by the Doctors here at Medical trust hospital
in Cochin, Kerala India.
Only after the infection comes down, the doctors will go ahead
with his transplant. While the infection persists, the transplant cannot be
done for he may not make it through or if with a slim chance he does, he will definitely
slip into coma. But till then we live in a massive fear that his liver could
just give up.
My daughter Nenita (6 years), Son Liam (8 months) and I are
completely dependent on Jerlin. He is the backbone of our house.
I secretly also fear on how will I raise INR 20 lakhs for this transplant. I
request you’ll to generously donate as much as you can and please help me. I
request you’ll to keep us in your prayers as we need all the blessings.
I also pray that no one goes
through such testing times. It is like living hell, I have only been running to
and fro managing the kids, the younger one is still on feed and taking care of my husband too.Thanking each one of you in advance!!!God Bless you all...Nisha Jerlin

story:
Running the Marathon for Oisin’s Wish List & Diffuse Infiltrating Pontine Glioma (DIPG) research

A few weeks ago we learned our Friends son had been diagnosed with a brain tumour, one which has no cure. Oisin's story can be found on this blog - http://butterflyboyoisin.wordpress.com/oisins-story/

Aidan Blighe & Kieran Culhane are going to run the upcoming Dublin City Marathon to help raise money that can go toward a fund to enable Oisin to fulfill his wish list and also toward research for Diffuse Infiltrating Pontine Glioma (DIPG).

We would ask that everyone  sponsor this cause so we can help try make this very difficult time for Barry, Sheila & their family a little bit easier & to try make every day for Oisin very special.
We would ask at the very least that you take the time to read Oisin's blog. This alone will help raise awareness of Diffuse Infiltrating Pontine Glioma.

If you can donate your donation will help fund some wonderful experiences for Oisin, as well as go toward sensory equipment for Temple Street Hospital and research into Diffuse Infiltrating Pontine Glioma, currently a non - treatable type of brain tumour. (please note donations are in USD - current exchange approx .78 cent = 1 dollar, or else 1 euro = 1.28 dollar)
Anyone else who knows Barry & Sheila, is running Dublin City Marathon or just wants to join this campaign is more than welcome to come on board and get involved.
You can also help by donating directly on Oisin's blog - http://butterflyboyoisin.wordpress.com/donations/

story:
THE PLAN:

We will install a proprietary electro-purification system in the city of Santiago de los Caballeros to provide clean water for daily use and to help kill water borne-bacteria responsible for the cholera epidemic in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. This is the first of several planned projects throughout the region.

THE PROBLEM:

The Dominican Republic has a severe shortage of clean water and is experiencing the largest cholera epidemic in modern times.  It has sickened over 30,000 people and killed 472 in the Dominican Republic since November 2010. In neighboring Haiti, it has infected more than 700,000 people and caused 8,721 deaths since October 2010.

Officials in Haiti and the Dominican Republic are preparing for a long campaign against cholera, the water-borne disease that has sickened tens of thousands of people in the two neighboring Caribbean countries.  Acting together, the two governments are working on a project to wipe out the disease on Hispaniola by 2022. The plan will include substantial spending on clean water and sanitation.

THE SOLUTION AND TECHNOLOGY :

To purify water on an urban scale, the Santiago de los Caballeros Water Project calls for the installation of a Neptune CF Oxygenation System which will process over 50,000 gallons of water per day. The Neptune CF System will kill all water-borne bacteria, including the Cholera Bacteria, as well as other water-borne parasites and bacteria.

·  The Neptune CF is a patent pending technology that uses oxygen ions from generated ozone to neutralize and remove biological, organic and chemical contaminants. The system can process 50,000 gallons a day of contaminated water.

·  The Neptune CF System requires no consumables or chemicals and has no moving parts other than the water in treatment. 

·  Since it doesn’t require harsh chemicals such as chlorine or chemical acids, the Neptune CF System will not have a negative impact on the environment, and will reduce the costs of water treatment.

·  The Neptune CF System requires only 20% of the electrical energy that the nearest commercially available solution requires per volume of water treated.

The project will include installation and support for integrating the Neptune CF System into the metropolitan water system servicing the city and suburbs of Santiago de los Caballeros, which currently services approximately 60 percent of households supporting 329,000 inhabitants. The city is currently upgrading its pumping systems and other infra-structure, so now would be a good time to install a decontamination system.

In recent years the continuity of potable water supply services in Santiago has been affected by strong population growth due to increased immigration from other areas of the country.

Various factors affect the water quality in the Dominican Republic, including: poor condition of purification systems, minimal operational controls, low level of maintenance of treatment plants, and mostly intermittent systems. 38.4% of water systems have no chlorination system installed. The fact that a chlorination system exists is not a guarantee that water is actually properly disinfected, and water contaminated by bacteria is an ongoing problem.

THE NEED FOR PURE WATER IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES

Stopping water-borne diseases is one of the most important global public health issues in the world today. Everyone has the obligation to do everything possible to provide clean, purified drinking water to our neighbors in developing countries. Water, sanitation and hygiene are all intimately connected to the advancement of developing countries.

Diseases related to water include those due to micro-organisms such as the bacteria which causes cholera. There are also other diseases related to parasites that have at least part of their life cycle in water. Diseases such as malaria have water-related vectors. Certain pulmonary diseases are caused by bacteria in water droplets.

According to the United Nations World Health Organization, every year there are 1.6 million diarrheal deaths related to unsafe water, sanitation, and hygiene—the vast majority among children under 5. More than one billion people lack access to an improved water source.

*  An estimated 2.4 billion people lack adequate sanitation and 1.1 billion people are without access to safe water.

*  90% of wastewater in developing countries is discharged into rivers and streams without any treatment.

* There are 1.6 million deaths per year attributed to dirty water and poor sanitation.

* In the past ten years, diarrhea related to unsanitary water has killed more children than all the people lost to armed conflict since WWII.

* At any one time, it is estimated that half the world's hospital beds are occupied with patients suffering from water-borne diseases.

* The average distance that women in developing countries walk to collect water per day is four miles and the average weight that women carry on their heads is approximately 44 pounds.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

Please join us in providing a much needed resource to the people of the Dominican Republic.

ABOUT THE COMPANY

We are a U.S. based company that has been providing cutting edge  environmental remediation and water purification solutions since 2010.

story: Cycling is a shared passion of ours. It has been a tough year for Emily on the bike. After her big accident last summer it took a while to recover. She was back to her normal self for a few months and we were finally able to enjoy our rides together. I upgraded several things on her Lemond and everyone was happy. A few weeks ago someone broke in our new RV and stole her bike (among other things), leaving her bike-less. We went to insurance which was recently purchased to cover the RV and our personal belongings, but insurance won't cover it. Thanks Progressive! After putting all of our savings into our new home, my lady is left with no bike and no funds to buy a new one. This is where you come in. Please help me make my baby happy again. It has been very hard for her and it hurts me to watch her watching all the other bikes go by with out her. Every dollar counts. Please help us! I love you, Emily.

story:
My medical bills are so expensive that I need to purchase a plan from Healthcare.gov


I lost my health care plan when the Affordable Health Care Act was introduced in January 2014, right while I was going through testing on my heart which was brought to a halt right when I was told I had a heart enlargement:
  • My name is John-David Feldman, I live in Florida and because the Governor is blocking the increase in medicare subsidies I have to pay full price for ObamaCare.
  • I have been in the hospital on and off for the last 2 weeks due to complications they are referring me to a physician and with all the hospital bills I racked up it is going end up costing over $1500.
  • If I do not get this testing done I could have a stroke I am only 33 years old I don't want to die.
I do not qualify for Medicare or Disability unless I get more testing to bring to the Social Security office.

Unfortunately my life has a price tag on it I am at the mercy of Florida's broken health care industry.

Here is where the money is going:

  • I have to pay to get insurance and pay my medical bills.
  • Help to pay for living expenses until I can get back to work.
  • Your help no matter how much will have a huge impact on my life.

If you cannot help financial please pray for me.

If you can't help please send this around to people who can:

  • I need you guys to get out and make some noise about this campaign the squeaky wheel gets grease and I will be sqeaking as long as I am physically able to. 
  • Please Use the Indiegogo share tools to pass this campaign around!

story:
Featured On

              

           "This week, we came across an Indiegogo project that we wanted to highlight particularly for all Indians, especially those who live in Delhi, which was recently acknowledged as the most polluted city in the world" 

           "Using Wepo, you'll be able to regularly see information about air quality, and be more conscious about pollution"

            

          "Wepo is a small, carbon-monoxide-sensing box that’s worn on the belt and notifies users about the quality of the air around them"

             

           "A new device that's good for your health and compatible with your smart watch is in the works, only instead of counting your steps it tells you where to go for cleaner air"    

              

           "Wepo is meant to be a good companion for your smart watch, to fight air pollution & restore the Right to Air quality in a new way, also for cleaner and greener future"

              

          "Wepo is your personal pollution detector"

5 decades have gone, we haven't heard the words of Mr. Lyndon B. Johnson, loud and clear. Still we are in a perpetual state of denial on the issues of air pollution. Air pollution is not only an American problem, its a global issue and it is time to move forward and restore Right to Air.

  • to disrupt how you WATCH air quality
  • to be a Wearable You'll Actually Wear - Every Day
  • to empower citizens to know about air quality conveniently on their wrist
  • to be a good companion for your Smart Watch
  • to fight Air Pollution & restore the Right to Air quality in a Smart way
  • for cleaner and greener future 


Wepo is incorporated with powerful technologies into something very small enough to wear and to create entirely new experience on how we look and feel about at the air quality around us. The first generation of Wepo is packed with Carbon Monoxide sensors. Successive variants of Wepo with Nitrogen Dioxide sensors, Particulate Matter sensors and much more pollutants will be made available soon.

Wepo is packed with one of the most accurate miniature carbon monoxide sensor in such a small footprint .The Electrochemical Carbon Monoxide sensor in Wepo is tested rigorously for its accuracy .


Wepo app is available for iOS, Android ( 4.3 and above ) and Tizen devices (Galaxy Gear S Smartwatch). Android wear smart watch platform is also supported. The mobile app allows you to track air quality, and over time, helps you see trends in the way environment changes, allowing you to make smart decisions.

Get the information on air quality conveniently on your wrist with the help of Wepo

We have been working on Wepo for the past one year and have successfully developed a working prototype and functional app. Wepo has undergone several successful rounds of prototyping, testing and validation. We are now designing and fabricating a larger lot of systems in support of an alpha test program.

We are currently focusing on:

  • Finalizing engineering design & schematics for production
  • Fine tuning iOS,Android and Tizen smart watch app to ensure it works flawlessly
  • Developing sophisticated analytics and data visualization in the app



We are currently on track to deliver Wepo to backers in July 2015, and we're excited to keep all of our backers up to date on progress and developments!




We're overwhelmed with the feed back and questions received here, on email, Facebook and everywhere. Here are the questions more frequently asked! Feel free to leave a comment or email us at info@getmywepo.com

1. How it is weared?

Wepo comes with an accessory clip which you can clip on your belt . Wepo can also be weared as a pendant .

2. Do I need to have a smart watch for working of Wepo?

For Better User experience of Wepo we highly recommend Smart Watch

You can get the data on your Android phone or iphone using the respective Wepo app.  We have developed an app for the android wear and tested it on galaxy gear live and Tizen based Galaxy Gear S Smart watch. 

3. Does it supports apple watch?

We will be working with Apple Watch to deliver an even better user experience ( as soon as we get our hands on one of them ).

4. How long the battery last?

As per our test results, the  2000 mAh battery lasts for 20 hours of continuous usage.

5. Is Wepo waterproof?

Not yet, we are working on the design to make it water proof.

6. Why Wepo measures only Carbon Monoxide?

Wepo is a platform that we are building. Our first iteration is with the Carbon Monoxide sensor as prolonged exposure to Carbon Monoxide is harmful when breathed because it displaces oxygen in blood and deprives the heart, brain and other organs of oxygen which ultimately reduces your life span.

In our next iterations we plan to come up with Nitrogen Dioxide, Particulate matter and Ozone sensors, etc.

Carbon monoxide (CO) gas forms primarily when carbon fuels are not burned completely. Mobile sources account for the majority of CO emissions These sources include both on-road vehicles (e.g., cars, trucks, motorcycles) and nonroad vehicles and engines (e.g., farm equipment, construction equipment, aircraft, marine vessels). Consequently, high concentrations of CO generally occur in areas with heavy traffic congestion. In cities, as much as 95 percent of all CO emissions may come from automobile exhaust). Other sources of CO emissions include industrial processes, non-transportation fuel combustion, and natural sources, such as wildfires.(Source : US EPA )

7. What are the dimensions and weight of Wepo?

Dimensions: 1.8"x1.3"x1.7". Weight: 98 g.

8. I have more questions, do you have answers?

Yes! Please leave a comment on the COMMENT tab at the top of the page, or email us at info@getmywepo.com and we will try to reply as soon as possible.

9. What kind of tests are performed on Wepo's sensors?

Every Carbon Monoxide sensor used in Wepo is tested for its accuracy by calibrating it with known Carbon Monoxide standard cylinders.

We have been working for more than one year developing Wepo and getting it ready for production. We know what the next steps are for manufacturing and have great partners ready to start. However, we know that before mass production begins, we may encounter some problems. We have plans to mitigate all the risks.

Manufacturing: We need to create tooling to manufacture different parts of the product. This process is complex and requires time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle the risk, we've selected partners who can work closely with us through the whole manufacturing process.

Software: The software and app are functional, Software development sometimes gets tricky and takes longer than expected, but we have a lot of experience in this area and if necessary will look for additional help to solve any problems that could emerge.

We have the team to overcome all challenges, as we've done so far. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you and deliver it right on time. We will be distributing regular updates to all of our backers outlining progress, as well as the introduction of any roadblocks that could impact our planned production timeline.
