We have been working for more than one year developing Wepo and getting it ready for production. We know what the next steps are for manufacturing and have great partners ready to start. However, we know that before mass production begins, we may encounter some problems. We have plans to mitigate all the risks.
Manufacturing: We need to create tooling to manufacture different parts of the product. This process is complex and requires time and money. Complications could potentially emerge and delay the manufacturing schedule. To tackle the risk, we've selected partners who can work closely with us through the whole manufacturing process.
Software: The software and app are functional, Software development sometimes gets tricky and takes longer than expected, but we have a lot of experience in this area and if necessary will look for additional help to solve any problems that could emerge.
We have the team to overcome all challenges, as we've done so far. Our goal is to make the best possible product for you and deliver it right on time. We will be distributing regular updates to all of our backers outlining progress, as well as the introduction of any roadblocks that could impact our planned production timeline.

story: Campaign finished
story_txt: Campaign finished

story:
The Purrch was developed by Eric Hosler, a concert violinist and violin teacher, for his students and himself, as an aid to correct posture. Little did he realize that the Purrch would become much, much more.




Every time someone new sees the Purrch there seems to be another use for it.  Our research subjects included people who use stand-up computers, golf tournament spectators, soccer moms and dads, musicians, beauticians and barbers, to name a few of the many ways they tested the Purrch to great effect. 






The Purrch's patented arching shaft is bent from strong but lightweight aluminum. It will easily hold people weighing up to 400 pounds. The arc allows the Purrch to meet the floor at the perfect angle for optimum function, reliability and comfort.



The exceptional polyurethane rubber compound for our custom designed foot was selected after extensive testing of materials to ensure the safest and best adhesion to the floor - and the unique foot pattern on the bottom provides the ultimate in gripping potential on the widest possible variety of surfaces, both indoors and out.



We tested hundreds of seats trying to find the right mix of comfort and support for the Purrch. We finally realized that we had to make our own seat. Covered with vinyl and filled with memory foam, our seat is exceptionally comfortable and durable.

The Purrch is great for most people who have to be on their feet or on their seat for long periods of time.  The Purrch takes 50% to 67% of your weight off of your feet and thereby relieves the stress on your ankles, knees, hips and eases your back into a more comfortable upright position.




We’ve spent four years and $100,000.00 in product development costs and legal fees, and two years field testing the prototypes that were created. We’re finally ready to launch the Purrch and order the first production pieces. This is where YOU, our supporters come in. Be the first to own the Purrch and be a part of introducing it to the rest of the world. By becoming a sponsor you will be pre ordering your Purrch before it’s available to the general public and at a 30% discount from the suggested retail price of $100.00. We’ll also throw in free shipping.As our tag line says…'Where will YOU Purrch?’ Thank you for supporting the Purrch.

story:
Camp Kilarunna: a Terror 5K

Camp Kilarunna is a fully immersive horror experience and terror 5K. A weekend-long haunted house with no escape. What starts out with potato sack races and Kumbaya ends with you running for your life into the darkness. 

Campers will arrive Saturday morning. The day will start bright and early with breakfast and fun. The grounds of the campsite are in a picturesque part of Pennsylvania, 3 hours east of Pittsburgh and 3 hours west of Philadelphia. We have full run of the grounds, which include miles and miles for hiking, a lake for boating, a full mess hall for dining, basketball and tennis courts, stables, and a ball field.  

After lunch, campers will return to their cabins to rest before the big race. The counselors will give everyone a bit of the local history before the 5K...and that's when things get scary. We'll do some traditional camp songs around a bonfire as the afternoon winds down, and as the sun begins to set we start the race. While campers run the 5K course, they will have to defend themselves from the creatures in the woods. People may jump out and chase, intimidate, or startle runners. Don't worry, no one will get hurt! We're just here to have a scary good time.  

For those who survive the race, we'll party until dawn. Classic horror movies, beer, wine, and music wrap up the night.  The after party is sponsored by Straub and Clique Vodka - you are guaranteed to have a good time...if you make it out alive. 

Overnight accommodations vary from outdoor bring-your-own-tent camping and classic indoor cabins shared with bunkmates.

Campers leave on Sunday by mid-morning. 

Food will be provided: a light breakfast on Saturday morning, a late lunch pre-race, post-race dinner, and more during the after-party. We'll send you on your way with a full belly Sunday morning. 

Not into running for your life? We'll be showing classic horror movies on the big screen in the lodge.  

Dates available for camping: 

October 11-12, 2014

October 18-19, 2014

October 25-26, 2014

***

As horror lovers, we have been dreaming up a fun weekend like this for years - so we've decided to take a stab at it. All we need is you.


What We Need & What You Get

To make this happen, we need a campsite, actors and actresses, make-up artists, food, insurance, and a million other little things. The devil is in the details. 

Your contributions will go toward funding this nightmare. We envision this as an annual event happening each weekend in October. We need to start with a bang. After this funding campaign ends, we'll begin advertising in Pittsburgh and Philadelphia. While we work on lining up official sponsorship, we'll need capital to work with in order to get the word out. 

By getting on board early and supporting us you will have a major edge over the competition. You can claim your room now and start training for the 5K. After all, only the strong survive. 

If our goal is not met, the dream won't die. We want this to be as unbelievable as we envision it. No guts, no gory!

Donations made at any level will get you an invitation to our super VIP private party and slasher movie double feature at the Hollywood Theater on September 8th. More spooky details to follow.

Learn about our team

Justin White - By day, he works in the film industry; by night, he falls asleep to the soothing screams of Halloween. He will be writing the script for the counselors to follow throughout the weekend. His inspiration is a scary Wet Hot American Summer. 

Michelle Mitchell - A professional pill pusher at several local pharmacies, she will be selecting our actors and actresses, coordinating volunteers, and organizing the games.

Nicole White - Half of the event planning team On the Nose Events, she will be in charge of all the behind the screams action and making sure everything (and everyone) runs smoothly.

Laura Pliskin - An artistic coordinator and creative genius, she will be using her years of On the Nose Events experience to make every weekend a nightmare come true. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share this with every creep you know!

As we get closer to October, we'll be looking for volunteers, too. Be sure to check the site for more info: www.campkilarunna.com

story:
Short Summary

Phi Kappa Tau's Annual Safe Sets Philanthropy is a volleyball tournament held in an effort to raise money in order to send seriously ill children to Camp Boggy Creek (explanation below). In an effort to help raise money for this event I have decided I am going to raise money in order to cut my hair. The more funds the shorter it goes!


"

Welcome to Camp Boggy Creek. A place of dreams, of joy, of possibilities. A camp where children with serious illnesses and their families can forget the word “no” for a little while and embrace the promise of “yes”.

Camp Boggy Creek was founded in 1996 by Paul Newman and General H. Norman Schwarzkopf, with one simple premise in mind, that every child, no matter their illness, could experience the transformational spirit and friendships that go hand in hand with camp.

With unobtrusive expert medical care, it was their dream that Camp would provide seriously ill children with a fun-filled experience defined by compassion, laughter and acceptance.

Since 1996, Camp Boggy Creek has made it possible for children with serious illnesses to enjoy a camp experience in a safe, medically-sound environment. Located just a short drive from Orlando, Florida, the 232-acre camp serves children ages 7-16 who’ve  been diagnosed with chronic or life-threatening conditions.

Camp Boggy Creek never charges campers to attend and never asks them to contribute anything other than a positive, playful attitude.

As a year-round retreat, Camp Boggy Creek is able to serve thousands for campers and their families through activity-packed weekly and weekend camp programs. The camp offers children the chance to catch their first fish, go horseback riding or climb our ropes  tower, all while making new friends.

Beyond boundless fun, Camp Boggy Creek provides fellowship. Children can spend time with others who are just like them and share their life-experiences, which serves as a reminder that they are not alone. "

What We Need & What You Get

We have a goal set at 2000 dollars which would result in a "1" buzz cut to hair that has been long for more than 15 years.

***All money donated will go directly to the Philanthropy***

story:
A LONGER, HEALTHIER LIFE

We all want to live longer healthier lives. You may be as fit as a fiddle and seek out natural, healthy foods and drinks. Or, your health may be under attack. Diseases like high blood pressure, diabetes, high cholesterol and cancer are so wide spread that we all know a loved one or friend who’s been touched by one of these conditions. It might be a mom or dad, an aunty or uncle, a cousin or a dear friend. You might be a survivor.

Mamaki is a natural healing herb that grows in Hawaii’s tropical rainforest.  Help us create new delicious tea blends with mamaki so more people can benefit from the power of this superplant.  

 

MAMAKI: WELLNESS IN A CUP

Mamaki (Pipturus albidus) is a plant that is indigenous to the Hawaiian Rainforest. It grows no where else in the world. We have been in the tea business since 1995 and have worked with mamaki for 10 years. The way we used to get mamaki was from foragers who would pick it in the wild. The amount we could get was very limited.

Now, this remarkable plant is being grown on a sustainable and pristine farm on the Big Island of Hawaiʻi. 


Mamaki Farm on the Island of Hawaiʻi (The Big Island)


Nutritious foods resemble parts of the body they can help

Carrots contain beta carotene which decreases muscular degeneration in the eye. The cross section of a carrot resembles a human eye.


Walnuts look like mini brains and are high in omega 3 fatty acids which support healthy brain function.


Tomatoes are multi chambered on the inside like the heart and contain lycopene which can reduce the risk of heart disease.


The mamaki leaf resembles a network of veins and blood vessels. Mamaki is a natural source of potent antioxidants and nutrients that purifies and regulates healthy blood balance.


Mamaki contains:

  • Antioxidants
  • Rutin
  • Potassium
  • Magnesium
  • Antiviral properties
  • Cancer inhibiting properties


A LONG HISTORY OF BEING SAFE

For centuries, kahuna or traditional Hawaiian healers have used mamaki to maintain health and fight diseases so it has a long history of being safe. According to the Journal of Food Science, mamaki leaves have therapeutic value to regulate blood sugar, blood pressure and cholesterol. It was first recommended in western medicine by Dr. Terry Shintani, founder of the Hawaii Diet.


Mamaki Wellness is:

  • 100% Natural
  • Caffeine Free
  • Allergen Free
  • Gluten Free
  • Sugar Free
  • Hormone Free
  • Calorie Free
  • GMO free


WHY WE NEED YOU

Grown in Hawai’i. Healing worldwide. This is our vision but there are hurdles to overcome.

Any new product line requires significant upfront costs.  Your backing will help us purchase the ingredients to make the blend, print new tea bag envelopes and complete our first run of this healthy drink.

Mamaki costs $150 a pound and we need to purchase a minimum of 50 lbs.  To be cost effective, we also have to produce a minimum run of 50,000 tea bags.

As a project backer, you will be able to experience the benefits of mamaki at a fraction of what it would cost to purchase a pound.  You will be one of the first to enjoy Mamaki Wellness Tea.


Whole leaf tea bags cost more than common paper tea bags but they offer a distinct advantage. These bags allow the ingredients to be cut into larger pieces which help retain more of their natural nutrients.

Each tea bag will be wrapped in an individual air tight envelope that locks in freshness, flavor and nutrition. These envelopes make it more convenient to take Wellness in a Cup everywhere you go.


So please back our project and join the fight to live longer, healthier lives for you and those you love…one cup at a time.

A LITTLE ABOUT US

The Tea Chest has been a purveyor of some of the finest teas in the world since 1995 earning the company a reputation for having products that deliver outstanding taste and quality.

In 2004 the firm's Original Blend Nilgiri Iced Tea was selected Best Iced Tea in America in the first national tea tasting competition sponsored by the US Tea Association. The company has been recognized for using organic certified, natural and sustainable ingredients. It works with local farmers to cultivate and process local ingredients to create products that distinctly represent Hawaii.

The company’s products are served and sold by distinguished establishments like Alan Wong’s Restaurant, Halekulani Hotel, The Westin Moana Surfrider, Four Seasons Resorts, Mauna Kea Beach Hotel, The Prince Hotel Waikiki and Whole Foods Market.


The company has been featured in Gourmet Magazine, Business Week, Hawai’i Magazine and on CNN.


TESTIMONIES

“There is nobody who knows tea like Byron and Satomi Goo. They offer more than 100 varieties of tea and can describe the qualities of each.” -Jocelyn Fujii, Hula Moon Press LLC

“The taste of cool” - Robynne L. Maii, Gourmet Magazine

“Mamaki tea is the only tea I drink” - Ezekiel “Zeke” Lau, Pro Surfer”

“A big a** cup of healthy!” - Doc Rock, Blogger, TUAW.com

“After a glass, I definitely feel more energized and good to go“ - Justin Ridgley, Pro Climber, Volcanic Rock Gym


MAHALOS

Shawn Boyd

Brad Watanabe

BeRad Studio

Taste Table

Volcanic Rock Gym

Fresh Cafe


RISK and CHALLENGES

We will do our best to get these new blends to you on time so you can share them with friends and family. The envelopes you see in the video are prototype mock ups, not actual printed envelopes.

Pledges will be used to print brand new, beautifully designed envelopes. We are working with a new supplier because our current one does not provide larger sized envelopes that are needed. Some cushion has been built into the production schedule to hit our shipping deadline.  However, there is the risk of something unexpected happening with suppliers which could possibly delay shipment.

story:
Introduction

    My name is Vanessa, and this fundraiser is for my best friend Ariel. Ariel Duell is 22years old, a wife and mother to two amazing children. She was diagnosed with a brain tumor the size of a tennis ball in early June, 2013. The doctors soon discovered that Ariel has had this tumor on her brain since she was born! This tumor had grown so large it was causing extreme pressure on her brain, resulting in seizures. With these seizures the doctors enforced regulations on her life. Ariel is no longer allowed to drive, she must have someone with her at all times, and the worst of all, she was not allowed to hold her children unless seated. Finally, on July 31st, 2013 Ariel underwent brain surgery. The doctors were able to remove a majority of the cancerous tumor; however, Ariel will soon start chemo and radiation to remove the remaining portion. Ariel has been a fighter and this obstacle has shown me even more how strong she truly is!

   This fund is my way of helping Ariel and her family during this stressful time. I am hoping with the support and generosity of others, we can reduce her medical bills and family expenses, allowing her to focus on recovery.

What We Need & What You Get

  The funding raised here will go directly to Ariel's medical bills including, surgery costs, hospital costs, chemo/radiation treatment and living expenses while she recovers. Even if I am unable to reach my goal of $10,000, the donations raised will still be given to Ariel to reduce her bills that are accumulating. 

   Ariel has been so strong through this and her family and I want her to be able to concertrate on getting well. Please help Ariel's road to recovery! As my way of beginning to thank you I will be making handmade gifts of thanks.

PERKS: I have multiple perks (gifts) associated with Ariel's Brain Cancer Fund! (please include your address when choosing a perk, so I can mail the gift to you)

  1. The first perk is a handmade friendship bracelet, as a constant reminder of your contrubtion to Ariel.The bracelet will include Ariels favorite color (purple) and the color of brain cancer (grey).
  2. The second perk is a handmade brain cancer ribbon! This ribbon will be handweaved by myself using the hawaiian lei technique. This ribbion will include a pin so you can proudly wear your ribbon as a constant reminder of your generosity.
  3. The last perk will be a personalized letter letting you know updates about Ariel and thanking you for your amazing gesture. But thats not all, the last perk will include the two pervious perks, the handmade bracelet and the handmade cancer ribbon!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, that is okay, please share this link and bring awareness to Ariel's fund!

And be sure to stay updated on Ariel's progress by clicking on the link "updates."

Thank you

Ariel is no longer allowed to drive, she must have someone with her at all times, and the worst of all, she was not allowed to hold her children unless seated. Finally, on July 31st, 2013 Ariel underwent brain surgery. The doctors were able to remove a majority of the cancerous tumor; however, Ariel will soon start chemo and radiation to remove the remaining portion. Ariel has been a fighter and this obstacle has shown me even more how strong she truly is!
   This fund is my way of helping Ariel and her family during this stressful time. I am hoping with the support and generosity of others, we can reduce her medical bills and family expenses, allowing her to focus on recovery.



What We Need & What You Get
  The funding raised here will go directly to Ariel's medical bills including, surgery costs, hospital costs, chemo/radiation treatment and living expenses while she recovers. Even if I am unable to reach my goal of $10,000, the donations raised will still be given to Ariel to reduce her bills that are accumulating. 
   Ariel has been so strong through this and her family and I want her to be able to concertrate on getting well. Please help Ariel's road to recovery! As my way of beginning to thank you I will be making handmade gifts of thanks.
PERKS: I have multiple perks (gifts) associated with Ariel's Brain Cancer Fund! (please include your address when choosing a perk, so I can mail the gift to you)

The first perk is a handmade friendship bracelet, as a constant reminder of your contrubtion to Ariel.The bracelet will include Ariels favorite color (purple) and the color of brain cancer (grey).
The second perk is a handmade brain cancer ribbon! This ribbon will be handweaved by myself using the hawaiian lei technique. This ribbion will include a pin so you can proudly wear your ribbon as a constant reminder of your generosity.
The last perk will be a personalized letter letting you know updates about Ariel and thanking you for your amazing gesture. But thats not all, the last perk will include the two pervious perks, the handmade bracelet and the handmade cancer ribbon!




Other Ways You Can Help



If you are unable to donate, that is okay, please share this link and bring awareness to Ariel's fund!
And be sure to stay updated on Ariel's progress by clicking on the link "updates."
Thank you

story:
On November 8th, Typhoon Haiyan hit and became one of the world's most powerful typhoons as it affected a total of 9.5 million people across the Philippines -- and displaced at least 600,000 -- when it slammed into the country.  There are still millions dealing with the effects of the emotional wounds that the devastation caused.  
Dr. Kimberly is a psychologist whose passion is to assist in healing individuals in her private practice, and also to help individuals/ groups affected by natural disasters such as with Hurricane Yolanda.  She will be traveling with an international team of volunteers to the Philippines to offer TRE® (Tension & Trauma Releasing Exercises) trainings to local relief workers and aid workers.of personnel/and local civilians. This group of volunteers will provide trauma assistance to the thousands still suffering post Hurricane Yolanda.  Dr. Kimberly will be assisting with the training and research that will be provided to those in the disaster zones.  Funds are needed for travel expenses, medical costs, supplies, lodging and food.  Dr. Kimberly has previously assisted with hurricane disaster work in Honduras where she helped with Hurricane Mitch in South America in 1998.  Her private practice will be covered by a colleague for two weeks, and she will resume her normal practice upon her return.

story:
Join Jack and Bill on a journey towards the Cairns Ironman, and help inspire a Fun, Fit and Healthy Lifestyle for all.

Actions Speak Louder Then Words!

Ironman Cairns Sunday June 8, 2014. 

3.8km (2.4m) Swim, 180Km (112m) Bike, 42.2Km (26m) Run 

Jack Nunn (USA) and Bill Panter (AUS) will compete in their 5th and 1st Ironman respectively. Their mission? To inspire a Fun, Fit and Healthy lifestyle. 

This campaign is driven by the passion of Jack and Bill to live and inspire others to enjoy a healthy lifestyle. Between them they have encouraged family, friends and clients to get active, healthy and maintain that lifestyle. Now it's time to take it to the next level. During their road to Ironman Cairns 2014, Jack and Bill will endure rigorous training, competitions and continual of dialogue about living healthy. Jack and Bill want to help others by providing advice and guidance on how to achieve the most out of daily life with health and fitness.

Before launching this campaign, Jack and Bill had noticed a huge amount of interest in what they are doing. This alone has inspired new and old friends to make positive changes towards living a Fun, Fit and Healthy lifestyle. They are constantly adding tasks to their mission to make this campaign as successful as possible. In Australia, they will be talking to students at Southport State High School on the importance of healthy living. Setting good habits at an early age is key, and maintaining those habits throughout adult life is just as Important. And, they are always up for ideas and suggestions from others on how they can spread their message further. (Follow us here on Facebook)

Contributors will help Jack and Bill spread the word internationally about living a Fun, Fit and Healthy lifestyle. Jack and Bill will attend as many lead up events as possible in California before heading out to the big race in June: Ironman Cairns 2014.

About us

For most of his life, Bill Panter has been involved in athletics. Whether it was a swimming event in high school, playing rugby at a premier level, or competing to a national level in gymnastics and pole vault. Bill has always maintained a 'give it a go' attitude. It has been this attitude as well as a series of choices and planning that has allowed Bill to team up with Jack Nunn, his close friend, training partner and coach.

Jack Nunn is a rower and triathlete. It’s both his passion and profession, and he  hopes to inspire more people to take part in fitness and live an active and healthy lifestyle. The Southern California native and founder of Roworx, an indoor rowing fitness studio in Long Beach, California, was a member of the rowing team at UC Berkeley. There, he studied to be a sports writer, and won four Pac-10 championships and three IRA (International Rowing Association) National Championships. He was a member of the US National Rowing Team from 2001 to 2004. Jack never expected to turn rowing or triathlons into his full-time profession, and he feels grateful for how the sport has shaped his life as well as others around him. He's competed in five Ironmans including Nice, France, Cozymel, Mexico, Florianopolois, Brazil and won his age group in numerous half marathons and races. 

Jack teaches about 15 classes each week (mostly indoor rowing) at the Boathouse overlooking Marine Stadium (the rowing venue for the 1932 Olympics) in Long Beach, California. He's also an active rower and triathlon competitor at events around the world. Rowing has given Jack an identity as a rower and triathlete over the past 20 years, and he has always had the desire to give something back and give others the benefit of his experience.

What You Get

We have a large array of awesome perks for contributors. Please check them out and see what would be best for you. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask. 

What We Need

We need to raise $10,000 to help us achieve our campaign. Below is a list of the approximate costs involved per person. (Total cost will also be shown).  

  • Each lead up event costs on average: $110 USD. We are planning to compete in at least 10 events before we head to Australia. (Total: $2200 USD)
  • Flights from Los Angeles to Cairns: $1600 USD (not including excess baggage for bikes) (Total: $3200 USD)
  • Ironman entry fee: $750 USD (Total: $1500)
  • Fun, Fit and Healthy promotional gear: (Total: $1200) 
  • Accommodation in Cairns (Total: $1200)
  • Personal health and safety equipment, miscellaneous expenses, other transportation and logistic costs. (Total: $700)

We believe we will reach our target, but if for some reason we do not, funds will be used proportionally towards the above expenses. 

The Impact

Society is constanly battling with the overwelming problems caused by poor individual health. Not only is this a massive economic drain, but it is a huge contributor to daily motivation and overall happiness. This can seem a complex problem, but with the right mix of information and delivery which encourages action, a lifestyle change can be achieved and maintained quicker than one may think. 

Jack and Bill have always strived to inspire friends and family, and the launch of this new campaign will allow them to share their message, and hopefully, positively impact the lives of others around the world. 

 Who Inspired Us 

Jack and Bill have both been very fortunate to have had great families, friends and huge support network throughout their lives. One of their biggest backers and inspirations has been their fathers. Although Jack and Bill have obtained a very high level in their chosen sports, they have lived somewhat in the shadows of their fathers. 

Jack's father, John, has a long history of rowing accolades, including winning a Bronze medal in double sculls in the 1968 Olympics in Mexico City, and coaching the US Rowing Team in the 1976 Olympics in Montreal. In 1972, John's Olympic rowing career was cut short when his employer told him that if he took more time off to train and compete in the Munich games, that he would no longer be employed at the company. (At the time, John and his wife had three young daughters at home under the age of 5. He didn't feel like he could leave not knowing if he would still have a job to support his family when he returned).

 Bill's father, Bob, was one of Australia's top road cyclists and competed professionally from 1965 -1970. His cycling career ended abruptly when he was struck down by a car during a training session, causing him to be in a coma for three days and blind for a week. Although Bob made an almost full recovery, he was never able to ride professionally again. Bob coached and mentored many athletes including Robbie McEwen, a Tour de France Green Jersey winner.

So far, Jack and Bill's story shows that although they have not yet reached the limelight of their fathers, they are implementing the same lifestyle system that got them there. So whether or not one makes it to stardom or the Olympic level, the most important thing to remember and embrace is: live a Fun, Fit and Healthy lifestyle. 

Other Ways you Can Help

Get up, get active and spread the word for us! Let your friends and families know what we are doing and take advantage of the cool perks we have to offer. Pass on our story by using Indiegogo share tools and following us here on Facebook. Thanks for your help, it is greatly appreciated. 

One of the awesome perks up for grabs. 

Jack racing towards 1st place in the duathlon at the 2013 Worlds Masters Games in Italy. He also place third in the triathlon and won two Gold medals and two Silver medals in rowing competitions. 

Bill at the start of his 5km run at the UCLA sprint reverse triathlon. March 2nd, 2014

Jack after a solid hour of wattbike training with Bill. March 4, 2014.


John Nunn (right), with his rowing partner William Maher after winning a Bronze medal in double sculls at the 1968 Mexico City Olympics.   

On the final day of the nine-day Sun Tour of Victoria in 1967, Bob Panters' bike broke in half a few yards from the finish. Despite this, Bob still managed to come 3rd in the tour.

story:
Cervical cancer is a major women's health issue in the developing world and Tanzania has one of the highest rates of the disease.  Women here are not only more likely to be diagnosed at a later stage than their counterparts in developed nations, they also experience a higher mortality rate.  The key to addressing cervical cancer is to catch and treat the disease in its earliest stages- something now possible through a simple and relatively inexpensive procedure known as visual inspection with acetic acid.  Using household vinegar, a cotton swab, and a flashlight, health care providers can screen women for cervical cancer and, in many cases, treat early stages of the disease with cryotherapy (freezing of the abnormal cells) all in the same day! 

To address this serious health problem, CECAP, a cervical cancer screening program, would like to conduct mass rural cervical cancer screenings over a period of 5 days.  CECAP is based in Ifakara, a large town in the Kilombero District of Tanzania, and currently conducts screening two days each week from their office at St. Francis Referral Hospital (http://www.ifakara.org/en/st-francis-hospital/h...).  However, Kilombero is a large rural district with few paved roads.  Transportation is difficult and expensive for many rural women, who often have responsibilities at home and on their farms that make it difficult to seek medical services in a distant town. Therefore, CECAP would  like to bring its screening services to them!

And the best part?  It will only require $700 to do this!  This amount of money will cover the cost of advertising the mass screening in the targeted areas, the salaries of the medical personal to do the screening, room and board while staying overnight at screening locations, and transportation to and from the screening sites.  The 2013 fundraising campaign provided funds to screen nearly 300 women over a period of four days!  CECAP was also able to provide the transportation fees for three women with more advanced cases to travel to larger health facilities for much-needed treatment.  With this campaign, CECAP would like to increase the outreach screening days they offer this year to at least 5. 

There are many rural areas that could benefit from these services and any donation, no matter how small, will help CECAP reach its goal.  Any additional funds raised over the $700 goal will go towards increasing the number of outreach screening days offered and to assisting with transportation fees to larger hospitals for screening clients who lack the means to pay for their own travel yet require more advanced treatment than St. Francis can provide. Thank you for helping us reach this goal!

story:
My Inspiration!

I love soccer. But not everyone is able to enjoy this beautiful sport. As a little girl, I was always told that one person can make a huge impact. As a high school student, I wanted to make one of my dreams a reality. So, I founded Gear for Cheer, a movement aimed at spreading the joys of soccer around the globe.


What GFC Needs

With rising shipping costs, it has become increasingly expensive to ship the collected gear around the country to larger organizations. The raised funds will go towards delivering donations. Whatever is not used for shipping will go to Peace Passers, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  100%. 


Your generosity is invaluable. 

I've always had an immense appreciation for various nonprofits who spend their time and energy towards making the world a better place. Now, it's time for me to give back. The feeling of empowerment and excitement when I see people responding to my efforts is indescribable. Whether or not GFC reaches its goal, your contributions are infinitely appreciated.



Cool Perks!

A donation of as little as $1 will go a long way in bettering someone else's life. All donors will be featured on Gear for Cheer's "Cheers" page for everyone to admire. Donate more, and you can receive shout outs, thank-yous or even a custom T-shirt!
Please remember to spread the word on Facebook and Twitter!

Thank you! Cheers!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We are Lyndan and Vanessa Coleman and we love helping people get in shape and live happier healthier lives! It is our Passion!

  • We are the owners of Fight For it Now Fitness Bootcamp located in Southern California. We have been in the Fitness industry, combined for over 20 years. We are both Certified Instructors. Vanessa Coleman was Voted "Top 40 under 40 business owners" 2012. She was also Featured in the book "The Flip Flop CEO" for business accomplishments in 2013 and Fight For it Now Bootcamp was voted "#1 Fitness Program", Canyon Country 2013
  • We want to allow people to start their own business doing what they love, even if they have almost no money! Four years ago we started our Fitness Bootcamp and we were broke. We had no idea what we were doing. All we knew is that we loved Fitness and we loved helping people get in shape. Well, we figured it out and 3 years later we were voted #1 Fitness program in our city! We know their are tons of people who have a passion for fitness and just dont know what to do with it. So we put together a great, easy system to walk you through, step by step on how we grew our business with very little money. We know if we had this system when we first started we would have reached and helped a lot more people a lot sooner. That is the goal, to get people happier and healthier through Fitness.
  • Obesity is one the biggest preventable causes of Death in America!! Your contribution can change someone's life. It sounds dramatic right? But it is the truth. Weather you donate to help, or donate to start your own Fitness Bootcamp you are contributing to ending the trend of obesity. So many people are intimidated by gyms and don't know how to use the equipment. They also may not be able to afford a Personal Trainer. A Fitness Bootcamp can offer them the best of both worlds. The more Fitness Bootcamps there are the more people who can be reached. Your contribution will make a difference so please help...

    What We Need & What You Get

    We need to raise $10,000 
    The money raised will go toward Creating and building a great functioning easy to use website which will allow new business owners to easily navigate through, How to structure classes, types of workouts to do, forms, audio downloads and more!
    We will also need to market this system everywhere, and as you know that gets expensive. So a portion will aslo go towards getting this system out and in front of people through ads and Fitness Expos.
    Any contribution of $200 or more will get you your own Fitness Bootcamp System. Which will include;
    • A-Z step by step guide to building your own successful Fitness Bootcamp with very little money.
    • A Fitness assessment, Fitness questionnaire and Waiver(sample) docs. 
    • Over 100 numbered exercises to easily customize each workout.
    • The Building a Bootcamp on a Budget booklet and audio download version.
    • How to use social media to grow your business for Free.
    • Where to teach your classes
    • How to merge your Fitness and/or Nutritional networking business with your Fitness Bootcamp to grow them both.
    • How to take payments.
    • How to Build a free website
    • How to do Team challenges to grow your member count, and much more!   
    Its all in there! Everything you need to know to build a successful, life changing Fitness Bootcamp!
      This system will be priced at $297 once it hits the Market so now is a good time to get yours!
      Our system is unique because we are able to show you exactly how to get your Fitness Bootcamp up and running for very little money. We did it! So we know it works. We have taken out all the guess work so you will reach success much sooner then we did. This is a step by step guide. We wish this system existed when we first started!

      The Impact

      Every little bit will help. By contributing you will be part of the solution! You will be helping this system get into the hands of someone who is passionate about fitness. Someone who wants to help others live a healthier life. Every dollar counts!
      Obesity is one of the top preventable killers in America! This is a problem that can be fixed little by little, one Bootcamp at at time.  Like we mentioned, A lot of people just dont know how to exercise. This system will teach people how to run a class, how to motivate and how to teach others to exercise. Then those people can move and teach others. A total ripple effect. We can help change the world!


          Other Ways You Can Help

          If you are not able to contribute at this time that's okay. You can still help. Please spread the word and be loud about our campaign! Please "Share" on Facebook, Instagram, twitter, email ect now. We would really appreciate it! You can use "Indiegogo share tools" as well. Thank you :)

          Lyndan & Vanessa

Short Summary
Hi! We are Lyndan and Vanessa Coleman and we love helping people get in shape and live happier healthier lives! It is our Passion!


We are the owners of Fight For it Now Fitness Bootcamp located in Southern California. We have been in the Fitness industry, combined for over 20 years. We are both Certified Instructors. Vanessa Coleman was Voted "Top 40 under 40 business owners" 2012. She was also Featured in the book "The Flip Flop CEO" for business accomplishments in 2013 and Fight For it Now Bootcamp was voted "#1 Fitness Program", Canyon Country 2013
We want to allow people to start their own business doing what they love, even if they have almost no money! Four years ago we started our Fitness Bootcamp and we were broke. We had no idea what we were doing. All we knew is that we loved Fitness and we loved helping people get in shape. Well, we figured it out and 3 years later we were voted #1 Fitness program in our city! We know their are tons of people who have a passion for fitness and just dont know what to do with it. So we put together a great, easy system to walk you through, step by step on how we grew our business with very little money. We know if we had this system when we first started we would have reached and helped a lot more people a lot sooner. That is the goal, to get people happier and healthier through Fitness.
Obesity is one the biggest preventable causes of Death in America!! Your contribution can change someone's life. It sounds dramatic right? But it is the truth. Weather you donate to help, or donate to start your own Fitness Bootcamp you are contributing to ending the trend of obesity. So many people are intimidated by gyms and don't know how to use the equipment. They also may not be able to afford a Personal Trainer. A Fitness Bootcamp can offer them the best of both worlds. The more Fitness Bootcamps there are the more people who can be reached. Your contribution will make a difference so please help...


  What We Need & What You Get
We need to raise $10,000 
The money raised will go toward Creating and building a great functioning easy to use website which will allow new business owners to easily navigate through, How to structure classes, types of workouts to do, forms, audio downloads and more!
We will also need to market this system everywhere, and as you know that gets expensive. So a portion will aslo go towards getting this system out and in front of people through ads and Fitness Expos.
Any contribution of $200 or more will get you your own Fitness Bootcamp System. Which will include;


A-Z step by step guide to building your own successful Fitness Bootcamp with very little money.

A Fitness assessment, Fitness questionnaire and Waiver(sample) docs. 

Over 100 numbered exercises to easily customize each workout.

The Building a Bootcamp on a Budget booklet and audio download version.

How to use social media to grow your business for Free.

Where to teach your classes
How to merge your Fitness and/or Nutritional networking business with your Fitness Bootcamp to grow them both.
How to take payments.

How to Build a free website

How to do Team challenges to grow your member count, and much more!   


Its all in there! Everything you need to know to build a successful, life changing Fitness Bootcamp!


This system will be priced at $297 once it hits the Market so now is a good time to get yours!

Our system is unique because we are able to show you exactly how to get your Fitness Bootcamp up and running for very little money. We did it! So we know it works. We have taken out all the guess work so you will reach success much sooner then we did. This is a step by step guide. We wish this system existed when we first started!


 The Impact

Every little bit will help. By contributing you will be part of the solution! You will be helping this system get into the hands of someone who is passionate about fitness. Someone who wants to help others live a healthier life. Every dollar counts!
Obesity is one of the top preventable killers in America! This is a problem that can be fixed little by little, one Bootcamp at at time.  Like we mentioned, A lot of people just dont know how to exercise. This system will teach people how to run a class, how to motivate and how to teach others to exercise. Then those people can move and teach others. A total ripple effect. We can help change the world!



  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not able to contribute at this time that's okay. You can still help. Please spread the word and be loud about our campaign! Please "Share" on Facebook, Instagram, twitter, email ect now. We would really appreciate it! You can use "Indiegogo share tools" as well. Thank you :)Lyndan & Vanessa

story:
WHO?

DyAnna Gordon CPM, is a midwife serving families in Southern Utah. She has been dedicated to supporting families in birth for over ten years. When she was 19 she visited Africa for an extended vacation and was shocked at the poverty and illness that she witnesses especially among pregnant women and young children. After completing a Bachelors of Science degree, becoming the mother of four children, and achieving her Certified Professional Midwife credential she is feeling the call to give back and serve in this capacity at MamaBaby Haiti.

WHAT?

Dy will serve as a midwife for three weeks at MamaBaby Haiti helping to provide prenatal care for up to 600 women every month as well as helping the staff midwives deliver 30-200 births a month.

WHERE?

MamaBaby Haiti is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving the health and well being of mothers and babies. Their mission is to lower the maternal, fetal, and neonatal mortality rate in Haiti. All services and education are free. They teach mothers and families about prenatal health and nutrition, hygiene, childbirth education, breastfeeding education with the goal of exclusive breastfeeding for a minimum of one year, contraception methods, and sustainable living (including herbal health remedies, gardening and raising chickens).


WHY?

Some shocking statistics about Haiti:

– 74 babies die per 1000 births – the highest in the Western Hemisphere

 

– 12% of all babies die before their 1st birthday

 

– 1/3 of all children die before their 5th birthday

 

– 1in 71 women will die in pregnancy or childbirth

 

– 50% population earns less than $60 a year

 

– Less than 45% of the population has clean water


Education, prenatal, birth and postpartum care by a skilled midwife can make a huge difference in reducing these numbers.


HOW?

Donate, donate,donate! All funds will go directly to cover travel expenses as well as pay for room and board including body guard, chef to insure clean food and water, interpreter, and supplies that will remain in Haiti when Dy returns home.


If you have any question email Dy at completebeginnings@gmail.com or visit mamababyhaiti.org

story:
If Sunscreen is Supposed to Prevent Cancer, Why Would We Use Ones Made With Carcinogens?

Thank you for your interest in Kynk Naturals!  We produce Fair Trade Organic Shea Butter and other natural, handcrafted personal care products in Cambridge, ON Canada. Our philosophy is if you can’t eat it, we don’t use it!  Our newest project is to create a sunscreen so natural you won't mind if your kids eat it, called Pasty White Babies.  But we need your help.

We need to raise $30,000 to cover the cost of NHP Certification (Health Canada’s FDA for natural products), and manufacturing or we won’t be able to  So we're turning to our strongest supporters for contributions. In exchange, we're offering a full bottle of Pasty White Babies Sunscreen, discounts off our website, and our deepest heartfelt thanks.  Your contribution will help us feed our families, to employ & empower more women both in Canada and Ghana, and further, it will help support thousands of forward-thinking & like-minded individuals of all ages spend much needed time in the sun.  Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If everyone Kynk knows plus 10 of their friends contribute $10, we can make the world a better place!  We know EVERYONE out there wants world peace and healthy body care products, but we might not have the extra $2 available.  But we're SURE you know someone who does!  Please share the Love, and let your People know that Kynk wants to care for them!  (See Indiegogo Share Tools Below)

Backstory Details

Around 12 years ago I was so freaked out about the toxins and detrimental products I was putting on my hair & skin, that I shaved my head for 3 years and used nothing but olive oil.  Here, Necessity gave birth to Invention, and 8 years ago Kynk Naturals was born!  I went out and made my own hair & body care products.  I feel the same way about sunscreen too! 

I have yet to find a sunscreen that I would let my children eat.  So keeping with Kynk's tradition of simple ingredients found in food, our Shea Butter based Pasty White Babies uses NON-nanomicrinized, or sub-micronized Zinc Oxide at 100nm or more (too big to get in your lungs [hard to do in a cream anyways], or penetrate your skin) as the active ingredient.  But here's the rub; it's WHITENING!  Now as a woman of immediate African descent, I am highly concerned with this!  However, I do still burn (no redness [I'm that dark], but mass crack & peel of skin), and all forms of cancer run in our family.  So I opt for a safe & healthy longevity.  Since my children are just happy to be outside, we don't mind the ..."sheen"  ;)

Folks, the best sunscreen is shade, long sleeves, and common sense.  But for those times where extra protection is required, please choose a product dedicated to your safety and well being!

What We Need & What You Get

We have broken the total budget down into 3 phases.  In the first phase, we need $10,000CAD to get us though the first round of NHP Registration: $5,000 for a consultant to file the paperwork appropriately and accurately, $4,000 for the inital round of ingredient tests, and $1,000 for the formulation for the manufacuring facility to confirm formulation.  The next 2 phases will see us through additional testing, and production.  The more we raise, the more units we can produce to lower costs.

The Believers who contribute $30, will recieve 1 unit of Pasty White Babies, and contributions of $75 will recieve a coupon code for 50% off our website AND a bottle of Pasty White Babies!

Why Indiegogo

We believe that people want SAFE, not just natural products.  We’ve put a great amount of work and posititve energy into developing Pasty White Babies because we believe in and need it. Through Indiegogo, we can connect with forward-thinking & like-minded individuals, build stronger relationships with our early adopters, and use your feedback to make the best product possible.

What it Means

Now, we look to you to rally the people and call them to join in our crusade (yes, you do hear Les Mis building urgently in the background) – who will be strong and stand with me?

While all of the ingredients may not taste good, they are all found in food!  This will just add to the safety. 

We’ve had 8 years of serving you the best handcrafted bodycare products possible from the women’s Co-Op in Ghana, to our kitchens in small town Ontario.  This project will enable us to employ & empower more women both in Canada and Ghana.
 
Such extensive and rigorous ingredient and human subject testing ensures that every component's I is dotted and every T crossed as per Health Canada.  So much of the expense of producing sunscreen is in testing and maintaining strict government standards.

But most importantly, my kids use the same stuff you & your kids use, and I won’t let my kids use anything they can’t eat go on their bodies.

Please share the Love, and let your People know that Kynk wants to care for them!  (See Indiegogo Share Tools Below)

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Larry Alibrandi, a world class beverage scientist, nutritionist, entrepreneur and the founder of NCN Beverages. I've created and helped launch products globally for several multinational corporations, and as an entrepreneur have created and brought to market many value added beverages that fulfill specific consumer needs. I have successfully sold my former brands and this next tour of duty I am inspired to raise the bar and hope to build the next mega company! I've learned many lessons as a corporate scientist and as an entrepreneur. My desire is to apply what I've learned and selectively recruit the finest staff to join me 

NCN Beverages is a Research & Development incubator that has spent tremndous resources looking at all the pieces of the puzzle to bring innovative new products to the marketplace based on consumer demand. We intend to create employment, and be mindful of the environment and its natural resources. Urban Chic is our first of hopefully several products and is a weight-management product that utilizes clinically proven ingredients that help burn fat and enhance health & wellness. This innovative finished product has a small carbon footprint, minimizes the impact on landfill and is environmentally friendly. Its Green! Its delicious! It works!

Our first production of Urban Chic will be done at a current Good Manufacturing Practices (cGMP) factory that will then allow us to get the finished product into the marketplace. That's where you come in! Join our team!

What We Need & What You Get

• We need $22,500 for our first production run of one item so we can start selling this exciting new product. Ideally we're hoping that you our dear brand ambassadors far exceed the $22,500 and help us launch two items.

• Any pledge is sincerely appreciated and less than $25 donations will receive a personalized thank you! Inline with the perk campaign for only $25, you will get a sampling of our products plus an Urban Chic T-shirt; for $50 you also get an Urban Chic water bottle; $100 we will add a special designer shirt; $500/$1000/$5000 will give you a special promo code and give you 10% in commissions on Urban Chic authorized sales you generate within the continental USA. The commissions will be rewarded in your selection of product, apparel and gift cards.

• The funds will go toward production and getting lift off!

The Impact

• The weight-loss category in the US is a $65 billion dollar business. Urban Chic is a revolutionary new powder that contains clinically proven ingredients shown to be effective in gold standard weight loss studies. Urban Chic is environmentally friendly, low cost, easy to carry, delicious and effective! It is targeted to consumers who want to live a healthy lifestyle.

• Our goal is to make a healthy good-for-you product with no artificial flavors, no artificial colors, no preservatives and all natural sweeteners. Urban Chic also contains antioxidants to help you stay healthy and we believe that our products minimize the use of our natural planet resources.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial pledge is difficult, its understood but do join our movement , please help spread the word, tell your friends, like us on Facebook.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for listening to me and for your help in getting Urban Chic off the ground!

story:
Home is where our tribe is.

We're bringing your favorite boxing conditioning class back but this time, in a pop-up format. We'll bring the equipment, and classes will be scheduled at various locations around the city of Portland. You never know where we might pop-up! An old warehouse, a sunny park, a rooftop or maybe even a brewery where we can cool down afterwards with some drinks.  All we need are some gloves, mitts and YOU!

Here's what you can expect:

Shadowboxing and guided partner drills paired with interval training and isometric exercises for an empowering workout. Get ready to get sweaty with some great music and a fantastic community of people. Classes will vary from women's only to co-ed and you will find a range of times including happy hour classes and classes by candlelight.

                      

Class Pricing:

Introductory Package - 3 classes for $30

1 Class - $14

5 Pack - $65 ($13 each)

10 Pack - $120 ($12 each)

Gloves can be rented for $1

What do we need?

We need your help to raise at least $1,400 for basic equipment.

Here's the breakdown:

Weights $100
Gloves $275
Mitts $400
Speaker $175
Insurance $200
Website/Marketing/ for the first year $250

What's in it for you?

Undying gratitude, opportunity to pre-pay classes at a discounted rate and get sweaty in a limited edition TribeBoxing tank.

What's in it for us?

Micah and Andrea  have a special place in their hearts for boxing. In fact, it's how they met. Two years later they married and are joining forces to share the love with the Portland community.


Micah has been a student and teacher of martial arts and boxing for the last 15 years. For him, it has been a way of life with its fair share of challenges, rewards and personal growth. His passion is to share his knowledge with peaceful warriors and like-minded souls. 

Andrea started taking boxing when she first moved to Portland, she was hooked immediately. The workout was powerful, inspiring and empowering. It became her stress relief, a way to stay fit and also, how she met many friends that are dear to her to this day.

Andrea is a also an instructor Barre3 and she can't wait to combine her amazing playlists, challenging isometric and interval training with her love and passion of boxing.

Challenges.

With your help, we will have all the basic equipment we need to give you a rocking class. We have a unique challenge as a pop-up exercise class to discover venues and business that are interested in collaborating with us.

We would love your help!

If you know of a space that may be interested in hosting a TribeBoxing class, send them our way! Think outside of the box: rooftops, breweries, dance clubs, corporate space, industrial space, outdoor, food industry, etc. We look forward to connecting our tribe with our Portland community.

TribeBoxing is also available to teach a class for your next special event for up to 20 people! 

Thank you for your support.

Whether it's a financial contribution to help us purchase equipment, sharing this with friends who would love to try a class or local businesses that may be interested in hosting, we appreciate all of your love and support and couldn't do it without you.

This is our movement. This is our therapy. This is our tribe.

story:
Richard Boulter is the first born of a family of five from Rockport Massachusetts. His parents are deeply compassionate, community-minded people who constantly think of and help others. Richard, a hard-working landscaper and well-respected business owner for almost 40 years, followed their example, and off-season has mentored people on spiritual quests. He uplifts people towards a significantly more positive life and outlook. He is a giver through and through, like his parents.

Now he needs your help.

A freak swimming accident while on vacation in Nicaragua in 2010 fractured his spine and left him a quadriplegic. All of his personal and business assets were used to pay for his hospitalization there and the Life Flight that brought him back to Massachusetts. His oldest son became his primary caregiver and has coordinated round-the-clock assistance for his father.

The life of a quadriplegic is tenuous. When a patient lies in bed for a prolonged period, normal blood circulation breaks down and bed sores develop. Unfortunately Richard has reached this stage and his bed sores are infected. This has become a systemic condition, meaning his entire blood circulatory system carries an infection. It is severely debilitating.

In order to recover from such a deeply embedded condition, an individual's cells need the proper voltage  to facilitate normal cell repair. Without proper voltage there is no healing.

The intention of this fund raising campaign is to immediately purchase the device which addresses this lowered body voltage specifically. It is the Bio-modulator machine developed by Dr. Jerry Tennant. Dr. Tennant himself contracted meningitis and lost his medical practice. He was unable to receive help from any of his peer physicians. Out of urgent necessity to gain back his life, he researched and uncovered the connection between cell voltage and tissue healing. Now with his health restored, he manufactures a device which introduces voltage into tissues where it is needed. He holds periodic training seminars for health practitioners who will use the Bio-modulator.

This campaign effort will result in the immediate purchase of the Bio-modulator and the personal hands-on training in Texas at Dr. Jerry Tennant's facility.

Richard Boulter very fortunately has had the dogged assistance of a health related therapist local to him , Julie Amriti Duffy, MA, LMT. This is the individual who will be trained. The integrity, compassion and dedication of this person is on an angelic plane.

In the event that this campaign is successful to a greater degree than the immediate need, a non profit organization will be formed to raise funds for additional health practitioners to be equipped with and trained in the use of the Tennant Bio-modulator.

You can help today. Many persons who are in desperate need do not have access to or knowledge of this revolutionary device. Your contribution will help with an urgent need and could go a long way toward raising awareness and helping many more people.
story_txt:
Richard Boulter is the first born of a family of five from Rockport Massachusetts. His parents are deeply compassionate, community-minded people who constantly think of and help others. Richard, a hard-working landscaper and well-respected business owner for almost 40 years, followed their example, and off-season has mentored people on spiritual quests. He uplifts people towards a significantly more positive life and outlook. He is a giver through and through, like his parents.
Now he needs your help.
A freak swimming accident while on vacation in Nicaragua in 2010 fractured his spine and left him a quadriplegic. All of his personal and business assets were used to pay for his hospitalization there and the Life Flight that brought him back to Massachusetts. His oldest son became his primary caregiver and has coordinated round-the-clock assistance for his father.
The life of a quadriplegic is tenuous. When a patient lies in bed for a prolonged period, normal blood circulation breaks down and bed sores develop. Unfortunately Richard has reached this stage and his bed sores are infected. This has become a systemic condition, meaning his entire blood circulatory system carries an infection. It is severely debilitating.
In order to recover from such a deeply embedded condition, an individual's cells need the proper voltage  to facilitate normal cell repair. Without proper voltage there is no healing.
The intention of this fund raising campaign is to immediately purchase the device which addresses this lowered body voltage specifically. It is the Bio-modulator machine developed by Dr. Jerry Tennant. Dr. Tennant himself contracted meningitis and lost his medical practice. He was unable to receive help from any of his peer physicians. Out of urgent necessity to gain back his life, he researched and uncovered the connection between cell voltage and tissue healing. Now with his health restored, he manufactures a device which introduces voltage into tissues where it is needed. He holds periodic training seminars for health practitioners who will use the Bio-modulator.
This campaign effort will result in the immediate purchase of the Bio-modulator and the personal hands-on training in Texas at Dr. Jerry Tennant's facility.
Richard Boulter very fortunately has had the dogged assistance of a health related therapist local to him , Julie Amriti Duffy, MA, LMT. This is the individual who will be trained. The integrity, compassion and dedication of this person is on an angelic plane.
In the event that this campaign is successful to a greater degree than the immediate need, a non profit organization will be formed to raise funds for additional health practitioners to be equipped with and trained in the use of the Tennant Bio-modulator.
You can help today. Many persons who are in desperate need do not have access to or knowledge of this revolutionary device. Your contribution will help with an urgent need and could go a long way toward raising awareness and helping many more people.

story:
LONG LIVE HASSAN!Short Summary

THIS IS ADDRESSED TO ALL OF THOSE , LIKE ME HAVE WHO LOST A DEAR BELOVED PERSON TO KIDNEY FAILURE AND OR KIDNEY TRANSPLANT REJECTIONS AND OR BAD DIALISYS , SPECIALLY IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES.

My name is Birgit Bofarull Halm. I am an actor, writer, musician and editor. And, finally a fundraiser, which will end up being and NGO for dialysis patients world wide.

This campaign is URGENT, because Hassan is only receiving, after full renal failure, dialysis only ONCE A WEEK, when it should be 3 times a week.

I already lost the love of my life, Calvin Warren Andreassi to these same circumstances. I want HASSAN, whom I love as my own biological son TO LIVE!

Contributors will help cover:

1. Plane fare round trip for Hassan, his donor(Mustapha his biological brother),  myself, who is running this whole production,

2. Hotels ( modest and clean inns 20 euros a night per person),

3. Food (Hassan being in dialysis needs a very special diet and many vitamin and mineral supplements), 

4.Blood tests ( for compatibility and cross check that therea are no autoimmunological disorders), 

5.Visas( from Morocco to Spain, if it doesn't work here to Argentina, wher I am scouting a hospital in Buenos Aires, Hopital Italiano),

6. Train tickets ( to move around from my home where they will be staying to the Fundació Puigvert), 

7. More tests at Fundació Puigvert and dialysis until he gets the transplant done either here in Bacelona or  where ever we can afford with your pledges.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • SO FAR I NEED URGENTLY 3000 AND FINALLY 80,000 TO TIE US UP TILL  DECEMBER 17,2013:
  • 1500 EUROS FOR:
  • PLANE FARE FOR THE 3 OF US R/T BARCELONA MARRAKECH.
  • HOTELS IN MARRAKECH 2 NIGHTS , TWO ROOMS 3 PEOPLE= 60
  • HOTEL IN CASABLANCA TO PICK UP VISA, 2 NIGHTS X 3 PEOPLE= 80
  • TRANSPORT INSIDE MOROCCO 140 EUROS
  • TRAIN FARE IN BARCELONA 60 EUROS
  • DR. GUIRADO'S FIRST VISIT WITH HASSAN AT FUNDACIÓ PUIGVERT, 200 EUROS
  • BLOOD TESTS: CROSS MATCH AND BLOOD TYPES. DISCARD PROTEIN IN DONOR'S URINE.
  • HASSAN IS THE SWEETEST FUNNIEST FCBARCELONA FAN. HE IS SO WISE AND SO AMAZING. SWEET LOVING AND I WANT HIM TO BECOME THE BEST HOTEL MANAGER IN EUROPE OR IN MY RETIREMENT BUSINESS. AMAZING GUY!!! 22 YEARS OLD!
  • WHAT EVER FUNDS WE RECEIVE WILL GO TO COVERING PLAN A; TRANSPLANT IN BARCELONA, WHICH COSTS 60,000 EUROS PLUS THE VISITS AND THE PREVIOUS DIALYSIS PRE OPERATION, ANOTHER 10,000. 
  • IF GOAL NOT MET, PLAN B) BUENOS AIRES, WHERE I AM GETTING A BUDGET PLANNED AT THE HOSPITAL ITALIANO.
  •  PLAN C) SWEDEN.. IT COULD BE FOR FREE, BUT STILL, VISA AND LODGINGS CAN BE VERY EXPENSIVE.
  •  PLAND D) INDIA... GOOD DOCTORS , VERY CHEAP, BUT AGAIN, A LONG TRIP FOR HASSAN AT THIS PRECARIOUS STATE OF HIS HEALTH, COULD BE DETRIMENTAL. HE IS HIGHLY INTOXICATED FROM SUCH POOR DIALYSIS.

The Impact

THIS IS JUST THE BEGINNING OF AN NGO I WISH TO FORM FOR DIALISYS PATIENTS WORLD WIDE, THAT EITHER HAVE NO ACCESS OR SIMPLY NEED A TRANSPLANT ASAP.

  • I BELIEVE IN IT; BECAUSE WHEN I MET CALVIN WARREN ANDREASSI, HE HAD 6 MONTHS TO LIVE AND OUR LOVE MADE HIS HEPATITIS B VIRUS CONTRACTED FROM MALPRACTICE AT NYHOSPITAL IN 1984. IN NOV 13, 1985, WE MET FELL IN LOVE AND HE SURVIVED! THE VIRUS INEXPLICABLY, MIRACULOUSLY WENT INTO REMISSION!
  • ONLY LOVE CAN MAKE LOVE

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but THAT DOESN'T MEAN YOU CAN'T HELP ME WITH LOGISTICS:

FIND OUT ABOUT VISAS IN SWEDEN, CUBA, INDIA AND ARGENTINA FOR MOROCCANS. I HAVE A SPANISH PASSPORT AND HAVE NO PROBLEM TRAVELLING.

CONTACT ME IN FACEBOOK WITH MY NAME BIRGIT BOFARULL, JOIN THE GROUP I CREATED :

LONG LIVE HASSAN/ABAJO EL REY, ARRIBA HASSAN!

LOVE LIGHT LAUGHTER!

THANKYOU!!!!! GOD BLESS!!!

And that’s all there is to it.

GOD BLESS!!!And that’s all there is to it.

story:
My Cystic Fibrosis Story

Cystic Fibrosis is a genetic disorder you're born with, I was diagnosed with Cystic Fibrosis at 6 months old, but that is hardly the beginning of my journey with CF. When I was 8 years old I was confronted with the decision or whether or not i want to be put on a list for a double lung transplant after spending weeks in and out the hospital. When i was 14 I made the decision that a feeding tube would help me stay healthy and would be a good idea.  These are decisions I made with the help of my parents and my doctors but the ultimate decision was mine. 

In my time in and out of the hospital I made friends with other Cystic's but unfortunately due to the nature of our diseae we're not allowed to be within 6 feet of eachother or in the same room without wearing a mask. 

In April of 2012 I recieved word that one of my friends with Cystic Fibrosis had become critically ill and a few hours later she was gone. I'd never lost someone like that before, the feeling of hopelessness is overwhelming and crushing.  I began to question what the purpose of everything was, and why I was working so hard in college when life would inevidably end.

In August of 2012 those questions only increased at the loss of a very young friend of mine he was 10 years old. He was one of the best people i knew, he really knew how to live. After he passed away I realized that the only thing I could d for them was to help the rest of the Cystic's out there, and that is what i fully intend to do.

 

 

Lets make CF stand for Cure Found!

On this page you can:

  • Pay the registration fee for the Tower of Terror Run 5k and 10 miler
  • Earn some cool perks for friends or family members
  • Anything earned after the goal will go directly to the two foundations we're supporting

Even if the goal isn't reached the funds will go to the deposit on Run Team and to the CF Foundation and the Rock CF Foundation.

The Change your making!

The donations made to this campaign will be saving lives:

  • They will help the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation push a drug through the FDA that will improve the quality of life for many Cystics around the world
  • Raise awareness for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation and the Lets Rock CF Foundation
  • Provide a group of runners with a great night!

Can't Donate, well maybe you can!

There are other ways to help rather than just donating:

  • Spreading the news about our team to friends/family and coworkers who would be interested in running or donating
  • Spreading the word on facebook about the CF Foundation and the great work they do!

 

Every little bit helps, please spread the word!

story:
What is iT?

 

iT is a small – about 25mm across – Bluetooth Low Energy (BTLE) tracking and motion sensor device. When paired with a free, easy to operate app, called Find iT, you can track and locate any item you want.

iT has a range of up to 35m and the app allows you to track up to ten iTs at once, which gives you the power to track and locate multiple items at the same time.

You can use the app to customise every function of iT, such as tethering distance, reporting frequency, motion sensor on/off, name, etc.

iT will initially be released for the iPhone 4S, iPhone 5. with a plan to develop support for the new iPad, iPad Mini, new iPod Touch,  Samsung Android 4.0 devices, and Android 4.3 devices in the future.

The Find iT app

The app is the driver that allows you to use and customise each and every iT.

The screen on the left is what you will see after pairing a device with the app. You can assign the device a colour and a name, e.g. red - mum's handbag; blue - dad's wallet, You can alter the set up at any time.

The screen on the right allows you to view every iT, an indication of how far away iT is or if the iT is out of range. The various colours on the side allow you to quickly scan the list and select your chosen iT. From this screen you can easily switch the connection on or off.

 Features

  • Invisible Tether

Imagine your valued possessions are attached to you with an invisible string (tether). Once you have set the distance of the tether - short, medium or long - the app will notify you if the iT moves outside of the set range. The app will also notify you when it is in range again. For example, while everyone else is fighting for standing room  at the airport carousel you can sit down and wait for notification from Find iT.

  • Motion Sensor

If iT moves you will know about it! iT has a built-in motion sensor so when iT moves you will receive notification. The motion sensor will know if someone opens your locker door, for example, or moves your handbag and will send a notification to your phone.

  • Buzzer/Light

This will be how you will find iT. You will be able to activate a buzzer and a light on the iT from the app so you can see/hear where iT is. A video will be uploaded soon showing how this feature works.

  • Distance indicator

The Find iT app lists every iT you have paired with the device and gives an indication of their distance from your current location using a green (short), yellow (intermediate) and red (long) light next to the name. You can switch them on and off as needed.

 

  • Where was iT?

If you move outside the range of an iT the app will register your location on a map so you know where you were when iT was last in range. You can go back to that location, use the light and buzzer and find your lost item.

 

Attaching iT

  • Drop iT

Drop and go! Simply drop iT into your bag, wallet or folder.

  

  • Stick iT

Use the pre-supplied double sided tape to permanently attach your iT.

 

  • Key Ring iT

We have designed an easy to operate, robust key ring attachment.

  

 

  • Hold iT

The mounting cradle can be attached to anything and everything. The cradle has a simple clip mechanism that allows you to remove and replace iT as required. Choose from  velcro, suction cup or a clip.

 


Device Specs

Diameter: 25mm

Thickness: 4.6mm

Battery Life: Up to 1 year

Battery Type: Coin Cell Battery

Connectivity: Bluetooth 4.0 (Bluetooth Low Energy)

Device Compatibility: iT will initially be released for the iPhone 4S, iPhone 5. with a plan to develop support for the new iPad, iPad Mini, new iPod Touch,  Samsung Android 4.0 devices, and Android 4.3 devices in the future.

 

Our Promise

We are passionate and committed to the continuing development of the iT line of products. We have engaged an award-winning design house to develop prototypes of iT and our future products....more information coming soon.


Where Are We Now? 

We currently have a number of working prototypes of the boards so our focus is:-

  • Testing - trialling and manufacturing a larger batch of pre-production boards to work through any issues that can occur in the early stages of manufacturing
  • App development - we have a functional app but we have to tweak it to look and work the way we want it to.
  • Housing -  samples will arrive shortly and we will then start the tooling process to allow us to produce a quality product in volume.


Why We Need YOUR Help

We have been in development for eight months and are progressing well but now we need your help to take iT to the next level. Our goal is to raise sufficient funds to bring iT to full production and then take iT to the marketplace.Your support will ensure the success of this exciting project. 


Schedule

September 2013 – Indiegogo campaign launched

October/November 2013 – Alpha testing and Certification

November/December 2013 - Beta testing and first consumer testing

January/February 2014 - Production begins/Shipping to customers to commence

November/December 2013 - The campaign for the next device from the iT Company


Our Next Device

Our next device will allow you to receive notifications for any or all of your iTs without having to be in range. Using a WiFi connection and running off mains power you will have constant access through the app so if any of your iTs move or go out of range you will know. This will allow you to set up a personal net over anything you want.


About The iT Company

The iT Company is Australian owned and operated. iT has been designed and developed in Australia.

Meet our team:

Sinclair Chick – Founder and Managing Director of the iT Company

Simon Blyth – Managing Director at LX

Samuel Klistorner – Embedded Systems Engineer at LX

Phill Ogden – Embedded Firmware Engineer at LX
