story:
LOOP

“word of mouth”

automated web based marketing software

LOOP is a marketing software tool that increases profit and efficiency, with the added benefit of providing detailed information of sales that are a direct cause of its application. The people that have viewed it's potential already find it a product that will change the future of digital marketing. The LOOP technology introduces a completely new approach in marketing.It is currently in the last phase of development and I have programmed it to an almost Alpha state.

 

WHY LOOP WORKS

Let's say you want to sell something new. It could be anything from a car, a laptop or a pair of sunglasses to a certain brand of toothpaste.

Conventional marketing relies on large scale and expensive marketing campaigns to obtain new customers.

Thanks to the internet customers now have access to information about all the products available to them, and these products are talked about on a grand scale, generating a community of trusted “experts” that influence the success of products they talk about online.

Yahoo, Google and Facebook are a good example of platforms abundant with customers that have a question about a certain product and are looking for answers. On the other hand you have another group that in turn supplies them with answers, experts in various areas of expertise and enthusiasts eager to answer all their questions. Now of course web marketing has existed for quite some time, but the way this is done is still with the legacy state of mind. The approach is still the same but in a directer smaller scale. Currently

companies rely on generating group awareness through facebook, twitter etc and targeting information to a specific audience. This is not the true meaning of word of mouth; and only reaches one single person.

This is where LOOP comes in; this software is designed to inventively make use of the “Word of Mouth” principle, connecting Supply and Demand. It searches the internet for questions asked by potential customers and then connects them to satisfied and experienced buyers.

Like most people we are tempted to do some research when planning to purchase a new product we are interested in, and when we do we rely on people that know the product to enthuse us about it - to confirm that the product is actually as good as we hope it will be, rather than relying solely on biased advertising.

As stated before; Google, Yahoo and Facebook already make millions by supplying potential customers with advertising they are possibly interested in, based on their browsing history or the interests of their friends. This amount could be significantly increased using LOOP software.

 

HOW LOOP WORKS

primary functionality:

A Company plans to promote a new product and decides to use LOOP to generate word of mouth marketing.

LOOP searches the web, looking for and recognising positive feedback about the product in question.

This can be feedback a customer has paid for in order to promote it or generate sales, a blog, forums or any other web page it is discussed on. A potential buyer posts a question about the products and LOOP links them to a few adamant supporters of it, improving their idea of the product and thus increasing the chance they will buy it. After the potential buyer has been linked with the supporters, we follow and log the data, which in turn allows us to prove a sale actually taking place. The current methods of gathering information on the effect of marketing and actual sales generated by it are an advertising nightmare. LOOP more accurately reaches customers and will better prove an actual sale. All of this, it can do millions of times per day and only running from 1 server, leaving large potential for our software customers.

 

Secondairy functionality:

Apart from connecting potential buyers with supporters LOOP can also search the internet for any

negative feedback given on a product or company.

LOOP can provide its own feedback with answers designed to debunk any claims that are made. Again

not by spraying propaganda, but with actual opinions generated by real people. By connecting to the

rumour spreaders it tones back public opinion to rational train of thought.

 

How is this then sold as a product?

The inherited functionality of the product will make this an easy sell to both consumers as to marketing companies, LOOP can sell itself by picking a few companies and using it on their products. The results generated can then be presented to the companies themselves or the marketing companies working for them.

We would be able to show them actual results of increased sales. Some research and feel for the market was already done, finding there is a huge potential of marketing companies .

Simply said , right now there is nothing out there remotely resembling the potential of this product. It can do the same as is being done right now, but in its full functionality can do five times more.

Being fully automated, the cost of using its services do not go up for the first 1000 clients other then maintainance.

The claim to fame of a product selling itself becomes an actual reality here!

Return On Investment

You should see a return within one year after completion. Below you can see a short list of current products that are similar but have very limited functionality compared to my product. If we would do a quick calculation you could see that a quick return is very feasable and highly likely.

http://engagor.com/pricing/  

asks 21.000,- annually for creating monthly buzz services.

http://www.buzzcapture.com/brand-monitor/

their services can go up to 20.000,- for a single buzz campaign.

http://www.poolworldwide.com/

Creating buzz with guerilla marketing and viral adds at 5000,- a try, not even including the actual making of such videos.

What does this mean when it comes to possible revenue?

If we keep the above mentioned in mind. This means that for LOOP to return its original funding; it would only need about 2 to 3 annual contracts with a brand they have in their current portfolio. Considering that we could provide a lot more and already have a much directer way of communicating with their end consumers, we find ourselves in a position where we can offer more for less. This in any market is the best selling position to be in. As the costs very marginally go up with the intensity of using our service, LOOP is almost cost neutral from this point.

What is great about LOOP

I am very aware that when it comes to marketing people think about being sold things they don't want; however this software can only sell what other people already love, therefor it puts an end to spamming customers to sell things they do not want, but instead caters to people who in fact are looking for something specific; and assists them!

story:
"I was almost victim of the flooding a few days ago as I drove my van through what looked to be very shallow water in a strip mall parking lot, only to find out it as over 2 feet deep! My van managed to get to the edge of the deep water before stalling out. It restarted back up and all was fine. But for many others in my neighborhood and city, they were not so lucky" - Pensacola Resident


I ask everyone  to come together to help those who has lost everything and misplaced from thier homes!!! It could have been you, and you would want the help!! SO LET'S DO THE RIGHT THING!!!! GOD is watching!!

story:
Amy Hopkins' New Heart Valve

Amy Hopkins is a remarkable woman whose life is the embodiment of living simply and giving generously. A member of the Musical Instrument Maker's Forum, talented musician, skilled luthier, and accomplished carpenter, she lives an incredibly modest life. Amy cares for her ailing father at his home and lives in a building on the same farm without the modern conveniences many of us take for granted.

              

When Katrina struck New Orleans Amy not only helped restore numerous instruments that had been damaged, she also made multiple trips to NOLA to help rebuild fellow musician Sunpie and wife's home.

           

Amy also helped my husband and I rebuild our home after the 2010 Nashville flood. She was the first to arrive and declared a home that had been under 2' of water for over three days, "not bad. This is nothing. We can save it."

             

Now it's up to us to save Amy. Recently, her doctor discovered a congenital defect in her aorta where two of the aortic valvular leaflets had fused during development; a condition called Bicuspid Aortic Valve. People with BAV tire easily and have difficulty maintaining stamina for moderate to intense physical activity. The heart is unduly stressed in order to either pump more blood through a defective valve or attempt to circulate regurgitation blood through a leaking valve. Surgery to replace the defective valve was imperative. Amy's doctor told her without the procedure she would be dead within a year's time.

                  

Thankfully Amy had her surgery at Johns Hopkins on June 15th. She did better than expected and is now convalescing at home. With no insurance and barely any posessions Amy has too much to qualify for assistance yet far too little to pay the mounting medical bills herself. Our goal is to raise $35,000 to go in it's entirety (minus indiegogo's fees) towards Amy's surgery and aftercare expenses.

 Please help Amy in any way you can. If you can give a few dollars your donation, however small, makes a difference. If you can't give you can spread the word. Share Amy's story by using the sharing tools below or by using good old-fashioned word of mouth. Let's show Amy that a lifetime of caring has earned her a ton of good karma in return!

story:
Our Story

We are a multidisciplinary group of inventors, software developers, permacultors and other people that wants to start a transition industrial space.

We want to create a space in which to live and work, with space for environment friendly industries (recycling, used-oil transformation, elaborated food products and others) with low rent costs and common infrastructure.

The Impact

Catalonia has been hit hard by the crisis. There is not much work and the housing situation is practically unsustainable. We want to create a space that supports other projects on the surrounding community by ways of giving low rent for artists or small businesses that mind the ecology, restoring an unused space to bring new work and applied grassroots technology.

We want to create new solutions for the transition towns most common problems, and document and share this solutions with the rest of our extended activist and ecologist network.

What We Need & What You Get

We are a group of about 40 people that wants to live or work there, and we hope that more people and projects will join as soon and the place is available. By now, we are still in the process of buying the place and we have gathered a part of the amount needed to sign the sale contract. We are working with a credit cooperative from Italy that will give us a credit of the same amount of money that we can gather. The amount of money we gather should be of at least 95.000 Euro, so they give us other 95.000 and we can sign the contract, and after that we will need to pay to the owner 2.100 more Euro per month, plus the credit.

We have already gathered 55.000 Euro, but still need 40.000 more. If we gather this 40.000 we will be able to pay the sign and have some money (30.000) for the initial restoration. From then on, we will have to pay around 3.000 euros per month during 10 years.

We want our friends to support us on the buying of the land, and we would like to have many small supporters in stead of a huge supporter, so we thought of asking for 5.000 euros from you , thought the mor ewe raise the easier it will be to fix the space and reform it. It is likely that we will be able to buy the place without your contribution, but if for any reason this will not happen, we would use the money to recover the 30.000 euros of the reserve that we already payed.

This is a very ambitious project but we think that we need to start thinking other ways of living and we have to be ready for the big crisis that is coming. We want to be a resource center for our near community and abroad, documenting and sharing experiences, giving workshops and creating employment for the local community.

Our space wants to be open to new projects and initiatives, being the stable home of 20 families and several other people for short time (like you!) and giving low price rents for small local businesses that help on this transition.

We want to be a networking space and welcome people that wants to do smaller residences of 2 or 3 months in the place. That's why many of the pledges are to enjoy locally: we want to meet you, or your friends!


Other Ways You Can Help

We need a lot of materials for the construction of the site, seeds for the garden and of course hand to build it up. If you want to work with us, please drop us a line.

You can always organise benefits for our project, or spread the message of this campaign to other people.

story:
Short Summary

Hi!  I'm Michelle Lewis.  For the past two years my son, Michael, has run track with the "Racin' Rams", a team with North Carolina's "Bridge II Sports", a 501(c)3 organization dedicated to giving people with disabilities opportunities to play the sports they love!  See more about Bridge II Sports at www.bridge2sports.org . 

This year several of our "Racin' Rams" track team participated in the Mid-Atlantic games in early June and earned spots at the National Junior Disability Championships (NJDC).  Our athletes qualified to throw shot put, discus, and javelin, and to race in the 100-, 200-, 400-, and 800-meter wheelchair races.  See more about the team athttp://www.bridge2sports.org/index.php/programs/trianglearea/track-field .  

Our head coach, Mia Rublee, attended college on wheelchair basketball and track scholarships. She holds a Masters Degree in Social Work (MSW) from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a Bachelors Degree from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champagne in Sociology. Read more about Mia at http://www.bridge2sports.org/index.php/bridge-blog/100-track-and-field/183-mia-the-bridge-ii-sports-track-and-field-coach .

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to earn up to $6,000 for our trip.  This should pay for 6 airline tickets ($526 each) from Raleigh, NC to Phoenix, AZ, 3 hotel rooms ($89 each), ground transportation for athletes and their wheelchairs, and the entry fee.

Almost all of our events are "travel" events, as there are so few junior disabled competitors.  Although parents and "Bridge II Sports" plan for that, we did not know that we would qualify for Nationals and with such short notice, any help funding this unexpected opportunity will be greatly appreciated. Any unused funds will remain with Bridge II Sports, our 501(c)3 organization/sponsor, to be used for next year's travel to distance events (specifically to travel to Nationals or regional events leading to National qualifications).

The Impact

Coach Mia says that "Letting our kids go to Nationals allows them to continue to compete at a high level, to gain independence, confidence, and self-assurance, teaches them to set goals, and may lead to the Paralympics".  We're hoping for a few Paralympians!

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you contribute or not, you can help in other ways

  • Please help spread the word!  Let your friends know, share on Facebook, Twitter, and other media outlets you use! 
  • Please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for everything you do to help us get these amazing kids to Nationals!

story:
My name is Jeff Danglo and my idea to improve the healthcare system is to provide icons for the pages and pages of a patient's text data, to improve the efficiency of communication between healthcare professionals.  I'm a Registered Nurse,  have a BS In Social Work from Florida State University,  a US army veteran.   

Today's healthcare workers, raised with the internet and educated as much by images as by words, must comprehend large amounts of patient data and make immediate informed decisions.  Healthcare professionals deal with heavy workloads, time pressures, interruptions, and stress - an efficient communication system is essential to reduce errors, increase the time of hands-on care, and prevent unnecessary hospitalizations.  Icons can improve communication.

The goal of this project is to improve the healthcare system by creating and making available on my website www.healthcareinpictures.com hundreds of icons representing a wide variety of patient data including:   Any healthcare organization, doctor, nurse, therapist, or administrator may utilize these icons for free - just copy and paste whatever fits your needs and makes the healthcare delivery process more efficient.

I am seeking funding to pay for a graphic designer.  The design process occurs in 4 stages:  1)  Define and research the patient information desired - production of initial image which best represents this information.   2) Consulting with graphic designer - design changes, revisions, with goal of maintaining same style and simplicity.  3)  Obtain feedback from healthcare professionals - nurses, social workers, doctors, on the accuracy of information the icon is intended to convey, then additional revisions. 4) Post on www.healthcareinpictures.com.  Special thanks to Harvard School of Architecture  Student Lauren Matrka for assisting with initial design. 

Mistakes leading to patient's deaths are much higher than previously thought, and may be as high as 400,000 deaths per year according to a new study in the Journal of Patient Safety.  Each year preventable adverse events (PAE's) lead to the deaths of 210,000 to 400,00 patients who seek care at a hospital.  These figures would make medical errors the third leading cause of death after heart disease and cancer. I truly believe my project can reduce these deaths.  

If you have any questions please e-mail me at jeffdanger555@gmail.com . Thank you for stopping by.  Jeff Danglo BSW, RN

I truly believe my project can reduce these deaths.  If you have any questions please e-mail me at jeffdanger555@gmail.com . Thank you for stopping by.  Jeff Danglo BSW, RN

story:
Introduction 

Hey fellow Indiegogo supporters, I am Dah Yun from Innopharm. Together with 2 partners of mine, Harvey and Raymond, we share the same passion for innovation in healthcare and pharmaceutical products. We work as pharmacists in different hospitals. Over the years, we have managed to come out with some cool and innovative products.

W-H-Y

Based on our working experience, we noticed that the patients in the hospital have been facing discomfort and inconvenience using the conventional intravenous (IV) stand. The inconvenience includes: 

1) Patients difficult to Mobilize freely especially when they need to go to Washroom or go up/down Staircase

2)Congestion in lift when patients travel by lift

3)Limitation of Space between Beds in wards

4)Backflow of blood when IV bags carried fall

5)Fall injuries due to IV drip line tangled by IV stand rollers.

SO..

This is not the quality of life of patient that we would like to see. So it comes to a question: IS IT TIME FOR A BETTER IV STAND?


W-H-A-T

Let me introduce to you guys our prototype, the Multipole. 



It is not just another IV stand, it is a convertible IV stand. It is different as

1)It can be diassembled (Upper part as a portable pole that holds IV bag/blood bag; lower part as walking stick (optional) to assist weaker patient)

2)Light. It weights only about 0.6kg on its own. With IV bag, it is around 1kg.

3)Ergonomically design.

4)Easy to be put on/taken off. Convenient for patients who have urgency to go washroom. 

5)Can be worn on any shoulders.

6)Safer. IV bag will not fall and IV drip line will not be tangled by rollers.


This Is For...

Main target populations are:-

1)Patients encouraged to ambulate

2)Post surgical patient

3)Patient on painkiller/chemotherapy

4)Patients without guardian

5)Young patients

6)Elderly

However, when it is not dissembled, it can still function as a normal IV stand just like a conventional one which can be used by all patients.


Basically...

To summarize, Multipole is much more convenient, safer and time saving for patients who need IV administration rather than pushing the conventional one-piece IV stand around.


Why Fund Us?

With this product, we can tackle a lot of problems and issues in the hospital. However, we know there are still rooms of improvement for this product. Currently, for the prototype, we are only using PVC and some recycled household materials due to financial restraint. We know this will not meet the required criterias of medical devices used in hospital setting.


Our Plan...

In initial phase, we intend to evaluate this product at my current hospital which is Hospital Queen Elizabeth, Kota Kinabalu. In later phase, we are hoping to bring this to next level where more hospitals or daycare centers can use our products. 


How You Can Help

To make this happen we need to produce a final batch of products with:

1)Refined design

2)Suitable material such as polypropylene (PE) and aluminium.

3)3D printing technology (optional)

Everyone has get used to the conventional IV stand which is there for centuries even though patients are facing so much inconvenience. It is time for a change. And this is where you guys can play a part in. Please lend us a hand and support us. Together we can be part of this big plan to improve the quality of life of patients.

With your massive support, hopefully we can introduce Multipole to all hospitals worldwide. Your contribution will help us to produce the final batch and lessen the overall production costs.


In Return..

To produce a final batch of product, it wont be easy without you guys. These are the perk we are offering.

2 USD: We would like to extend our gratitude on your support personally in the form of a warm email from us.

5 USD: Thank you guys for the generosity. I guess we need to shoot a thank you video, personally just for you!

10 USD: We would like to let you know more Sabah, a beautiful state in Malaysia which is a truly unique adventure, eco, wildlife and scuba diving paradise of the new millenium . A postcard by our founding members will be on your doorstep soon.

15 USD: We would mention and thank you personally on our official facebook page to appreciate your contribution.

25 USD: Acknowledgment. We will have your names engraved on our first batch of products.

50 USD: We will use your designated name for the name of our Multipole series by batch.

85 USD: You are getting a Multipole (upper portable pole) from our first batch! You are free to donate it to your nearby hospital or day-care center.


Future Plan

We can actually integrate more functions to the Multipole which can benefit patient more. We have put some thinking to possible functions like

1)GPS system to trace patients' location

2)Fall sensor to detect any incidents of fall happened

This can be done with your help as well. 


How You Can Help US....more

Please share this around. We can all make a difference. With your help, we can reach out to more people who need this portable IV stand. 


Contact Us At

Lau Dah Yun

Personal Email: Lau_dahyun@yahoo.com

story:
Who We Are & What We're Doing

We are 1REACH. A team of four young professionals united through shared passions for sports, memorable events, and community development. We came together through our Sport and Event Marketing program at George Brown College.

We are currently working on our event Pump Up Parasport! It is a Sitting Volleyball Tournament that aims to raise awareness of sports for disabled athletes in a fun and educational way. All proceeds will go to ParaSport Ontario's Ready, Willing and Able program. Ready, Willing and Able is an awareness and first contact program that gives people with disabilities and others the opportunity to try different parasports in a fun and supportive environment. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your help in putting on our event and raising donations for ParaSport Ontario's Ready, Willing and Able program. We have started this event with our own seed money and are facing some additional unforseen costs. While we will be receiving money from the teams that register for our event, this page has been created to help us with these additional unforseen costs.

All contributions will go towards:

  • Paying for our venue, a gymnasium at Ryerson University
  • After we cover the venue cost, all contributions will go to ParaSport Ontario's  Ready, Willing and Able program
**Tax receipts can be issued for amounts $20 or larger. Please let us know if you would like a tax receipt 1reach.gbc@gmail.com

    The Impact

    With your help we will be able to secure our venue and raise donations for Ready, Willing and Able. We believe in the power of ParaSport Ontario's Ready, Willing and Able program in raising awareness of parasports in our community and to share the athletic endeavours and challenges these athletes have overcome. It also encourages people to maintain a healthy active lifestyle, while being introduced to different sports. By helping to raise funds for Ready, Willing and Able, we can help them strengthen and enhance their scope on a provincial and national level and support their goal of being the leader in the community for persons with a physical disability. By donating to ParaSport Ontario's Ready, Willing and Able program we can help them be more self-sufficient and maximize involvement of athletes, coaches, officials and volunteers in parasports and paralympic sports.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you are unable to contribute financially, please share this page with your family and friends! We appreciate people spreading the word about over event just as much as! Thank you for your support!

story:
Hello Indigogoers :)

My name is Sharon. I have been a Massage Therapist since 2005. I love my job. Last year I even published an e-book with funny stories from the massage room and people really liked it.

I have a very active imagination and I am very connected to my Inner Child. I think everyone should be. As the famous saying goes: "You don't stop playing because you get old, You get old because you stop playing".

 

 

In that spirit, I have dreamed of opening my own Massage place, which will combine my two passions and pamper the Inner Child in each one of us. When you'll enter my spa, you'll leave your worries behind and receive a holistic Body-Mind energy treatment which leaves you refreshed and with that child-like feeling of awesomeness. You'll also get tips to take home and apply on a daily basis.

The funds that I am hoping to raise here with your help, will help transform
this idea to reality, the first stage being: finding and leasing the right venue in Los Angeles area, and convert the space to 8 individual massage rooms designed per my unique vision and specifications.

My offered perks all have to do with Fairy Tales and Massage according to the amount donated. Any amount is appreciated and if you can't donate, you can interest your friends with my campaign and that's great too! I invite you to check out my video and share it.

Thank you so much and May we all get to fulfill our wishes!

* My offered perks will be sent out to my campaign contributors towards the end of the campaign. If I can send them sooner, I will :)

** If I don't reach my goal to open the place, I will be unable to fulfill some our the perks, but I will compensate my contributors with a similar value reward.

story:
Single mom of to lovely kids need neck fixation surgery to "come back to life"


I am a physical therapist and NLP Master Coach and life Coach. I have used to help People all my life, being a good person and finding help for others. Then I was hit in the back of my head, being struck Down and got serious injury to my ligaments in my neck, and the vertebraes twist themselves into the nervous cord and nerveous system. I end up lying in bed With Extreme pain, nauseous, dizziness, lack of sight, nerve pain, shivering etc. I cannot longer attain my kids, follow them to activities or og outside my house. Being With friends, going to the School Meetings etc is impossible. I need to og to abroad to get a surgery, because the doctors in Norway will not perform this kind of surgery. And since I cannot work anymore, I cannot rise the Money for such an operation. All I want to in life, is to be With my kids, and to get back to work, so I can contribute to help People again and be a part of society.

I hope you can help me, good People out there in the world. It would be so wonderful If anyone out there would help me get back to a meaningful life again, so I can be a mother again (not a patient, leaving my kids on their own, full of sorrow) and when I recover, I can work to help other patients and People. That was why I chose my profession in the first Place :) <3

The surgery costs 27 000 $, so all contributions will help me on my way. I am extremely Grateful for all help ! If I don`t get all the Money from here, I will continue to contact organizations, my community, friends and familiy  etc until I get there.

I am Grateful for all help, prayers and if you can spread the word.

God bless you and Love from Kari

story:
What got this all started?

Well, it was a simple question that I asked to Lorrie Brilla, PhD.: "Could Structural Integration ever become part of the research she conducts at Western Washington University?"  Her reply was simple, unhesitating, and an enthusiastic, "yes". You see, Lorrie has had positive results from Structural Integration, and as a professor of kinesiology, she has a professional interest in seeing the ideas of SI tested. 

Within a few months we had a research design, and now, just about a year later we are nearly ready to begin the project.  We only need to cover the costs of the 150 SI sessions, plus the associated costs of running this crowd funding campaign. 

This is where you come in.

Your generous contribution to this project insures that it will go forward. This is an all-or-none campaign, which means if we don't meet the goal of raising $23,000 the project will not go forward, and your money won't be spent. This also means that you can give generously without fearing that your donation will be wasted. Most importantly however, you can feel great about contributing to a project that we hope will make a major contribution to validating the effects of Structural Integration and to increasing the public's awareness .


An Important Opportunity to Help Research Get Done

  • Scientific research is needed to support the claims of Structural Integration
  • With evidence-based research Structural Integration can gain wider acceptance
  • An easy, exciting, and direct way for individuals to support independent  research

More About this Community-Based Partnership

  • This campaign will pay for the cost of doing 150 SI sessions as well as the costs associated with hosting the campaign through indiegogo
  • WWU will contribute the experimental design, testing equipment and labs, and data analysis needed to complete the project, as well as publishing submissions to journals and conferences
  • The Rolf Institute of Structural Integration has generously donated $5000
  • Your financial support can make this research happen

You can read the full research prospectus here


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $23,000 to cover the SI sessions and costs associated with the indiegogo campaign. 

As an expression of our appreciation for your donation we have some cool gifts to give. Check them out over there on the right hand side of the page.

The total breakdown of expenses are as follows:

  • SI sessions - $18,000
  • Indiegogo fees + credit card processing - $1500
  • Video production - $1500
  • Gifts - $2000

The Impact: Validating SI and Getting it on the Map

With this project everyone wins. The Goal is to publish and present the results in journals and conferences.

  • SI practitioners through their contributions have a chance to be a force in gaining acceptance for their work
  • Clients can trust that the claims of Structural Integration rests on solid evidence
  • Researchers begin building a foundation that can support further inquiry for years to come

Risks & Challenges

Frankly, I hope the biggest challenge we face -raising the money to go forward- won't be much of a challenge at all. We have 40 days to get it done, and I won't rest until we reach the goal. That is my commitment.

My hope is the community of SI practitioners will see it similarly, realize the potential of this opportunity, and get behind it. We need everyone to help the dollars flow by spreading the word.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us get this research done. 

    So, please 

    • Make some noise about your campaign - tell your colleagues, friends, family members, and clients.
    • You can use the indiegogo tools to help spread the word!
    • Please don't hesitate to be in touch during the campaign! We will be :)

story:
THE WORTHWHILE MILE

The Worthwhile Mile is all about creating opportunities for people to engage in active, service-oriented adventures dedicated to improving awareness and support for worthy causes.

This summer, the WM will deliver 3 long-distance cycling trips to generate support for the field of Anaplastology:

  • WSEF - Denver to Durango, June 2-8
  • Chi Ride - Chicago / North Shore, September 7
  • IAA - Nashville to Asheville, September 20-26

What is Anaplastology?  It is a field that combines science, art, and technology in order to create facial or somatic (body) prostheses for patients who have suffered severe disfigurement due to cancer, traumatic injury, or congenital origin. Prosthetic treatment provides an alternative when surgical reconstruction is unachievable or not desired. Most importantly, it offers the possibility of some functional and psychological rehabilitation that is vital to a patient's well-being.

Many people, myself included, have never heard of anaplastology or don't a have a clear understanding of what this type of treatment involves. Unfortunately, this lack of awareness also exists among a considerable proportion of health care professionals. As a result, many patients are not informed about prosthetic rehabilitation as a potential avenue for treatment, and often those who may benefit from a prosthesis are not referred to an anaplastologist. Can you imagine being a burn victim or losing your eye to cancer, and going years before learning that you could have received care had you only been told about it?

You can help! There are less than 200 anaplastologists practicing worldwide--they make up a small group of talented specialists who need your help to educate the world about existing patient resources. Your support will benefit not only anaplastology patients, but also the growth of the field. It is our hope that The Worthwhile Mile will bring attention to this important clinical practice, while also generating support for its advancement through research and education.


Why do we need your help?  How will we use it?

  • Every dollar donated helps us execute these rides.

Why is it important that we succeed in executing the Worthwhile Mile 2014? 

We are at the foundation level of forming a not-for-profit organization focused on: 

  • organizing service-oriented, active adventures
  • educating the world about under-represented or poorly known patient populations
  • educating patients about services and opportunities available to them
  • improving awareness about patient needs
  • increasing support for research and education to advance services and improve quality of life

The extended mission of this initiative is to increase advocacy for patient populations and health topics that are less understood, under-researched and/or under-represented. 

This year, our focus is on soft-tissue prosthetic patients for whom surgical reconstruction is either unachievable or not desired by the patient. WM 2014 rides campaign for these patients by increasing awareness and support for Anaplastology. 

What's on the horizon?  The Worthwhile Mile combines Health Promotion through physically-engaging adventure with Social Advocacy by creating opportunities to educate others about the unique needs of less-know/under-represented populations. 

Associating one's adventure with a cause...

  • motivates the adventure,
  • brings attention to the cause, and
  • produces new, infomed advocates! 
Over the next five years, we invite the public to share with us about patient populations and areas of health they would like to see represented by Worthwhile Mile adventures. If you have an adventure in mind and would like assistance organizing a campaign for the cause of your choice, contact The Worthwhile Mile. 

The opportunities are ENDLESS! 

Examples of heatlh topics and populations for which we aim to increase our advocacy efforts include (but are not limited to) Blood Disorders, Autoimmune Rheumatic Diseases (such as Sceroderma), Gender Identity & Transition Health, Violence-related physical injury or paralysis, and health needs of the short- and long-term homeless. 


How does YOUR CONTRIBUTION make an IMPACT this year?

  • Remember, every dollar donated helps us to execute this summer's three rides (WSEF, CHI, IAA).
  • Between the WSEF & IAA rides, 40 riders commit to fund-raise $1000. That means we have the potential to raise $40,000 for a worthy cause: facial and body prosthetic rehabilitation, aka Anaplastology.
  • The success of this summer's rides will permit the Worthwhile Mile to establish an organizational structure from which it can extend its support to more and more worthy causes.
  • Your contributions will be used to offset the expenses of: 
  1. Organization & Leadership Development (NPO Incorporation & 501c3 Application processes; legal & financial services) ($1400)
  2. Support Vehicle & Equipment Transport (including gas) ($2000)
  3. Food & Overnight Provisions ($600)
  4. Liability Coverage ($2500)


Every dollar towards our goal amount is necessary, appreciated, and will absolutely contribute to the success of this initiative.

Thank you in advance for your support!


Sincerest thanks, 

Erin Stevens

WM Founder & Lead Organizer


Visit WORTHWHILEMILE.COM

------------------------------------- Detail - WM 2014 Rides  ----------------------------------

WSEF - Denver to Durango, June 2-8

  • Supporting the Walter Spohn Education Fund (WSEF) research and education initiatives in Facial and Somato (body) Prosthetics

Chi Ride - Chicago / North Shore, September 7

  • Supporting the development and execution of The Worthwhile Mile

IAA - Nashville to Asheville, September 21-26

  • Supporting the International Anaplastology Association (IAA), which promotes quality patient care by supporting the development of best practices in anaplastology through educational conferences, networking, publication, and advocacy opportunities


----------------------------- Detail - Organizational Background --------------------------

What kind of experience to WM Organizers bring to the project?                             A brief background on who is behind this project

Erin Stevens, WM founder and lead organizer:

  • The Worthwhile Mile's founder and lead organizer, Erin Stevens, has 5+ years experience in advocacy and outreach, fundraising, grant-writing and assessment, as well as clinical experience and research applied to prosthetic rehabilitation and public health. 
  • She has devoted herself to service-oriented, active adventures -- organizing the Worthwhile Mile's inaugural 1000-mile cycling campaign (2012), and leading a coast-to-coast cycling trip with Bike & Build, a non-profit organization dedicated to Affordable Housing (2013).
  • Stevens holds a Master of Science in Biomedical Visualization from the University of Illinois at Chicago, where she received clinical training and studied Instructional Design for biomedical and health communication. 
  • She has spent over five years establishing herself within an international network of colleagues practicing in the field of cranio-facial rehabilitation, collaborating on innovative solutions to improving patient outcomes and clinical experience.
  • Stevens is currently pursuing a Master of Public Health degree fro the University of Illinois at Chicago, where she is focusing her research interests on Community Health and Health Promotion. 
  • Stevens has served for the past two years as the Sponsorship Committee Chair for the anaplastology's professional association, the International Anaplastology Association; Stevens also serves as Board Chair for the Facial Prosthetics Initiatives Network.
  • Her commitment to adolescent and young adult educational programming and curriculum development includes over 5 years of service between her work with AVID (Achievement Via Individual Determination) and UIC's African American Academic Network. 
  • Stevens continues to keep life extra interesting through her volunteer service with the Chicago League of Lady Arm Wrestlers as both an arm wrestler and CLLAW Committee Member (Sideshow Theatre Company, Chicago). 
Field/Professional experience (see Stevens' LinkedIn profile):
  • Research, Facial Prosthetics/Anaplastology at University of Illinois Hospital & Heath Sciences System - Craniofacial Center
  • Visiting Clinical Anaplastologist at University of Illinois at Chicago
  • Research & Development; Design and 3D Specialist at DENOYER-GEPPERT SCIENCE ITL
  • Online Learning Resources Designer (Dept. of Biomedical Health Information Science) at University of Illinois at Chicago
  • Event Coordinator at Student Association of Medical Artists
  • Educator, African American Academic Network
  • Program Staff, Havens Community Center


The WM Organizing Team includes: 

  • Kelly Kraft - Freelance Project Manager, New York; WM Trip Leader 2014, Bike & Build Trip Leader 2010, 2013, Climate Ride Trip Leader 2013
  • Danielle Carlson - Social Innovation Communications Specialist, Groupon - Chicago, IL
  • Ashley Gallo, MS - Community Support Specialist, QMHP, Thresholds, Chicago, IL 
  • Dr. Kelli Stevens-Selbst, DPM, MS - St. Joseph's Medical Center - Houston, TX
  • Michael Collins - North Carolina; WM Trip Leader 2014; Bike & Build Trip Leader 2013
  • Yolondra Yarborough - Chicago, IL; WM 2014 Trip Leader
story_txt:
THE WORTHWHILE MILE
The Worthwhile Mile is all about creating opportunities for people to engage in active, service-oriented adventures dedicated to improving awareness and support for worthy causes.This summer, the WM will deliver 3 long-distance cycling trips to generate support for the field of Anaplastology:

WSEF - Denver to Durango, June 2-8


Chi Ride - Chicago / North Shore, September 7

IAA - Nashville to Asheville, September 20-26

What is Anaplastology?  It is a field that combines science, art, and technology in order to create facial or somatic (body) prostheses for patients who have suffered severe disfigurement due to cancer, traumatic injury, or congenital origin. Prosthetic treatment provides an alternative when surgical reconstruction is unachievable or not desired. Most importantly, it offers the possibility of some functional and psychological rehabilitation that is vital to a patient's well-being.
Many people, myself included, have never heard of anaplastology or don't a have a clear understanding of what this type of treatment involves. Unfortunately, this lack of awareness also exists among a considerable proportion of health care professionals. As a result, many patients are not informed about prosthetic rehabilitation as a potential avenue for treatment, and often those who may benefit from a prosthesis are not referred to an anaplastologist. Can you imagine being a burn victim or losing your eye to cancer, and going years before learning that you could have received care had you only been told about it?
You can help! There are less than 200 anaplastologists practicing worldwide--they make up a small group of talented specialists who need your help to educate the world about existing patient resources. Your support will benefit not only anaplastology patients, but also the growth of the field. It is our hope that The Worthwhile Mile will bring attention to this important clinical practice, while also generating support for its advancement through research and education.
Why do we need your help?  How will we use it?Every dollar donated helps us execute these rides.Why is it important that we succeed in executing the Worthwhile Mile 2014? We are at the foundation level of forming a not-for-profit organization focused on: 
organizing service-oriented, active adventures
educating the world about under-represented or poorly known patient populations
educating patients about services and opportunities available to them
improving awareness about patient needs
increasing support for research and education to advance services and improve quality of life

The extended mission of this initiative is to increase advocacy for patient populations and health topics that are less understood, under-researched and/or under-represented. 
This year, our focus is on soft-tissue prosthetic patients for whom surgical reconstruction is either unachievable or not desired by the patient. WM 2014 rides campaign for these patients by increasing awareness and support for Anaplastology. What's on the horizon?  The Worthwhile Mile combines Health Promotion through physically-engaging adventure with Social Advocacy by creating opportunities to educate others about the unique needs of less-know/under-represented populations. Associating one's adventure with a cause...
motivates the adventure,
brings attention to the cause, and
produces new, infomed advocates! 
Over the next five years, we invite the public to share with us about patient populations and areas of health they would like to see represented by Worthwhile Mile adventures. If you have an adventure in mind and would like assistance organizing a campaign for the cause of your choice, contact The Worthwhile Mile. The opportunities are ENDLESS! Examples of heatlh topics and populations for which we aim to increase our advocacy efforts include (but are not limited to) Blood Disorders, Autoimmune Rheumatic Diseases (such as Sceroderma), Gender Identity & Transition Health, Violence-related physical injury or paralysis, and health needs of the short- and long-term homeless. How does YOUR CONTRIBUTION make an IMPACT this year?
Remember, every dollar donated helps us to execute this summer's three rides (WSEF, CHI, IAA).
Between the WSEF & IAA rides, 40 riders commit to fund-raise $1000. That means we have the potential to raise $40,000 for a worthy cause: facial and body prosthetic rehabilitation, aka Anaplastology.
The success of this summer's rides will permit the Worthwhile Mile to establish an organizational structure from which it can extend its support to more and more worthy causes.
Your contributions will be used to offset the expenses of: 
Organization & Leadership Development (NPO Incorporation & 501c3 Application processes; legal & financial services) ($1400)
Support Vehicle & Equipment Transport (including gas) ($2000)
Food & Overnight Provisions ($600)
Liability Coverage ($2500)
Every dollar towards our goal amount is necessary, appreciated, and will absolutely contribute to the success of this initiative.Thank you in advance for your support!Sincerest thanks, Erin StevensWM Founder & Lead OrganizerVisit WORTHWHILEMILE.COM------------------------------------- Detail - WM 2014 Rides  ----------------------------------WSEF - Denver to Durango, June 2-8
Supporting the Walter Spohn Education Fund (WSEF) research and education initiatives in Facial and Somato (body) Prosthetics
Chi Ride - Chicago / North Shore, September 7Supporting the development and execution of The Worthwhile MileIAA - Nashville to Asheville, September 21-26

story:
WaterStop Carts are mobile units that purify municipal water; our intent is to replace the need for bottled water. Each mobile cart carries 50 gallons of water or the equivalent of 400-16 oz bottles of water (refilling a cart’s tank is as easy as using a common hose). Carts use the same filtration system used in bottled water for purity as well as taste and have a cooling system. (One note about the video, it mentions using nano silver to line the plumbing...we will not be using this unsustainable substance.)

Hello, my name is Nan Harris and I sold my co-op in Manhattan to finance WaterStop Carts LLC, a socially responsible, for profit business. Why? Because our world is facing a clean water crisis and it makes me angry that the bottled water industry has taken life’s essential element and made a commodity of it! You can live longer without food then you can without drinking water. We have designed a new delivery system with the intent of replacing the unsustainable use of bottled water (we will not be selling water, only the carts, filters and bottles).

                            

As consumers we are paying between 300 to 4,000 times the costs of tap water when we buy bottled water. The average American spends over $250 a year on bottled water. We also end up paying for the cost to our environment of carbon released and the oil and water used in manufacturing and transportation. Why are we paying this? Because bottled water is just easier to find. Trying to refill bottles from public sources is almost impossible and almost always distasteful. We can change this!!!



How do our carts solve this problem?

“Accessibility through Mobility”is the foundation of our thinking at WaterStop. Our mobile water carts go where people go, venues of all kinds. Sometimes we just say it’s “water on wheels”.The cart uses municipal water sources and the same filtration system used by bottled water companies. It delivers purified, fresh tasting water, it's like bottled water without the bottle. Refilling the tank, which holds 50 gallons or 400 – 16 oz bottles of water, is as easy as using a common garden hose. A cooling system is built in to keep the water just above room temperature. Standard filters are easy to change and commonly found in hardware stores like Home Depot (WaterStop will provide specialized filters in case of local water issues due to aging infrastructure or contamination) 

As mentioned in the video, digital banners are mounted on the cart and provide sponsorship opportunities so the cart can pay for itself. In the second prototype, a video monitor will be added for more sponsorship, entertainment and educational opportunities.

The Second Generation cart will also have Wifi so the cart becomes not only a Water Stop but a Hot Spot as well. A solar tower will be added to extend the battery life. Eventually, when solar can produce enough energy to run our mobile cart, we will convert to solar completely. Two notes: the completed look of the cart will have a modern, sleek design and our website will not go up until we have completed the beta-test.

Why Are We Crowd Funding?

Our purpose in raising more funds is to start designing the next generation cart. We will use these funds to build five carts for a beta-test at 5 US schools that have lead problems or other issues in their drinking water supply, a common problem in all 50 states. From this beta-test we will be able to complete the engineering of the next generation cart. 

Did you know that children in the US have to buy bottled water from vending machines in our Public Schools? In 2010 Congress passed a mandate that all public schools provide FREE water in all eating areas by 2014. So far there has been no progress on this issue that doesn't cost our underfunded schools significant money. Our carts provide the answer. The sponsorship opportunities on the carts will replace any potential lost income from selling bottled water in vending machines.

                            We are offering vendors who sell bottled water, 

                                          a way to replace lost income:


WaterStop will also make available to vendors and individuals our collapsible, reusable bottle to replace lost income from bottled water sales. Vendors can sell the collapsible bottles and offer free refills. This offer of a free refill will also bring customers back with the likelihood of another purchase. As seen in the video; the bottle is BPA free, dishwasher safe, good for 1,000 opening and closings and can be labeled by businesses for marketing purposes. We will also make these bottles available to the public, eventually designing our own line of collapsible, reusable bottles.

Manufacturing the Cart:

One of our partners, an environmental lawyer who contracts with the Department of Defense, (the DOD has expressed interest in WaterStop Carts for their installations), has established the likelihood of our carts being manufactured on tribal lands in the U.S.. Newly built manufacturing facilities gives everyone, sellers and buyers, a terrific tax break and creates much needed jobs.

Our Ultimate Goal:

To make mobile water carts available around the world. Design changes will be made to the units to adapt to various countries terrain, needs and local materials. In remote areas, like isolated villages, the cart may be a transport vehicle for already clean water.All carts will be manufactured in the country where it is selling. When a power source is limited or doesn't exist, as in crisis management of disasters, or in remote areas, a hand crank will be added to run the cart.

The Team:

Nan Harris, 30 years in the Entertainment Industry as a director, developer and producer; as a facilitator Nan developed the Waste Wise Workshop for corporations. She is joined by partnering organization Prospective Technology; Kevin McGill, Environmental Lawyer and George Evans, Policy Consultant for the DOD. John McCarren COO, Jerry Lynch International Water Expert..WaterStop is represented by Stella Lellos of Moses and Singer in NYC. 

                     There is no doubt that our innovation will be knocked off!

                                We want to stay ahead of this eventuality.

We would greatly appreciate it if you would pass this site address onto any like-minded people you may have on your email list; but please, not anyone working in the bottled water industry. They’re not going to be happy with WaterStop Carts! :)

Our intent is to avoid traditional publicity until the company is ready to enter the marketplace. This means we have a number of exclusive contracts in place with organizations like the DOD, School Districts and Sustainable Organizations like the Green Sports Alliance, Green Lodging, and The National Parks Service: Green Parks Plan etc.

Thank you for your contribution to our efforts and becoming a member of our family, I look forward to sending you updates soon!

Nan Harris

Founder and CEO (IA)

nharris@waterstopcarts.com

story:
Birthing at home is no longer normal. I'm attempting to bring the lens back into focus on the pure light that is birth, the natural and loving way. 

I want to honor my body and my baby for the immense power that each possess. I have been living the lifestyle of an environmentally friendly and conscious person for some time now. Vegetarian by choice at the enlightened age of five and aware and intune with the non physical realm through meditation and observance of nature in it's pure state at a young age. I'm now 27 years of age healthy and happy. This is my first love child. My vision is to not only birth at home but to also support moms to be and provide education in their upcoming decisions about birth and the way they want to bring their babies into this world. You're not only supporting me and my baby, but paving the way for mothers and children all over the world who wish to normalize the process of pregnancy, birth and childcare. Spread the love, light and knowledge regarding educated choices in childcare from pre-conception and into adulthood. Raise our consciousness and our strength as enlightened and powerful beings    

When we reach our goal: I will be allocating funding for my midwives and doulas along with organic prenatal vitamins, foods and supplements to support a healthy, natural pregnancy. No drugs will be used and the money will be given directly to my care providers for their services rendered. A doula will help me to create my birth-plan and assist me with any lactation issues that may arise after birth and during labor will massage and provide me with constant touch to release the natural oxytocin our bodies produce when stimulated. My midwives will provide me with prenatal and postpartum care and patiently monitor my progress externally in a non-invasive manner as I labor naturally for an undetermined length of time. When the baby has decided it's time to arrive she will supervise the birth of the head and body while my partner catches the baby and reveals to me the sex of our baby. I will then encapsulate my placenta for use to combat baby blues and to aid in my natural recovery from birthing. We will use belly binding and warming techniques to encourage natural contraction and healing of the uterus provided by a separate doula. If we cannot meet our goal: I will use whatever we have raised towards the midwives fees for services. I will not be able to use the assistance of doulas in healing and aiding in the natural process of labor and recovery. I will still be birthing at home.

$450 non refundable deposit for midwife 

$1500 due to midwife by 28 weeks complete 

$2250 due to midwife by 36 weeks 

$500 birth doula includes 2 prenatals, birth and 2 postnatal visits along with lactation consult and birth planning

$100 placenta encapsulation 

$175 per month for prenatal vitamins, DHA and iron supplement

$450 back up obstetrics visit

$200 lab fees 

$250 birth pool 

$35 birth kit 

$170 prenatal yoga 

$225 Birthfit exercise program 

$220 childbirth classes 

$200 belly binding and warming

$100 perks 

$0 normalize natural childbirth 

I will document my journey regardless in all ways possible, including: journaling, creating a social media page, video imaging as well as still photographs, birth art and possibly a following project that really captures this natural process step by step. Feel free to follow along as we take this magical ride together through pregnancy, birth and beyond.

 

Please share this page and any information you gain with your friends, family and the entire world. Let's surround ourselves with light and love and support one another. Birth is natural. We are beautiful.

-Sophia Powell

$200 belly binding and warming
$100 perks 
$0 normalize natural childbirth 
I will document my journey regardless in all ways possible, including: journaling, creating a social media page, video imaging as well as still photographs, birth art and possibly a following project that really captures this natural process step by step. Feel free to follow along as we take this magical ride together through pregnancy, birth and beyond.
 
Please share this page and any information you gain with your friends, family and the entire world. Let's surround ourselves with light and love and support one another. Birth is natural. We are beautiful.
-Sophia Powell

story:
My mom was diagnosed with thyroid cancer in August, and since that very moment we have been on a mission to find the very best treatment possible. We have decided that the best approach is a holistic one, and have embarked on a vast journey of research and synthesization in order to find all the pieces of the puzzle.

What we discovered has been both encouraging and unsettling. In order to really and truly tackle cancer -- in order to really get to the core of the problem and eliminate all possible contributing and detrimental factors -- we need more money than we have! 

We have set the goal of this campaign at a tentative $7,000 -- but the reality is that we need much more help than this! Through our research, and through a cautious and conservative estimate, we have calculated the minimum amount we need to be at about $50,000! Any cent you can contribute will be received with much gratitude and immense love!

What We Know For Sure

The first and foremost thing we need help funding is the removal of my mom's mercury tooth fillings, to avoid and alleviate mercury poisoning. She has had these for the majority of her life -- for 20 years, at least. The removal and replacement of mercury fillings is essential to any individual, but especially to those battling cancer. This procedure alone will cost about $20,000. The search for the right dentist -- who uses all the right, and safe, methods -- will be a part of this challenge.  

She also has problematic root canals, which are contributing to inflammation; these need to be fixed and improved -- as well other dental procedures that will arise while the mercury fillings are being replaced. 

The next thing we need to fund are blood tests. The types of tests which are suggested -- in order to really see what one's body needs, on an individual level -- are only done in private clinics and cost about $500 each, or more; We have marked out at least three specific tests which she requires -- as per the recommendation of experts in the field.

A holistic treatment approach requires a consultation with and treatment by a medical professional. This is not presently covered by insurance (which we have very little of!), so we are budgeting travel expenses to one or two chosen locations (in the U.S. or abroad). With conservative estimates, this can cost us $1,000-$2,000.

Another large cost we are incurring is the switch to completely organic produce, as well as high-quality supplements. Although we have been eating organic produce regularly for the past year or so, the switch to being 100% committed to this lifestyle, as well as the added weight of purchasing supplements (such as B12, B17, Micro-algae, Chaga and Reishi mushrooms, amongst several others) is contributing to us incurring a high cost.

Our next challenge is to test her living space for EMFs, and consequently clear these our from her environment. One outlet filter can cost about $150, and she will require more than one -- alongside the actual inspection.

We will need to install a shower filter for her, in order to completely eliminate chlorine from entering her body.

We already gather all of our drinking and cooking water at a local spring -- so that is well taken care of!

My mom will also need to replace all her cookware, getting rid of everything that is non-stick. Although she has already begun this process slowly over the past year, we now need to truly get rid of anything that can contribute any chemicals into her food. We ask you to help us here because we will only be purchasing one or two items in each category of cookware -- but the costs are  higher than we anticipated at this time in our lives!

We will also need to purchase items that will replace anything chemical in the household in terms of cleaning or personal care products. This includes everything from body lotion to floor cleaner. Although we make our own homemade versions of several things, and are already well on this path, the complete and utter elimination of anything but will be a larger challenge.

The holistic process also places great emphasis on the spiritual side of one's life. For this reason, we already have, and will travel to renowned spiritual healers wherever and whenever possible, as well as undergo much needed internal work, ourselves.

What We Will Give Back to You

In the past year or so, I (Anna) have been on a journey to teach people in my community about the chemical-free lifestyle. At the time, I had no idea that this journey would become so personal. As a part of this mission with my mom, I have vowed to spend even more time devoted to researching and synthesizing the necessary information for her recovery -- and for others living with, and treating, cancer. As part of this fundraising campaign, I ask you to help me devote my time to this -- I have quit my job -- so that I can bring all this information to the forefront that much quicker.

In exchange for your love and blessings, you will see me bring all this information to YOU, as well! A website will be maintained with all the information that we synthesize, and workshops and classes will also be held to help people bring this information into their own life! I want to use this opportunity to help not only my mom, but everyone else who has ever been touched by cancer -- and prevent many others from walking this path! Please share this page if this feels right to you, and help us spread the message of love. Our bodies are capable of even more healing than we have been lead to believe!

story:
This work invites readers on a journey through realms of history and philosophy - as well as salient theories of Ayurveda and Chinese medicine - that are relevant to yoga and its therapeutic gifts. 

Moreso, its a book about different worldviews, embedded in health practices and paths of personal development. A gesture pointing to the wisdom underlying many traditional healing systems. 

Beyond the limits of knowing is the source of healing - the root of our being. On this journey, self-care remedies and holistic and therapeutic principles will be highlighted. Diet, herbs, massage and yoga  will be discussed as they pertain to various life cycles, seasonal regimens and health concerns - including perinatal care and men's and women's health.

The book will serve as foundation for yoga educators, CAM students/providers, as well as the educated public. It is intended as the first volume in a series exploring the essential points of traditional healing and yoga. The focus of this work is on foundational theory, with successive volumes detailing pathology (patterns of imbalance) and therapeutic interventions. My goal is to create a valuable resource, a guide to accessing some of the available traditional sources and a pithy reference work, peppered with hints and examples of self-care strategies.

I'm driven by the prospect of creating a fun and engaging, yet informative guidebook. I want people to be both allured and educated, and also to have a resource for educators to teach from.

The monetary goal is meant to provide means for writing, research, editing and design.

After a deliberate decision to leave writing (publishing) aside for ten years, I was left open to study and practice traditional healing. Involved in research and curriculum development, I've had more time to reflect upon and engage this dialogue. I'm prepared to devote the time to author a more lengthy work, with an editorial focus of making it accessible and reader-friendly.

The greatest challenge I believe will be neither editorial nor related to design, but rather in allocating time. Several friends and individuals have suggested I initiate this project, but with a busy clinical practice and family life, setting aside time presents as the main obstacle. With the support of the community through this platform, I'll be able to see it through to publishing.

story:
NOTE REGARDING DELIVERY DATES!
We set the deliver by date to July to make sure we don't over promise and under deliver. This is a worst case scenario and you should receive your gripster much sooner than that. We should get orders shipped by the end of June 2013.

We created The Gripster so you have more ways to train!

After seeing the various ways that rock climbers train to get stronger we decided that there was room for development, so we created The Gripster.

The Gripster has been in development now for over two years. We have created many different versions and done a lot research and testing. Many knowledgeable and experienced climbers have provided feedback about our shapes and we have adjusted them accordingly. Now that we have some great shapes locked down we are ready to share them with all the climbers out there who are psyched to find new ways to train.

  • The Gripster was designed by Mike White who currently resides in Berkeley CA.
  • The Gripster started out as a passion project, but after much encouragement from various climbers who loved it, we decided to share it with the climbing community at large.
  • The contributions from this campaign will go towards our first production scale order, without this capital we would never be able to share The Gripster at a reasonable price.

We are really excited to be here on IndieGoGo and any contribution you can provide to get this project off the ground will be deeply appreciated.

We Need capital for our first order, you get The Gripster

The fabrication of equipment like this is extremely time consuming and labour intensive:

  • We need to create many silicon molds to be able to deliver a quality product in sufficient time and quantities.
  • Each mold is made from a master shape that has been CNC Routed and hand finished.
  • If we don't reach our desired goal we will still be able to fulfil the orders we do get.

A Project of Passion

Mike White started developing The Gripster over two years ago. He has spent a lot of his free time on this project and poured a large amount of his own personal savings into its development. If we can get The Gripster off the ground with this IndieGoGo project it will make all his hard work worthwhile, and he will also be really really happy!

  • The Grispster is a great training tool and there are endless possibilities and variations of how it can be used for training.
  • The Gripster is suitable to training at home, in the gym or while traveling.
  • A home spun maker project, The Gripster was developed at TechShop SF using CNC Routers, Laser cutters and many of the wood shop tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you're not able to contribute at the moment, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • If you know any climbers then share our project with them on Facebook or Twitter, Its easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Gripster, The Chunkster and The Globester come in five colors. Please note, due to variations in different batches of resin, temperature and humidity levels its not always possible to get an exact color match on each product. Keep in mind that each of our products are hand made. We will always do everything we can to get the colors right but please be aware that due to these variables some batches may come out with variations in tone.

Check out the T-Shirts currently availible on thegripster.com

Got Grip T-Shirt

No Beta Symbol
T-Shirt

Get a Grip T-Shirt

Thanks for checking out our campaign and thank you for your contributions!

story:
Our Story

In our world today, there are a lot of challenges that even the strongest of girls faces - threats to her health, her economic security, her family and community, her confidence, and the long-term sustainability of her home, planet earth.  These threats are created by adult-driven institutions and systems, so how is a girl supposed to stake her claim to a just, sustinable, prosperous future? 

Full Circles Foundation is one answer.  Full Circles Foundation is a long-term, holistic, entrepreneurial empowerment track in the Southeastern U.S. that grows “strong girls, a fair economy, and a healthy earth.”  We ally with families to offer a community-powered continuum of programs to girls facing structural obstacles to realizing their full potential.  This continuum fosters participants' personal wellness, community efficacy, and understanding of and appreciation for the interdependence of life (ecological literacy).     

In the summer of 2011 a team of six people initiated the first phase of the FCF vision.  They dreamt of an organization - a community, really - dedicated to building integrated, scalable, long-term solutions to gender, economic, and ecological crisis by focusing on one of the most powerful sources of energy the world has:  girls.  The vision began with the pilot Full Circles Foundation program, Strong Camp, in Raleigh, North Carolina.  Strong Camp, a six-week summer program, illuminated the connections between personal, community, and environmental health for 25 girls ages 5 through 17. 

The pilot was made possible by the enthusiastic investment of fiscal sponsor Grand Aspirations, a social enterprise incubator that supports, connects, and empowers young people who are creating innovative, self-sustaining initiatives at the intersection of climate and energy solutions, economic security, and social justice (www.grandaspirations.org).  

Our Opportunity

This year, FCF Raleigh has returned with the second Strong Camp (and we have a new sister program in Lexington, Kentucky!).  We have an amazing team of instrcutor-fellows (whom you can meet here) who are working hard to provide another summer full of empowerment for 40 girls, some returning and some new!

Strong Camp is comprised of three two-week units:  Strong Self, Strong Neighbor, and Strong Home.  

Strong Self focuses on the most important relationship of all: the relationship that a girl has with herself.  In this unit, we foster personal wellness in physical, emotional, cognitive and social forms. 

Strong Neighbor emphasizes the importance of a girl's healthy relationship to her neighbors, from those who share her home to those who live on the other side of the world.  In this unit, we foster efficacy; that is, the sense of having a stake in one’s community and the confidence and tools to impact it positively. 

Strong Home focuses on a girl's relationship with her home, from her backyard or local park to the earth at large, which we all share.  In this unit, we foster an appreciation and understanding of the interdependence of life, both as a physical reality and as a framework for living. 

Strong Camp meets a practical, immediate need of low-income Raleigh families by providing enriching, sliding-scale summer programming.  Just as important, FCF builds long-term, transformative relationships with participants and their families around the mission of "strong girls, a fair economy, and a healthy earth."  These relationsihps will be the foundation for launching future FCF programs.  

The Impact

By contributing today, you will enable Full Circles Foundation to...

  1. Provide Hands-On, Entrepreneurial Opportunities for Young Changemakers: FCF Instructor-Fellows are the backbone of Strong Camp.  Instructor-Fellows are passionate, dedicated, intelligent young people who want to make the world a better place.  Full Circles Foundation provides a meaningful, collaborative summer experience that includes opportunities for both training in and implementation of social entrepreneurial, community organizing, and media skills.  Your investment will help Full Circles Foundation provide essential need-based stipends to our 2012 Instructor-Fellows.
  2. Provide Six-Weeks of Entrepreneurial Summer Programming for 35 Girls Facing Strutural Obstacles:  Your investment will also help Full Circles Foundation cover materials expenses - like the up-front materials costs for our microventures!  Each unit of Strong Camp features a "microventure" - a project in which participants' learn how to make and sell a product.  FCF participants have made hand screen-printed t-shirts, hula-hoops, all-natural body products, hand-distressed jean shorts, and flower bombs!  By helping FCF cover up-front materials costs, you enable us to generate income for Strong Camp in a way that also advances our mission!      
  3. Strengthen Our Innovative Model:  Full Circles Foundation is only in Phase 1 of our vision.  Later Phases include an apprentice program and student owned and operated cooperatives.  Developing and launching these Phases will be key to FCF's long-term viability.  Your investment will provide capacity for us to continue the research and partnership-building necessary to launch these latter Phases.    
  4. Replicate:  In 2012, a second FCF pilot was launched in Lexington, Kentucky.  FCF has been approached this year by even more Southeastern communities excited about the FCF model and interested in replication of Phase 1.  With a vision as ambitious as ours, the process is as important as the goal.  In order to grow responsibly, FCF needs capacity to support new communities replicating our model.  Your investment will help us do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our grassroots fundraising effort is powered by YOU, and here are other ways you can help aside from donating:

  • Facebook: Use the power of social networking to help us spread the word about Full Circles Foundation. Post the link to this page on your wall and on your status, and post it on friends’ walls, too!
  • Twitter: Tweet the link to this site!
  • Join Our Mailing List: Stay up to date with FCF goings-on!
  • Volunteer:  There are still opportunities to get involved on-the-ground with the 2012 Raleigh Strong Camp.  Fill out the volunteer application on our website to get started!
  • Email:  Hit up your contact list with an email about Full Circles Foundation and why you chose to donate. Make sure to include the link to this page, and let your contacts know to forward it along to their networks as well.
  • Word of Mouth: One of the most powerful drivers of social action is through face-to-face dialogue. Start a conversation with your friends, family, and co-workers about what we’re up to at Full Circles Foundation! Then, you can direct them to this website, and they can pass with word on to others.
  • Call: If you can’t talk to your friends and family in person, give them a ring: they’d love to hear from you, and while you’re catching up you can let them know about FCF and how to support us.
